description:
Always consistent, North Beach delivered again .... great window seat, fun neighbors at the nearby tables, excellent service by Luca, and fine food.  


We shared the Prosciutto with Melon, the Tagliatelle with Mushrooms, and the Veal Scallopini. Their home cured ham is outstanding. The pasta dish was a perfect size to share, with delicious mushrooms. And finally, the veal was tender, a beautiful pinkish white, thin and perfectly cooked.

Corkage is $30 ... I forgot to look at the wine list since we brought our own in. Had fun with Marilyn at the bar. She made a great espresso.
author: Scott W.

description:
The food is okay. Not a place I would go out of my way for. I ordered the spaghetti carbonara and lamb chops.

Carbonara: the noodle itself was cooked really well. However, there was too much sauce, and either garlic or onions. The flavor was over powering.

Lamb Chops: the lamb was very dry. Flavor was good just dry. The sides were also a little undercooked. Especially the carrots. In this dish there was way too much garlic.

Seating was fast which was nice.
author: Napa T.

description:
What can I say? Well, apparently more than the staff as they predominantly do not speak English.

I'll start & finish with the ice cold calamari - no one ordered sushi but, we'll give it a whirl. Whirl complete- calamari was terrible. 

But fret not my friends -- there is a light at the end of this shit-filled tunnel that Trip Advisor has led you on with their mis-advised notion that this is the best Italian food in SF -- you can walk exactly 1/2 a block down the street to Original Joes for the good shit you were so desperately searching for but unable to find at North Beach Restaurant. 

thank me later.
author: Whitney C.

description:
What a lovely place. Stumbled here for dinner with friends. Prices ok for a pretty touristy area. I had veal which was delicious. Escargot and the garlic butter sauce was to die for. Offer a full bar so can make you any cocktail you want. Restrooms unisex - very clean. 
Service great. Decor is nice.
author: Madison S.

description: Our favorite.  The soups are wonderful and authentic.  Service is stylish yet attentive.  The food is good yet memorable.  The fellow cliental are affluent yet fun.
author: JoeJet J.

description:
3.5 stars

I have not been to North Beach Restaurant since the 80s...so when a couple asked us to join them we agreed.

Founded by Lorenzo Petroni, rip, North Beach restaurant used to be frequented by the likes of Herb Caen, Willie Brown, Michael Savage, and many others. People either loved Lorenzo or thought he was an A-hole....I personally got along with him. He was the epitome of the American Dream starting as a dishwasher and working his way up to opening a beautiful restaurant.

While the service and setting are still top notch the food is, in my opinion, pretty mediocre and over salted.

We started the experience off with the Antipasto Toscano for Two - Home-Cured Prosciutto, Salame, Cheese, Marinated Calamari, Veal Shank, Beans and Salsa Verde....and I must say I did not care for a single dish. Calamari was fishy and chewy. Veal tasted like a canned piece of meat...and grey...

The Carpaccio & Home-Cured Prosciutto combination was pretty forgettable. Meat was not flavorful and the cheese was meh.

Pasta dishes are worth ordering. We enjoyed the Tagliatelle Pescatora loaded with plenty of shell fish.

My Osso Bucco was really really salty. The meat was tender and flavorful however.

The two veal dishes our friends ordered looked pretty forgettable for the price charged.

The one place where North Beach shines is their Italian Wine selection. It is amazing  and you can find a great wine for $50-60 or $150

If you come here order a salad and a nice bowl of pasta and a great Tuscan wine...you'll leave happy.
author: David G.

description: Very good authentic Italian food. Prosciutto was amazing. Lasagna was delicious. Very friendly staff.
author: Robert P.

description:
Went to north beach restaurant last night.  This place was our go to 20 years ago and I'm happy to report the food and service are as good as ever! 

The salmon, halibut, pasta, and cannolis are incredible! I was with 20 people in the meat locker room with the hanging aged procuittio  and it felt like we were in the movie Good Fellas. The best part of the meal was our waiter - he has worked there 20 years, knew the menu cold and had so much passion for the restaurant.  We learned about the owner who was a bus boy and he partnered with the dishwasher years ago to start this place.  The owner went on to become a multimillionaire from Real estate investments in the city.  For a big party I'm not sure there is a better place to go! 

Our waiter should train other servers how to treat customers - perfection.
author: Erin B.

description: One of the best restaurant experiences I've ever had in San Francisco.  From the moment we walked in we were immediately taken care of.  A private tour of the prosciutto room, etc.  A perfect place to celebrate special occasions.  The food is great but that's only a part of the overall experience.  Can't recommend highly enough.
author: Geoff G.

description: Everything about this restaurant is perfect and worth going out of your way for.  Service is top notch, experience is still light and fun.  Every dish was excellent and served just the way it was asked for.  Halibut, cooked to perfection,  chicken livers (the BEST), bread and butter (sourdough and focaccia super fresh),  chicken Toscano (wonderful like you would make at home if you just had the time and maybe an Italian grandmother?), calamari appetizer and caprese salad were also shared and enjoyed by all.  Coffee, desserts (tiramisu, spumoni, biscotti), were excellent, but you MUST try the affogato (gelato, espresso and scotch) which was amazing down to the last spoonful.  Don't miss North Beach Restaurant, whether you are visiting San Francisco or a long time native.
author: Catherine A.

description: Wow! What a wonderful find on a short trip to the city! This is authentic Italian with all the charm and ambiance of Italy! Homemade pasta! Generous portions and so very tasty! They make a green salad taste gourmet! Wonderful staff! Excellent Wine! This is your A list Italian restaurant!
author: Catherine S.

description:
My family and I were looking for an authentic place to eat in little Italy, this place was mediocre. It was a little more glitz, glam, class, and expensive than some of the other restaurants. The interior was decorated for Christmas and was sheik. 

We ate at lunchtime and were seated right away. The server was super nice and attentive, and the service was fast.

My cousin ordered pasta, I had eggplant parmigiana, and my mom ordered a soup and salad. They give you bread to snack in while you wait, which was assorted and fresh. My eggplant was great, my moms soup came out too early, so when we got our food, she was eating cold soup. 

Overall, this place was average, nothing spectacular or superb, we could have found the same for a different price.
author: Rochelle E.

description:
Serendipity strikes! A different place was not open for lunch and we happened to walk in.  (yea!)
Professional and attentive service, refined atmosphere, delicious food.  I hesitated ordering the Prosciutto with Melon, thinking I might not go for it - wrong!  It is killer, and will order again next time. Also had the Polenta which was unique, but elegant and delicious.  All of the party enjoyed the entrees as well.  Super wine list too.
author: David K.

description:
Hands down best pasta I have ever had. The Pasta Della Casa is amazing. I had the pasta along with the mini lobster tails and it was simply an amazing meal. The service was great, prices were steep but that is what you have to pay to have a great meal in this area. 
North Beach restaurant is a definite 5 stars and a must visit. 
This picture is half the pasta and half the lobster tails. Wonderful
author: Jackson M.

description:
Well let's just say I wish their food was as good as their Martinis!

We sat down and after the drinks arrived everything was mediocre at best after that 

Butter was as hard as rock 
Bread was definitely not fresh or even hot

Chicken dish was over cooked 
Veal was pretty good but nothing special for the price it should have been great 

Pasta dishes were average but lacked any flair or originality 

This is a bit disturbing as the prices here are high and you would expect much more from a place like this.

The only reason this is not a one star review is the service was excellent!

I really thought this would be a lot better as it is in North Beach but IMHO I would find other options if this neighborhood
author: James S.

description: Overrated. We were seated 20 minutes after our reservation. We waited another 20 minutes to place our order. The food was "auctioned" when it was delivered. We had to ask for grated Parmesan cheese. The food was pretty good. However, we won't go back.
author: Dan R.

description:
I'm definitely coming back for mussels!!! They were so flavorful. I'm so bummed that I couldn't eat them a lot as I was suffering from nausea after wine tasting. All I could was drinking sprite endlessly.....lol

Anyway...
- mussels : AMAZING! I've got nothing else to say.

- caesar salad half order : just regular caesar salad. Nothing special but good.

- tagliatelle pescatora with tomato sauce : amazing seafood pasta! I was having the worst nausea so I couldn't eat anymore after I had one shrimp...so proud that I didn't puke. Anyway i took this to go and ate it when I felt a bit better and oh my gosh. This pasta was soooo good. Lots of seafood inside and the sauce was perfect. I would love to try this with cream sauce next time. Very fresh. If you love seafood, strongly recommend this! 

- pasta with meatballs : my husband got this and I didn't get to try but he said it was really good!
author: Kim P.

description: Just a basic over priced pasta place. Nothing stands out and honestly Olive Garden taste better. We got the fettuccini Alfredo which is fine. The gnocchi was super soft and the tortellini was okay. The burratta came with two slices of hard tomatoes and tasted bland. Would not go back.
author: T B.

description:
Food was okay, but nothing better than average and a horrible value. It is funny that some of the reviews talk about "freshness" when our bread was stale and salad had definitely been marinating in (way too much) dressing since long before we ordered it. We went w/ a gift certificate and  regretted not using the money we spent on valet parking to cook for ourselves at home. If it were half priced I would consider giving it 3 stars, but nothing more.

Reading the other reviews, it looks like many folks are either nostalgics who have been coming here for decades (perhaps quality used to be better) or tourists. There are definitely better options for Italian in San Francisco (and I presume most cities w/ more than 1 Italian restaurant).
author: Sarah S.

description:
Now I am not Italian and have yet to tour Italy. With that said, North Beach Restaurant is the best Italian food we have ever had, bar none. My husband and I have been going there for 20 years. It is always great, there is rarely a wait (but do get a reservation). We have been for lunch and dinner. It is so good that whenever I have to travel alone to San Francisco, I don't go--it would be cruel.
The portions are large and everything is the best. They have fresh fish and the most wonderful pasta. They have a lobster ravioli from time to time and it is the best.
I usually find Tiramisu boring, not here. Get it. Oh my, it is wonderful and enough to share. 
I love their salads and all there soups (I have had them all).
The service is top notch and it is located in lovely North Beach, the Italian section of town (not that there are a lot of Italians living there anymore). After dinner take a walk and enjoy the cool breeze. Enjoy.
author: Elizabeth L.

description:
One of the classics... an iconic neighborhood classic right in the middle of San Francisco's North Beach authentic Italian area.  

A legit "Cucina Toscana" putting out honest, fresh Italian classics from their wide menu, served by our very skilled waiter Spiro. (in his tuxedo) And the irrepressible Mr. Bui is still there as your charming, accommodating Host.  (he does love the ladies!). Also, Wine Spectator rates the underground wine cellar here in their Top 100!

We started with the Prosciutto & Melon (they cure their own, on site!) followed by our main courses of Eggplant Parmigiana and Spaghetti Carbonara.  Both were excellent renditions, and of course, we had to cap the whole thing off with Spumoni!   Highly recommended if you're in The City.
author: Georg O.

description: Yesterday was my birthday and I had North Beach Restaurant's wonderful food delivered to my house....Delicious....
author: Michelle A.

description:
I'm always happy when out of town friends know places they want to eat at (through recommendations and other friends), rather than asking me if I can "suggest a 'place' that's good to eat at in the city?" Secretly drives me nuts lol. Well, this night was one of those nights where I was thankful for an out of town friend's recommendation to meet here. I've never tried this place, so always up to checking it out! 

At face value, looks like your typical North Beach Italian restaurant - awnings, white table cloths, lots of wine displayed. Our server was more professional than personable but not a turn off at all. It was kind of entertaining. For dinner, here's what I ordered: 

Half Caesar salad for $7.50. First off, I love that they have a half order option. Romaine, croutons and shaved cheese. What made this salad so good was they had FRESH Caesar dressing; I could tell by the taste of anchovies. AMAZING. 

Risotto Pescatora for $30.25. This fisherman's risotta had it all! Clams, mussels, shrimp, scallops, calamari. It was filled with protein and was PERFECTLY cooked, al dente and creamy. ON POINT and HIGHLY RECOMMEND.

Overall, I really liked this meal. Authentic enough for me and super flavorful dishes with simple ingredients. If you're in the area, come check them out!!
author: Rockne H.

description: I finally found a true Italian restaurant with real Italian waiters too. The food here is to die for and makes me feel like I'm back in Italy. I had the risotto con porcini and my cousin had the gnocchi and it all delicious. We also had their homemade prosciutto and it was fresh. Going back there again.
author: Gordana D.

description: The polenta is perfection. The service is masterful. The ambience is so authentic.  We keep going back. The food is always so delicioso !   I wish we took pictures but we were too hungry.
author: Joy S.

description:
How Italian is meant to be. Wandered to the cellar and found their home-cured prosciutto 
The homemade raviolis are my favorite. The most special thing was their Zabbione...made just like my dad made his. Dessert will never be the same.
author: Julie M.

description: This place was ok.  The service was ok.  The food was ok.   Unfortunately it was just ok.   Maybe we caught them on an off night?   Because this place came highly recommended.   We gave up one of our premium meal times for this experience.  Apparently there's a famous  basement with 'hanging meat' that is very quaint, but we didn't get to see any of that.  Guess it's all about who you know???
author: Sabrina M.

description:
Best Tuscan Italian food we've found on the West Coast! Every meal we've had here has been spot on!
Best dishes:
* Burrata - nice firm texture on the outside with a nice gooey center! 
* Mixed Greens with Roquefort - delicious salad with fresh greens mixed with an amazing Roquefort dressing.
* Ossobuco - veal shanks braised with vegetables, white wine, white wine, and broth.
* Tagliatelle con Porcini - Wild Mushrooms

These are just a few of our favorite dishes.
The wait staff is very old school. 
This restaurant reminds me of some of the best Italian Restaurants on the East Coast.

It's definitely a treat to eat here!
P.S. I'd be remiss if I did not urge you to check out their wine list!
author: Jay G.

description: We were sadly disappointed with our recent experience at North Beach. It's been a staple for our family over the years. Something must have changed since our last time here. The ambiance was brighter, the restaurant more empty, and our meals were subpar. We probably won't be back again.
author: Morgan A.

description: Very good sauces for the pasta! Tried the vodka, Bolognese, and carbonara. Caesar salad dressing was wonderful, you could taste the anchovy notes. The interesting thing about this place is they cure their own prosciutto, I believe it is the only place in San Francisco that makes its prosciutto from scratch. There is a really neat underground the room where you can see the meat hanging. Excellent customer service. I will be back.
author: Tangible H.

description:
Atmosphere: 3 stars
Food: 4 stars
Server: 5 stars

Our dinner:
House cured prosciutto 
T-bone veal chop with Sage white sauce and parpadelle
Calamari steak with lemon butter-sauce 
Great wine recommendations and chocolate rum tiramisu for dessert! 
We asked for Alexandre as we've had him before...top notch recommendations, knowledgeable, impeccable friendly 5 star service. Alexandre is an incredible server!!
author: Rebecca C.

description:
Go to Date night spot- cheesecake + wine

The only comment I can make is "WOW." The cheese and crust both, make for a perfect slice.  Not too sweet and does not taste artificial. Will make non-cheesecake lovers rethink this dessert! 15/10
author: Nabiha J.

description:
Used to frequent this restaurant 30 years ago. Dropped in on a Sunday evening and were fortunate to get a table with no reservation. 

Food was good but not great. Caprese salad had rock solid tomatoes despite a specific request on their ripeness. Spouse's salad was swimming in dressing. 

Pasta was good and veal Milanese was okay. Could have been a bit less oily. 

Solid service. Overall good but not worthy of 5 stars.
author: Jeff S.

description: Dinner was amazing!! Our waiter was very accommodating, and our food was superb. I would definitely go back, and have recommended to friends and family.
author: Jenna G.

description: We were introduced to this legit Italian restaurant last night by our close friends. We had the private Cigar room for our large party and received excellent service by Mr. Mateo and crew. The house made prosciutto and melon combo starter were on point. Followed by a Side of vodka penne pasta and my main course the lightly breaded calamari steak, delicious. My partner in crime had the NY  steak paired with a smooth Pinot Noir and closed off with a strong, yet delightful grappa. The desserts our friends had were all loved. Such a great spot to gather with a large group. Gratzi Mateo!
author: ChechiChula M.

description:
The unique nature of North Beach is captured best by the perfectly named North Beach Restaurant. Everything on their huge menu is delicious. Service from tuxedo clad waiters who have been there forever is friendly and knowledgeable. Whatever their fresh fish of the day is, you can be assured it's the freshest anywhere. Veal is outstanding and pasta home made and extraordinary.
For years, Lorenzo Petroni welcomed everyone with a warmth that was so memorable. Since he passed away in 2014, his son Leo runs the restaurant and has learned much from his father. He's gracious and helpful. The North Beach is also a place where you can glimpse celebrities...from movie stars to politicians. It is THE place to experience North Beach.
author: Ronn O.

description:
Everything was excellent and authentic. House made/cured prosciutto, rolled lasagna and Petral Portofino - divine. 

Tiramisu cake layers a bit too saturated with espresso but still good.

Ask for Nino - amazing service.
author: Melody B.

description: Wonderful all the way around, food, service, ambience. Prosciutto, risotto, pasta, sautéed sole, halibut. Wow! (2013 - going back this week, can't wait!)
author: Paul T.

description:
I rarely write a negative review because I try to give a place the benefit of the doubt unless something really crappy happens.   I usually love this restaurant.  I've had several delicious meals here but after my recent experience on Sunday I'll never step foot near it again.  The food was great but the service was the worst.   

My friends and I had reserved a table for the festival.  We were excited to finally get a table here because they are always packed. A member of my group brought outside food (with the full intention of ordering a full meal at the restaurant too) the waiter and management responded rudely and with great hostility.  We apologized and told them there would be no problem meeting the minimum spend per person. But the waiter still yelled at us.

The waiter (Daniel) became increasingly rude from there on out despite our best attempts to lighten the situation.  He slammed plates down, took away our water, and then hardly checked on us. We felt increasingly uncomfortable as the meal went on.  We ended up spending double the minimum per person.  

When the bill arrived we decided due to the rude service and hostility we would not leave him the 20% to which he felt entitled to and left him a smaller tip. He even came around to each credit card holder and demanded his 20%.  When he didn't get his way he started dismantling our table while we were seated.  He practically yanked my chair from under me. 

Fast Forward a few days and we check our credit card bills, he charged each cardholder an extra $20. CHECK YOUR STATEMENTS AFTER GOING HERE! They cannot be trusted. 

Stealing from customers is never acceptable!
author: Kim L.

description: Had a lovely evening at this location.  What everyone noted is the wonderful service offered by the staff. The friends we were with said every time they came to this place service was superior.  Well I agree about that on our visit.
author: Sandy N.

description:
Came here because I read that it was good off a magazine last month.  Think the magazine was a few years old, but I'm new to the city so needed to branch out and see what's available.

Definitely an old school fancy American Italian restaurant when you walk in.  The staff are in suits and are very accommodating to your needs.  Instantly tried to upsell me on expensive wines, but we ended up ordering cheaper bottles.

In all honesty, the food was average.  We had caprese and carpaccio for our entree.  The caprese was just three tomatoes with a hunk of mozzarella.  They weren't very ripe and they came with a side of red onions which I don't think went with it.  The carpaccio was better, but also had way too much red onion on it.

For dinner I had the homemade ravioli and the porcini mushroom tagliatelle.  The ravioli was pretty good, but the past was too undercooked so some of it was hard to break up with a fork.  And the tagliatelle was fine, but nothing I would rave about.

Overall, I had  a good meal with friends but don't think I'd come back here or recommend it.  The service was fantastic, but when comparing the food quality to other restaurants in the city I don't think it compares.
author: Jade R.

description: I love this place! I have been here many times over the years and it never disappoints. The service is always amazing and I love the dress of the servers. Usually I order the same thing at restaurants when I find something I like. But here I branch out every time and I am always amazed!!  I do all the yummy pasta dishes and my husband tries all the seafood. Delicious!!
author: Amanda B.

description: SF has so many amazing restaurants that there is no need to settle for anything less than great. I never ever send my food back but I couldn't eat my pasta because it was so salty. The waiter brought me a new one, with minimal improvement in taste, and explained that maybe it was because the previous noodles had been made earlier and they had been sitting in salt water and that made it too salty! You claim to be a white linen fancy Italian restaurant and you precook your pasta and just let it sit around? I had no words... definitely never going back.
author: Elle W.

description: After seeing "Beach Blanket Babalon" at the Fugazi Theater, we walked 1/2 a block for dinner at the North Beach Restaurant.  The food and service were exceptional. I ordered veal Parmesan with a bolegnaise pasta.  Everything was outstanding.
author: Kenneth C.

description: This restaurant is terrific, great selection of wines, some from their own vineyard. Classic Tuscan cuisine prepared perfectly and the service is wonderful!!
author: George Y.

description:
Pretentious restaurant with extremely high prices.
The food was very bad. I didn't even want to finish my plate.
I left the restaurant feeling bad for spending all that money with such bad food.
I can't imagine why this place is still in business...
author: Bruno S.

description: T-bone Veal was delicious. Calamari steak was amazing. Still very impressed by this place and will probably be back sooner than in a few years next time.
author: Jeff M.

description:
Very disappointed overall.  We wanted authentic Italian food and this was recommended to us by the hotel concierge. I want to mention the parking is  a shady operation.  I had called to make sure they had parking, the guy said yes, $10 valet.  When we showed up, the valet guy told us $20 for SUV and made us pay up front. That seem odd but being out of towners we thought maybe it's the norm in SF. But when we were leaving, I noticed the valet didn't ask the others for the money up front so I went back into the restaurant to tell the host what had happened and also we had to pay double. He said that's an outside service but doesn't sound right and went out to talk to the guy. Whatever- onto the restaurant...

The hosts and waiters are all dressed up there so the entry was very pleasant/classy.  The place is bigger than it looks from the outside,we were seated in the back room. I'm not sure if our waiter was new or just didn't care but he just told us what the specials were, no description what so ever.  Again, thought that's just the norm until I heard the waiter 2 tables away describing the specials to his table, on and on for a few minutes! 
The food was not what we expected from an authentic Italian restaurant- very average if that.  The antipasto salad we ordered was actually kinda gross, slimy, over vinegar'd calamari, some meats, beans and something else.  I highly recommend you don't order that. I had the linguine with clams which was pretty good.  My friend ordered eggplant Parmesan, it wasn't served with any pasta so he was disappointed.  And I can't remember what the the other 2 dinners were but they were fine.  Oh, what waiter at an Italian restaurant doesn't ask if you want any parm cheese- ours.  I had to ask for it- and again I was jealous of the other table who had a waiter serving the the parm cheese and refilling their water cups.  
I can honestly say we'd pick Olive Garden for a fraction of the price over this place.
author: Mary M.

description:
I love this place. Since moving here a year ago I have come here six times, mostly with my family and a couple of times at the bar.

If you like old school service and food this is your place. I have never had bad service - at the bar or a table. For me service is the "entry fee" at any restaurant, without which I can't enjoy the food. My experience last Tuesday was not an exception. Our waiter, Spiro, was attentive and on the spot. He came back multiple times and did not rush us to make our order "all at once". We ordered our starters and drinks and he could tell we were still deciding, so he suggested putting those orders in and that he would come back. 

He suggested a few items but never pushed, and reminded me that I needed a refill on my drink when appropriate :). Just a pro. Nice. Attentive. Not in your face, but there when you wanted him to be. Raj, was the manager that night and he was nice as well. We felt "at home" and you could see so many parties - small and large - and they all seemed happy, just a great atmosphere all around. 

The food. I was a cook at an old school Italian place in my youth, and it is not as easy to find that old-country food as you would think. Pizza yes. Semi-fast food Italian yes. High end Italian yes. But down-home Italian, with mama in back, is nice to find. North Beach is your place. OK, I had Veal Parm. You might say, "Of course! What's not to like - cheese and sauce on top of meat!" But really, it is easy to do it wrong. My wife hd the Veal Osso Buco and it was delicious as well. Fell off the bone. 

The Tiramisu was to live for. Moist, sweet, not to sweet. Perfect.

I recommend this place. Go. Enjoy. Relax.
author: David O.

description: There were fruit flies in the vinegar bottle. I had already eaten most of a peice of the bread before I noticed 3 dead fruit flies in the vinegar I was using. We informed the waiter and he apologized and brought us a new bottle of vinegar (which I did not touch) and that was it. The meal wasn't comped or even discounted. Other then that the service and food was fine but I was a bit disappointed.
author: Kathleen B.

description:
I had one of the best veal chops I've ever had on Sunday night. A Caesar salad like the best. I highly recommend this restaurant. Oh, I forgot the service was impeccable. 
      This is one of the best Italian restaurants in San Francisco. A must. But no Pizza on the menu.
author: Jeff R.

description:
Honestly the best food I've ever had, the staff is amazing and the atmosphere can't be beat if you're looking for Italian food. The wine list is amazing and you won't be disappointed one bit

For my first time in California I couldn't have felt more welcome and will certainly come back. Warren runs an amazing job environment and makes you feel as if you are home.
author: Drew L.

description:
What can I say?  This restaurant in Little Italy/North Beach is as as "Old School" as it gets and I love it! When you walk in you are greeted by the Maitre'd dressed in a business suit and tie and as soon as you are seated the waiter in a black dinner jacket white shirt and black tie brings the menus and promptly asks if you would like anything to drink.  

The food was excellent.  My son ordered the Lamb Special and enjoyed it immensely.  My other son had the Fettuccine Alfredo and said it was great.  My husband had the Clam Linguine and raved about how tasty it was and full of clams.  I had the Pasta Primavera with Chicken and asked for it with olive oil and garlic.  It was delicious!  

The desserts were top notched.  We ordered the tiramisu, the sorbet and the cannoli, needless to say, we ate it all!
author: Cynth H.

description:
I have to say that I was impressed. I was of course aware of this restaurant, just one block away from the SF Italian Athletic Club, where I am a member, but I had never been inside. I don't know why, just never had a chance I guess. A special friend steered me there last Tuesday night, and the place was quite busy for a Tuesday. Good start.

As we walked in, Pietro, the son of the now passed founder, greeted us immediately as he recognized her since she comes often. I immediately detected his accent as true, and switched to Italian. After a warm welcome, his words to Raj, the gentleman who seated us were a humorous: "Raj, be very very careful with these two."  That was nice.

The true measure of an Italian restaurant is their pasta dishes, so both I and my charge ordered pasta. She had the Taglietelle Bolognese, I had the Spaghetti with Vodka. Both were absolutely delicious.

The bread was to die for, with of course the little dish of olive oil. We did not order appetizers.

Service was impeccable.

The only ding, and why not five stars, is that I ordered a bottle of Gattinara 2008 from the wine list, and the waiter showed up with the wine I asked for, but it was a 2010. That's a no-no.

I will go back.
author: Massimo M.

description: We came for a 3:00 lunch before the 5:00 Beach Blanket Babylon. Delicious food! The restaurant filled up as we were there, but there was only 2 other tables when we arrived so we had amazing service! Be sure to get the Triple Chocolate Mousse. Best we ever had!!! The scallops and thePasta Della Casa was great. We had them add extra basil. Enjoy a meal of Old North Beach tradition except no anti pasta salami, olives, Etc on the house. We will come again!
author: Mary M.

description: August trip to San Francisco which we haven't been here in over 10 years we asked the concierge for an Italian restaurant for dinner. North Beach Italian restaurant West recommended. It looks very good on the outside and inside the help is very congenial. My wife ordered a Caesar salad to start which we split and it was very good. My wife ordered linguine and clams but not one fresh clam in there. I ordered linguine Bolognese and it was absolutely flavorless. It was very disappointing after being told how good this restaurant is going to be. But the wine was great but pricey.
author: Joseph V.

description: I love the service and the food here !! I love their seafood pasta.  Such a wonderful experience !!! Especially the waiter Marco made us feel really warm and welcomed. Than you so much !!!
author: Jessy C.

description: Delicious. Ate here two nights on vacation. Was a little hesitant at first but was absolutely delicious and no lines. We got a chicken dish forget the name but was a flattened roast chicken. Delicious.  Highly recommend.
author: Josh B.

description: I came here with friends lastnight for a bday dinner. The place is located in north beach with other Italian businesses. The place was very nice. I would just say that the food was from 20-40 dollars a plate. But when we got our bill it was 2399 dollars. The waiter who was a bald man keeps opening wine drinks with out telling my groups. He didn't even explain to us how many wine bottles are needed or who else wanted to drink a wine. They just keep pouring.
author: Alex C.

description: I've been coming here for about ten years. The food is great and consistent. All entrees are authentic and flavorful. If you are looking for real Italian food this is the place.
author: kihjuana m.

description: The food here was nothing more than average. Came here for a late lunch a friend and I ordered the Tagliatelle al Pesto with Fresh Basil Sauce (requested to make it creamy). I asked the waiter if they could add shrimp, and he said they would charge an additional $8.... eight dollars?! I expected to pay additional for protein, but certainly not eight dollars. The food was overpriced for the taste, I've definitely had better Italian food in North Beach. Save yourself the disappointment and head to a neighboring restaurant instead.
author: Sonia D.

description: Great dinner! Wine and food were amazing! And service was impressive! I would recommend the carbonara for sure! Alexander was the best! We will come back for sure!
author: Fabiani T.

description: Old school Italian. Everything on the menu was fantastic and the whole staff was knowledgeable and friendly
author: John U.

description:
Late evening dinner and the server was not pleased to serve us.  A Portly, unkept balding gentleman was our server.  I think the other negative review here is that guy.  If you get him, you may as well just walk out and forget about eating at this place,  He is not a happy human.  

But that's besides the main point of, "How's the food?"  For the money, never again.  The Pasta was cooked Al Dente, like it should be.  The sauces are where this place is lacking.  My Bolognese, was watery and the meat was overcooked to the point of being powdery.  Way too dry.  The other dishes at the table were:

Cesar Salad:  Nice portion for $15 but way overdressed.  Too much oil made the lettuce very shiny and soggy.  The anchovy taste was there though and that made it palatable.

Squid appetizer:  This was good for the italian style.  cooked just enough to not be raw and very tender with a nice vinegar base.  

Tagliatelle with Porcini:  It was just mediocre.  

None of these dishes had any type of presence and all looked unappetizing.  I think a dish should not only taste good bu also look amazing when plated.  This place does not subscribe to this philosophy.  

I can not recommend this place and you will be disappointed if you decide to eat here, like I was, because besides being not up to snuff it's expensive for what it is.
author: Edward L.

description: Food was fair.  Veal was not tasty at all.  Fettuccine was bland. Food was warm, bread was good, but the butter was so hard you could not spread it.  Some what over priced for the food portions.  1st time here, but won't re-visit again. Although the Cannelloni was of the menu, it was very good!
author: Black V.

description:
We stopped in here for dinner on a Saturday night after a show and without a reservation.  It was like stepping back into old world Italy.  All if the staff were in tuxedos and the Host was able to squeeze us in to a table next to Carlos Santana and his family.  Emil, our waiter, was wonderful and helped my friend find a vegetarian dish to eat that didn't require leaving anything out of a dish.  She had spinach stuffed ravioli in white sauce and I had the most delicious gnocchi.  We split a double chocolate mousse that was to die for delicious.  

The atmosphere was wonderful with lots of local families.   They made us feel at home.  Next time we are in town, we will ve going again.
author: Renee B.

description: This place is delicious. I had the spaghetti with Vodka sauce and it was really good. I also tried some of my girlfriends arabiatta sauce and ot was excellent as well. My only gripe is the wait. We had made an 8pm reservation and weren't seated until about 8:40 and then it took about another 20 minutes to take our order. But the staff was very apologetic and very friendly. Ill go back but not on a Saturday night next time. Its very good.
author: Joe T.

description: Want "old school" Italian deliciousness?  Want "old school" waitstaff?  Want that "old school" North Beach, cozy feeling?  If so, this is the place for you and your friends to meet, eat and drink great Italian wine!   The lamb chop "lollipops" I had were grilled to perfection. My dining partners' ravioli dish was amazing, as was the filet of sole!  Go, go, go and have a great night out!
author: Scott G.

description: Decor, appetizers, dinner, dessert, wine, cappuccino- it's all great but would be nothing without our excellent waiter Nino - he's everything! Made our family celebration something special to remember - effortlessly
author: Tamara M.

description:
Tried this restaurant with family in town for a North Beach experience; we were not disappointed.

First off, the top-rate wait staff and host/GM greet you with a warm welcome, introducing themselves and making you feel special. The service throughout could not have been better - thank you, Mel!

We had them come up with a menu plan for us, which included a delicious, home-cured prosciutto plate, made on the premises - if interested, ask for a little tour of the places downstairs where they hang the prosciutto.

Otherwise, fairly standard Italian fare where you can't go wrong.
author: Ron F.

description: Old school Italian restaurant where the wait staff is seasoned and well trained that results in an impeccable high end dining experience.  Food was delicious. Would definitely return
author: Patricia R.

description: One of the Best Old School Italian restaurant around. Everything from the Appetizers threw the Main meals are all done excellently for many years ! Best Veal dishes all of them delicious, pastas all wonderful. Old school service. Been spending my birthday dinners here for over 45 years. My favorite place to dine
author: Heather F.

description:
We have been wandering around little Italy to find a decent place to have dinner and ended up choosing to eat here. 

Service: top notch. No waiting, full of tables available, server was a bit pushy but very knowledgable and more of butler quality, not your typical server. 

Ambience: very nice setting, good quality flatware, quiet and high class feeling.

Food: tasted good though veal was a bit too salty. We had:

1. Antipasti: we had two, calamari- it was truly well made, loved it. Server kept going on about how great the 'cured prosciutto and melon' was and we tried that. It was indeed good. Based on the two items we got, they do an excellent job. 

2. Entree: 
Sea scallops: okay it was the best I had in a very very long time. They know what they're doing!
Veal chop: it was a bit salty to my taste, but tasted great. 

3. Dolci: 
Will I skip tiramisu? No way. And boy was it good. I've tried tiramisu pretty much every place that offers it. This place, they do a better job than most places I've been to. I'll put it at top 5%.

I'd highly recommend this place. It's quite expensive compared to most places and it is worth it. 

The reason I don't give perfect 5 is because the server was professional and knowledgable but completely ignored my questions and only talked with my friend, I felt as though I'm being ignored because I'm not a man. I don't like being treated like this. But the food itself was good to earn the restaurant a 4 stars from me.
author: Bella J.

description:
Food and location aren't bad.  However it is the service that deserved the one star rating.  Waiter was rude and tactless.  One of our friends brought outside food, which understandably made the waiter and owner upset.  

Instead of the waiter telling him It wasn't ok, he started yelling and the owner kept insisting we meet the the table minimum.  We apologized and and said we would spend extra money to make up for our friend's actions.  Our table actually doubled the table minimum.  However throughout the whole dinner service the waiter continued to be angry and unprofessional.

Thus we decided to leave a smaller tip.  The waiter felt entitled to the full 20% tip, so he charged our credit cards with the extra amount. Every person in our party was charged an extra $20.  CHECK YOUR STATEMENTS EVERY TIME YOU LEAVE THIS RESTAURANT

Also the waiter was obviously mad due to the poor tip so he came up to every individual asking for more.  When we refused and explained to him it was due to service, he pretty much made us get up while he packed up our the outside table and chairs.
author: Hannah T.

description:
This is one of the best Italian restaurants I've eaten in.
The service was very professional and the ambiance was definitely present.

All entrees and pastas were cooked to perfection. The appetizer plate had a huge sample of everything.
author: Fred C.

description:
Our party of 10 dined at North Beach Restaurant this past Saturday evening.
The service was top notch, and since we were celebrating our girlfriend's upcoming wedding, our server went out of his way to ensure we all had a great time.

A few of us ordered the pasta carbonara, which is listed as the house specialty, and it was quite good.  To be honest, I've had better at other places, but this was pretty good.  It did its job by filling me up as we had a night of frivolities ahead of us.
The one downer is that my plate looked like it was rubbed down with oil when I was about done......  my dish was quite shiny from it, haha.  The other ladies in our group chimed in about how much they also liked their dish.  I didn't hear a complaint from anyone.

If you're looking for a place that provides excellent service, has an extensive wine list, and can accommodate a large group, then you won't be disappointed.  However, if you're a huge foodie in search of the next Michelin star restaurant, you should skip this place.
author: Marie W.

description:
What an experience! The meal and service we had at North Beach Restaurant deserves a glowing review! We started with the delicious house cured prosciutto and burrata cheese and the calamari steak with lemon sauce, a winning antipasto combination. My incredible pan seared T-Bone Veal
Chop in a white wine sage reduction with a side of house made pappardelle, (my favorite!) was TO-DIE-FOR. Highly recommend. 
My wife loved her Spicy Alfredo Baby Shrimp Pasta-I tried it and it was amazing-just the right amount of heat!
The chocolate rum tiramisu came highly recommended from our server, Alexandre, and it didn't disappoint. He also recommended the 2014 Chianti Reserva which fit our pocketbook and our taste! 
A big, big thank you to Alexandre, for a charming, yet very professional experience, quite witty, too! If only every dining experience could be so pleasant. 
Looking forward to dining at North Beach restaurant again!
author: Christopher C.

description:
Superb ambiance and great food.
The average Joe may only see the price sticker on the menu; I was very skeptical too.
After a decade without the pleasure to eat real Italian food, I can say this place is the one.
Why? Even if you do not like this type of cuisine, try the Tiramisu--the best one I have eaten (well the second best after my sister's).
author: G C.

description: Had two grand experiences at North Beach a long, long time ago. Wanted to return for old time's sake. Probably not the best Italian food in the city, but certainly not bad. We both had the caesar salad -- good. My friend enjoyed her meal, but what the heck was it? My spaghetti carbonara was very good. Excellent bottle of wine at a reasonable price. Attentive service. Quiet atmosphere. Will I live long enough to return in another 30 years?
author: Dave M.

description: My party of three had a delightful waiter and as we were asking him about a $10-15 appetizer, he suggested we get the burrata and proscutto for 3.  The food was good, gnocchi was a little grainy and firm, but overall pretty decent.  However When we got the bill, that appetizer was over $50.  We asked why it was so much, literally each of us got one slice of tomato with burrata on top with two slices of prosciutto on the side.  He stood firm and so we paid it but will never come back.  Customer service is number 1.  This restaurant doesn't understand that.
author: Will H.

description: Very good Italian- caprese and Caesar salads were good. Entrees of lasagna, osso buco and pasta Della casa were all delicious. A little pricey$ 200 before tip  for 4 -included 2 glasses of wine
author: Laura W.

description: All around good restaurant in a great location. Salads, meat, pastas all prepared and presented nicely. Drinks and the service are excellent. Good portions, old school Italian Restaurant. I can recommend this spot for locals or tourists.
author: Dan S.

description:
I had enjoyed dining here many years ago and got a chance to visit again while back in town on business. I couldn't convince anyone to join me so went solo. I was warmly greeted and shown to a nice small table with a view of all the dining room goings on. There are lots of yummy options on the menu but I called an audible and asked for a chicken parm. While waiting for my dish to be prepared, I was offered a large selection of bread along with olive oil on the table. All good stuff and kept me happy.

The chicken parm was served with several sliced roasted potatoes and veggies. I thought pasta was an option but I was told no substitutions. Actually worked out fine in the end as I didn't start slipping into a food coma towards the end of the meal.

The service here is impeccable. My waiter was very attentive and knew the menu and dishes inside and out. I'll be back for sure but hopefully not after such a long gap as this time.
author: Michael K.

description:
I love this place. Old world dining with classic Italian dishes. There are several things that make North Beach outstanding.
1) $10 Valet parking!
2) They don't shut down between lunch and dinner, so if you want to eat a meal at 4pm after seeing the latest Broadway touring show at the Orpheum or Golden Gate Theatre, you're in business without having to kill time for 1-2 hours till those "other" restaurants open at 5 or 5:30pm.
3) Elegant wait staff. It's so pleasant to have old school professional waiters.
4) Food is fantastic. Every meal I've had here has been delicious!
5) Spumoni!! Ok, so that's a personal thing, but what is an Italian meal without Spumoni for dessert?
I probably go here 2-3 times a month and I don't even live in the city! North Beach, I hope you are here FOREVER!!
author: Jeanne C.

description: Service was poor and the food was marginal. This place needs some reinvention for the younger generation.
author: Steve S.

description:
First time there and was completely enchanted by everyone who works there. What a great place!  They make their own prosciutto and serve it with melon, tomato and fresh mozzarella. Spectacular!  Since we couldn't decide on what to eat we ordered a bunch of dishes and tasted a little of everything which I suggest since you know you'll want a bite of your companions food. 

We had eggplant parmigiana, chicken saltimbocca, steak caruso, sword fish cooked in lemon, wine, garlic and parsley.  Everything was amazing!  

Don't pass up the cannoli!  Best you'll ever have!
author: Kari R.

description:
Highly recommend..Ciopinno A, Linguini with Fresh Clams A, Prosciutto and Melon  A+, Zabiaone A..Service A+...

Better vibe before the remodel....
author: Mark S.

description: The food is genuine Italian, very good, and at a reasonable price. Our waiter actually was Italian! What's most remarkable is the art: about a dozen large Joan Miro paintings.
author: David G.

description: Held a dinner for 15 colleagues in the Wine Cellar private room , received 5 star service all night. Matt aka Matteo was a fantastic host, professional and engaging , his team led by KC was outstanding ! My guests had a wonderful authentic San Francisco experience , they have been talking about it the rest of the trip. Food was delicious , restaurant was a hit!
author: Ken D.

description: Been coming here for about 10 years. Basta Pasta before this (same food) for those who know back then! There's a reason we have been coming for so long! You must come and try if you haven't before, we will always make the drive when we want great Italian with fresh  ingredients and great wine. Love it and always will!!
author: Rick K.

description: Excellent food. Great ambiance. Knowledgeable staff and great service. That's what you'll find at North Beach Restaurant.  Enjoy. We'll be back for sure.
author: P N.

description: If I could give them no stars I would! The worst service I have ever experienced. Food was mediocre and service was horrendous.
author: Nanette L.

description: Let me say this...the food was phenomenal! But good food is only half the story. When spending time and money you need to feel like it is well spent on both counts. Let me assure you that Spiro D helped with both. Our time here at North Beach was lovely and anyone looking for delicious and well prepared Italian food will not be disappointed. I am satisfied... thank you!
author: Grace M.

description:
Solid & classy.

If a quiet & grown-up restaurant is what you're after, then this is your spot.

The food can be hit or miss.  But over the years, I've never had a bad meal here.  No celebrity chef, no surprises on the menu.  The focus is on tradition & authenticity.  I find that comforting, & I respect it.  And since the son of the original owner took over, the food has improved.  

The pastas & seafood are strong.  And if you like veal, it's a must order here.  

Uniformed, male-only servers.  In fact, the only female employee, ever, is Marilyn, the bar manager.  Marilyn is professional to an art form.

And Warren, the host w the most, is perhaps the best Maitre D in SF.  He is gifted & doing what he was born to do.

If you come in on a day that both Warren & Marilyn are working, you've hit the jackpot.  

There's a reason that this used to be former Mayor Willie Brown's living room.

4 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: If you happen to be in the Bay Area you've ve just got to go to this place. The waiters were so nice and attentive to us even though I was underdressed. There were three graduation luncheons and folks were dressed to a tee! I walked in wearing a black T shirt and made a beeline for the ladies rest room where I turned my t inside out and fixed my hair (was wind blown). The lunch of Cesar salad and a pasta entre was superb and we ordered the Santa Margherita Pinot Grigio. This place was recommended by a local and I now recommend it to whomever comes to this beck of the woods.
author: B P.

description:
My boyfriend told me that he wanted an "old man cocktail and old school food" for dinner, so we went to North Beach Restaurant.  I had heard good things about this place for years, but had never eaten here before.  This place is definitely old school, the kind of place where the waitstaff has been there for decades (my father worked as a professional waiter when I was a kid, so places like this are really special to me.)  

We started with cocktails - an old-fashioned for him, and a Lorenzini for me (their wonderful house red with sparkling wine - not too sweet, very refreshing) and the burrata appetizer.  Creamy and decadent.

My guy had the scallops, which are some of the best that I have ever tasted, and I had the osso bucco, also some of the best that I have ever tasted.  We were almost too full for dessert, but wanted to try to the Zabaglione, and nearly fell over because it was so good.

It's pricey, but you do get what you pay for here.  We'll be back.
author: Michelle P.

description: I am giving this place one star because I have to. Beware!  The service is terrible. My food was not served the way I ordered it. When I asked for more sauce on my pasta it never came. My partner was done eating before they brought the wrong sauce to the table. The manager never came to find out what was wrong. I was made to pay for a dinner I did not eat let alone enjoy.
author: Roseann C.

description: Great place to go with friends.  The Salmon My Way was on point.  The burrata, prosciutto, salads were great appetizers.  A fun night!
author: Stacey F.

description: Excellent choice for dinner.  This place has a great menu with a very good staff.  The pasta and meats are excellent.   If in San Fransisco I think you have to make this place a must stop!
author: Dennis M.

description: Decent food. Very expensive. Felt rushed to turn the table over.  Not worth the price.
author: Alice D.

description: They served me cold escargot and fish that tasted like something from a school lunch restaurant. But I had a very nice friendly waiter!
author: Jonas P.

description: Excellent - I highly recommend dining here.  We were in s party of eight and the service never missed a beat.   The food was just like in Italy - fantastic.
author: Michael Scott P.

description:
We were recommended this restaurant as authentic Tuscany food, so we hopped onto Open Table and made a reservation for the following night.  The restaurant was not very crowded, and we had to wait a few minutes after we arrived for our table.  We were seated in a cozy nook looking out into the street.  I wish I remembered our waiter's name, because he was very nice and made us feel totally at ease.  He even escorted me across the restaurant when I asked him where the restroom was!  

We never had to wait long for our drinks or our appetizer.  We ordered the special for the appetizer, which consisted of a prosciutto and melon and a caprese with super fresh mozzarella.  We were warned that ordering one of the chicken dishes would take 20 minutes to get, which we were fine with.  It did not even seem that long of the wait and it was delicious!  The skin was seasoned perfectly, and crispy, while the inside was still juicy and flavorful.  Our other dish was a ravioli that was equally as delicious.

I didn't look at the dessert menu, because I really wanted the affogato.  For an affogato to be delicious, you really need a good espresso and this dessert was delicious!  I think I only shared 1 bite before devouring the rest myself.  

The food was delicious, the staff was pleasant and I would definitely come here again.
author: Megan L.

description:
We arrived as a group of 7 for a birthday dinner. The service was brisk yet not what you would accept from a restaurant positioning itself as a high-end destination. The following pointers should help you make a more informed decision:

1. I requested for a whiskey based cocktail. The waiter suggested an Old Fashion. When I asked him if he had a better suggestion, he offered the Manhattan. Not quite the high-end affair I would say.
2. We all ordered their specials - some in chicken and some in pork. I have had better chicken at the local KFC than the Mattone that was served to us. I must have developed some muscles during my meal to cut it into smaller pieces. It was one, tough fighter, straight out of the lowest drawer in the cold storage. Others had similar experiences.
3. With the meal wrapped up, the waiter took our order for the desserts and brought along a cheesecake with a lit candle for the birthday girl. Sweet, right? Not quite. Once she blew the candle, this cheesecake was passed over to me, as this was the dessert I had ordered! I don't know of a single restaurant in the world that doesn't give a complimentary dessert to the birthday person, irrespective of its proportions. Height of being cheap!
4. When the bill arrived, the restaurant had automatically added gratuity to the gross amount. This is the acceptable practice in SF for groups over 6, but with food and service this bad, they could have checked with us first. 

In summary, if the sole memory of a 'high-end' restaurant is their garlic bread (a must have), you're better advised to spend your money elsewhere.
author: Adi M.

description: Everything was A+ and delicious last night! Danny our server gave us great service I loved how even on a busy night we weren't rushed! I had the spaghetti carbonara and he had the veal scaloppini and we were just in food heaven. We'll be back soon! Plus there's valet parking.
author: Geena G.

description: Food was great, drinks were great, service was awful. At $150 per head you're better off at many other restaurants. If you're trying to have an experience, this isn't the place.
author: Dominic T.

description:
This place is awful. The waiter that "helped" us was a slimy French car salesman that tried to upsell everything and downright scam us. He mentioned a few specials, one of them being burrata and their "homemade" prosciutto. Because we just wanted the caprese salad and aren't die hard prosciutto lovers we asked him how much it was. He responded in a very condescending manner that he doesn't know maybe $15-16, maybe $18-20 dollars.  We decided we might as well. 
The burrata was good but the prosciutto was some to the worst I've had.... moving on, no ones fault. 

We also ordered the Cioppino (which is what I was dying for and originally came to eat at either Sotto mare or Cafe Sport but they were both closed on Labor Day). We ordered off the lunch menu at 2pm and the price of the cioppino was $21.50. The waited insisted to split it and brought it out to us in 2 cups I would expect my clam chowder cup to come in. 

Between our 2 cups, we had 2 shrimp, 1 muscle (awful- I had to spit it out), 1 clam and some cod. The sauce was bland and not anything to come back for...... ever! It might have as well just been tomato paste out of a can.

So our bill comes and low and behold, in addition to our 4 wines we were charged separately $15.75 for our burrata and $16 for the prosciutto. I get up to go confront the waiter (especially since this is the exact dish we asked him about)  and then I noticed he charged $34 for cioppino.  I tell him to change the price and take off one of those apps. After a rather unpleasant interaction he comes back with lowered cioppino price and an increased prosciutto price to $17 and a lowered burrata price to $12.

I will never go back... even the free bread they gave was dry and old .
author: Natalie V.

description: Good atmosphere. Came here for my wife's birthday dinner. We both had the lasagna. It was decent. My kids both had the fettuccine alfredo and it was good. Prices were reasonable. Great service!
author: Marcos V.

description: My company had our holiday event and I had search long and hard for a restaurant with a private room near Beach Blanket Babylon (part two of our holiday event) and I finally settled on The North Beach Restaurant. Best decision I made!! From talking to Bui and Nico to set up the arrangements to the greeting at the door to our private room - The Prosciutto Room - a MUST see! - to our FANTASTIC waiters Milanco and Larry to the excellent selection of foods we had - this is the place for an event. The food was delicious and they were so accommodating for our our Gluten free and vegetarians in the group. We had old school Italian menu to choose from (prosciutto/carpaccio, penne, salad, variety of choice for dinner with chicken, veal, fish and vegetarian (I had the Veal Saltimbacco which was DELICIOUS!) and topped off with house made Tiramisu/coffee. The waiters were so great keeping us on time for the show and never intrusive but you never needed for anything. I cannot wait to go back - I had friends there the same night eating upstairs that said the Osso Buco was AMAZING. Need a great spot great food, great service, great location - you must try The North Beach Restaurant!!
author: Cindy D.

description:
The thing you have to understand is that this is not a restaurant; it's an institution. The food is good without being fussy. The service is excellent, yet they still treat you like family. 

Extensive wine list, homemade prosciutto, and Frank Sinatra. What's not to like?
author: Rick S.

description: Had dinner with a large party down in the wine cellar on a Friday night. They were very accommodating and the service was top notch. Food was great, and the portion sizes are good. This place is definitely great if you're looking for an intimate dinner with great service. I had the lasagne- it was good and the sauce was excellent. My aunt had linguine with clams that she said was excellent as well.
author: Chelsea H.

description:
For a restaurant that allows people to wear jeans, sweatshirts, sports jerseys why would you insist on men taking off their caps?  This isn't 1950.  If want to create a certain type of upscale atmosphere then impose a dress code which in itself an outdated concept in contemporary dining.
Foods good if you want saucy rich Italian American fare. But due to the outdated views I won't be returning.
author: robbie l.

description:
Great food & great service in the private Prosciutto Room. 

Prosciutto is made on site and cured 9-12 months. Served over melon

The osso busco was phenom. 

Give it a try. My new North Beach go to spot.
author: Don T.

description: Excellent food. Great service. Very accommodating for variations on the meal. Veal was very tender.
author: Chris C.

description: Nothing more to say than authentic and delicious. We ended up coming here from a list of recommendations from someone living in the area. And the best part is that it's only a couple blocks away from the heart of North Beach. Now let's talk about the food. There's very few places where you can classic Italian food like here. The menu is massive with a huge arsenal of choices for different meats, pastas, salads, and much more. Me and my family had the clams, the gorgonzola gnocchi, the petrel fish with the butter sauce and capers, and the linguini with clam sauce. The taste just melts in your mouth. Not to mention the friendly and attentive service you get in California. People are so nice there. And there's no doubt I would come back to try all the other delicious meals they prepare.
author: Elliot F.

description: Under. Ormandy circumstances I would have given this restaurant a higher score but with good food should cone good service. I notice if you don't drink alcohol waiters tend to treat you with arrogant indifference and that was our experience. The pasta was fine. I ordered the cannelloni and my wife has the seafood risotto. But apparently there were specials which we not advised of and generally ignored yet other tables were treated quite differently. Restaurants are a repeat business and the discourteous behavior of our waiter really left a sour taste in my mouth. There are probably nicer places in Little Italy here in San Francisco. Where service is as grand as the food they prepare.
author: PAUL F.

description: Very good restaurant and excellent service. The salad was very fresh and tasty.  Checken livers were yummy. They also provide valet parking, which make it easier to go there. I would go there again for sure.
author: Dennis N.

description: This place is great! Really good fresh authentic good quality Italian food. Kind of expensive and classy looking that might scare off some, but try it. You will be glad you did. The service is great, lots of old school waiters so helpful. The marinara red sauce is great, the wines are great. Great big selection on the menu. Love this place!
author: Peter K.

description: Food is over rated and expensive. We were a party of 6 4 guys and two girls. Our server would come and serve everyone wine except me. Did not understand why.
author: Pinky P.

description:
Yes I visited as a tourist. We jumped off the bus, it was the first restaurant we saw. I saw the menu posted outside the restaurant; I was starving. Glanced at the menu, saw several items that looked tasty, and said, "I'm starved, let's eat here." Impulsive and I'm so glad. 

It was around 2, so just at the end of their lunch service. I had gnocchi gorgonzola and my BF had veal scaloppine. A basket of several types of bread, all good, was brought out, it was hard to remind myself to save room. I'm glad I did. The gnocchi I had was so light it almost floated right off the plate. The sauce was perfect - but I love strong gorgonzola. My BF's veal was delicious and was well presented with mushrooms, broccolini and rice. Great wine too. Split the mousse for dessert and I'd fly back to SF for that alone. 

Prices were decent - more than we planned to spend for lunch but totally worth how delicious it all was. Service was prompt, attentive. My water glass was never less than half. I got the feeling the server was near the end of his shift and we were his last table, but we were not rushed in any way. 

I liked how there were three distinct dining rooms, it made each one feel more intimate. The decor, however, was butt ugly 80s Monet inspired pastel landscapes. There was white table cloths but the menus were laminated. Obviously the focus there is on good food and not the looks.
author: Anne P.

description: Wow. First night in town and decided to try out some local Italian food in little Italy. Fantastico!! Dark wood, subdued lighting and waiters in tuxes. Fresh mozzarella salad, tagliatelle with pesto, gnocchi and ravioli for our entrees/ everything was SO delicious!!! Certainly won't be our last time here!
author: Diane B.

description:
Service and ambiance are pleasant enough, but this place is the classic example of why I never eat out at Italian restaurants unless its someone else's idea. In this case i was dragged out by family.

The menu is uninspiring, overpriced and obviously hasn't changed in 40 years. Chose a meat. Cover it in lemon butter and capers. Serve with a side of unseasoned zucchini and a few slices of potato that have spent too much time in the oven. $35. This represents  80% of the menu.

I started with some sweetbreads in a sauce best described as Campbell's cream of mushroom soup. I moved on to overcooked lamb in a watery brown sauce that probably came from a can and was supposed to make up for the fact that the meat wasn't seasoned before cooking. This was, of course, served with the same bland zucchini and overcooked potato slices as every other dish. Sister got veal and prawns. It was of course covered in lemon butter and capers and served with the same overcooked potatoes and zucchini. 3 shrimp, sliver of meat. $35.

In short, its every Italian restaurant I've ever been to. Overpriced, underwhelming and served to a Sinatra soundtrack  If i want to eat good Italian, I'll cook it myself.
author: Marc S.

description: I've only been to this restaurant twice, once when I was a teenager and once just a few days ago for my fathers 75th birthday lunch. I thought the food was pretty good, if not a little old fashioned, but my parents loved it, at least in part because it reminded them of when most restaurants were like this. I had the sea scallops, my father had the cioppino, and my mother had the tagliatelle pescatora. Clearly my family is fond of seafood and we were all very impressed with the quality of the seafood, the tagliatelle was freshly made, and even my extremely difficult to please father enjoyed his dish. The portions were massive, I didn't eat for the rest of the day, and the white wine mushroom sauce was a bit rich for my taste but I enjoyed it nevertheless. The food was worth 4 stars but if I could have given it 4.5 stars I would've. The extra half star would've been for the service. Some reviews said the service at this restaurant was less than great, but that wasn't my experience at all. I will admit that we were having lunch, not dinner, and the restaurant wasn't overly busy but the wait staff were very attentive and accommodating and were more than willing to answer any questions we had. TD;LR the food isn't new and trendy, but it's consistently good which is worth a lot
author: Ariel C.

description:
Beyond amazing food and service!
Escargot, clams pasta, tortellini, beer and proseco.  Our waiter was amazing.  We had no reservations and didn't have to wait that long.  Everything was top notch.  One of my faves from now on.

Top notch dining without being snooty or stuffy.
author: Esther B.

description: Excellent service. But we tried some basic dishes and were disappointed. Carbonara was average.  Lasagna was awful:   lasagne noodles, meat, tomato sauce,  then drenched on the plate.   It was remarkably tasteless.
author: Carel V.

description: Bread was brought out cold. Fettuccine Alfredo w/chicken was bland and nothing to brag about. Food was extremely expensive. Waiter was rude and acted burdened by our presence.
author: Zayden B.

description:
Dined here on Valentine's Day. My wife and I had a great time. Very good Italian food with a good selection of wine. I was surprised they didn't offer more Chiantis by the glass but they were all still good. Veal parmigiana was fantastic. My wife got the Tuscan chicken entree which was also top notch. 

The food here is pricy so be prepared. I think it was worth it but others may not. It is San Francisco after all... We'd come back for a special occasion as it offers a unique atmosphere and good food but not just an every day meal.
author: Jeff F.

description:
Favorite Italian restaurant in SF.   Don't let the fact there is a little Asian host who will greet you at the door fool you.   This is top notch old school Italian.  Start with the melon wrapped house aged prosciutto.  It does a great job setting the stage for the amazing Roquefort salad, chicken Marsala, and spaghetti vodka (house specialty).   The Indian Somalia has been there years and will do some nice wine pairings.  Although not a traditional Italian dessert, be sure to order the flan. It's some of the best you'll ever have. 

The only negative is the acoustics.   Most areas are very noisy.   Ask for the quietest location in the restaurant when making the reservation.
author: Eric T.

description: We had a wonderful dinner with the family. We had prosciutto and burrata and the waiter split it up in four plates for each guest. My son ordered the spaghetti in vodka sauce it was good, my husband had the shank and it was good, my daughter had the risotto which she loved and I had the ravioli which was amazing!!! We ordered a bottle of wine and had the best service. We passed on dessert because we always go to Stella's to pacify our sweet tooth. We will definitely go back, as a matter of fact it's become my daughter's favorite restaurant, and she's pretty picky.
author: Tkpasq P.

description:
First time here last night.

Incredible wait staff and food to die for.

A long 2 hour non rushed Italian dinner.

Attentive but unobtrusive service...top notch "Old school."

Simply put ...our evening there was beyond incredible!
author: Nick P.

description: Maitre d' was rude. Told me he needed to turn table over when I had just received my bill. Ruined the dining experience. Had only been there less than 90 minutes.
author: Joe M.

description:
My wife and I went here after reading some of the reviews which seemed good, but now I see why if you dig deeper into the list of customer feedback you'll see more of what is really to be expected if you dine here.

Our waiter, and I didn't get his name because he barely spoke to us before I had the maître d' reseat us in another section, was as rude and condescending to us as we've ever been treated in a restaurant. Take my advice and go to a Pizza Hut instead. You'll likely be treated better there, and the food will have more flavor.

Other reviews also mentioned food coming out too quickly and we had the same experience.  Appetizers literally came out 3 minutes after ordering; so much for 'made fresh' I suppose. Food was luke-warm and flavorless.  Main course was then served as the forks left our mouths from the last bite of the mediocre, 'army-rationesque' appetizers. Obviously, there was a lot left to be desired for this price point.

The maître d' knew that I was already annoyed by our first, rude waiter, and though he was gracious enough, he did nothing in terms of offering a complimentary cup of coffee, dessert, etc. Not saying we expected free food, but a nice gesture or offer to make up for the annoyance forced upon us by waiter number 1 would have been nice.  Nothing of the sort was proffered.

I heard at least three times that they have been in business at that location for almost 50 years. But if our level of service and the quality of the food was an indication of their standards for both, my prediction for the likelihood of another 50, is as my lucky 8 ball says, 'Outlook is not good.' Take my advice, and seek your dinnertime satisfaction at another venue.
author: Richard D.

description: We had the ravioli which is homemade and it was so good! We had them make it spicy. We also had the Pinot noir and it was delicious. They are known for their prosciutto so you must try it. The service is fast and attentive. Nice spot in the city.
author: Gauslin J.

description: Came here to eat lunch with two other people and the food was pretty good I say. I ordered a Pasta Della Casa and it was delish! One ordered eggplant parmesan and I forgot the other order but both were really good. We also order calamari which was good but I wish it was a little more crispy, it was a bit too soft for me haha. Overall, it is just a tid bit overprice but the service is good and fast, and the food was good.
author: Jen Z.

description:
I was a first timer at the restaurant last Friday night.  We had reservations for a table of 8 at 7:00 PM. (Now the restaurant knows EXACTLY who I am if they want to contact me to deliver a REAL apology).

There was just a lot that was "off" and odd" about our experience. For starters we were seated in the basement of the place in the farthest table in the back surrounded by bare white walls with no ambience. I was disappointed because I'd made reservations for my out of town guests and thought that our reserved status would grant us at least a table in a lively room with other diners.The timing of the service was really strange.  It took about 20 minutes to order drinks, then it took ANOTHER 20 minutes for the server to ask about taking our starters order.  Then (and only after we'd FINISHED eating the starters) he asked for our main course selections.  So after walking in the door it was almost an HOUR before we ordered mains. Here's where the dinner got surreal: My wife ordered the Chicken Toscana, a dish that specifically featured olives and artichokes. The server commented that the chicken was served on the bone, but if she wanted it prepared another way (he had an Italian term for it) he'd be happy to prepare it like that. She was delighted at his attentive suggestion and agreed to the "new preparation".

About 30 minutes later our entrees started to arrive. Everyone's dish was on the "cool" side of warm including my veal parmigiana which was acceptable, but nothing exceptional. But HERE's the thing; my wife's chicken was served with NEITHER OLIVES nor ARTICHOKES on the plate! When she alerted the server to this he apologized and about 10 minutes later(!) brought her a side bowl of artichokes, carrots and zucchinis - AGAIN with NO OLIVES. Now it was getting WEIRD. So AGAIN- she asked specifically for OLIVES and he replied that the restaurant was "all out of olives, we're so sorry". ????!!!??!?!?!?!  Imagine our flabberghastery.

We told him that if he'd have stated that info up front she could have ordered a different dish from the get-go and there'd be no problems.  His reply, "I'm so sorry".  Then he turned and left. It started to feel like a "Twilight Zone" episode in there, and by now the rest of the table was visibly uncomfortable with all of this back and forth.  We all hurried to finish and just get OUT of there, when the final insult was hurled:  A MANDATORY 20% gratuity had been added to the check so we were FORCED to pay an extravagance for service that would NOT have garnered this amount in a normal situation.  

I am not embellishing this tale in order to make a "good story".  THIS was our Friday night at "The North Beach Restaurant". They never even offered to "comp" our mangled chicken entree.
author: Lippy L.

description:
Food could be okay. But considering the prices I paid for food, I'd say it's tolerable. Too salty and not fresh. It seemed the food was made out of canned material. If the salty taste is a strategy to make the customers to order drinks, it worked. I ordered a glass of wine because I could barely tolerate the salty taste. Great for you. But I won't visit this place again for good. Never.

The services. It was awful. Even considered that the visit of our group is off the usual dinner time (4pm), their services are awful. Only big guys walked around fast, and they were definitely short in staff. I had wait for a while to order the wine, and when the waiter noticed that he'd ignored me a while, he tapped on my shoulder asked me if I was okay. Ha! 

Awful place I'd never come back! I only came here because Tony's restaurant waiting was 1 hour.
author: Seonghee P.

description: I had the most sublime appetizer in the Buratta. A must have, and the Veal Marsala, and Tiramisu are winners!
author: Blossoms K.

description: The food was nothing special and over priced. The waiter was more interested serving wine to all the tables. I ordered veal with mushrooms and pinenuts my husband chicken Marsala.
