The veal was tender but it had gravy as a sauce. It tasted like turkey gravy with no taste. My husband chicken was actually veal the waiter never came back so he eat the veal. If you don't order wine they ignore you. Also the garden salad is really for two. He told us the salad is for one. Big mistake it is for two. As far as I'm concerned save your money and find another Italian restaurant.
author: linda g.

description: This was a great meal!  The service was friendly and helpful.  Exactly what you want in service.  When I asked Oso Buko or Chiopinno, the response was "Mama Mia, How to choose!?  But you should try the Oso Buko, best in the city"  it was excellent.  I will say, that I almost felt jealous of the many patrons talking with managers like it was "Cheers" (old tv show).  One of us ordered a Swordfish steak and it was huge, delicious and cooked to perfection.  Another with a penchant for eggplant parmigiano was thrilled.     Great atmosphere, great food, great service.  They do have $10 valet.
author: David C.

description: Super disappointed. Was told this is one of the best in little Italy but the experience said otherwise. Service was dismal- rude, hasty, unprofessional. Steak that was supposed to be medium-rare was medium in the middle and medium-well on the outside. Other dishes that came for our group was lackluster for the price. There's gotta be something better than this in the area.
author: Brandon C.

description: Found by accident. Decided to try and was happy we went in. Small bit very good service and the lasagna and gnocchi are both made with home pasta. Loved this restaurant!!
author: Julie C.

description:
Traditional Italian at it's finest!  This place is amazing!  First of all, we got seated in the wine cellar - amazing ambiance and character.  Our waiter, Michael, was also outstanding.  He was able to tell us all about the items on the menu as if it was second nature and being adorable didn't hurt at all!  

The food was excellent, the service outstanding and couldn't give this place enough stars!  Anytime I'm in San Francisco, this is going to be one of our go-to spots.
author: Lonny P.

description: The worst meal I have ever had in SF. With so many choices in this wonderful city, do not eat in this tourist trap restaurant, where the buffet flavored food will make you want to buy a Costco sized bottle of Pepto-Bismol.
author: L. E.

description:
Some restaurants you come to more for the experience than the food. This is exactly that kind of place. I came here as part of a group and didn't make the choice myself, and I'm not sure I ever would have, so I arrived with few expectations. 

Food is fine. I wasn't wowed, and I wasn't dismayed. The Caesar seemed overly mayonnaise-like to me, and the house carbonara was slightly oily but okay. My dessert of zabaglione and strawberries was lovely. 

The servers seem to have worked here forever, and a steady crowd came and went all evening. 

The decor is an odd mix, with almost Asian-style art on the walls. Upstairs has about 20 tables and a bar, and the cellar rooms downstairs are dark and mobish. Ask to see the prosciutto room. It's exactly what you imagine it would be.
author: Kate H.

description:
My friend suggested we try this place on our up coming trip to SF good suggestion we came late and got right in   had carpacio ( don't know how to spell that ) but wow not even sure what it was but it was amazing great olive oil 
The service was old school good every one was on there toes 
Osobuco was one of the specials my wife had that it was very good I went for the saute chicken livers cooked with mushrooms amazing flavor but when i added the red sauce from my wife's meal it made it even better  
they make there own wine and would of loved to try it but was not available by the glass at least we did not see it 
would go back
author: Phillip J.

description:
Love the wait staff here! They are always accommodating and a joy to be around. I've been frequenting this place for over 10 years and it used to be my favorite Italian restaurant in the city. So it's with a heavy heart that I have to say the kitchen has lost its touch... leaving the experience badly overpriced. 

I took a date here recently and was completely underwhelmed. Her seafood dish was undercooked and mine (one of the most expensive cuts on the menu) was terribly over done. I ordered medium rare and got something on the border of well done. When told we like Pinots, our server recommended a bottle that somehow had absolutely no forward taste at all. It was a unique experience, but not what you expect from a bottle over $50. 

For the money I spent we could have had a really nice meal at any steakhouse in the city. My point being: there are way too many options at this price point to settle for a meal like this. I recommend checking into those alternatives instead.
author: Paul L.

description:
The food is not bad, the wait is terrible. After an 85 minute wait (promised 20-40) we were seated in the basement. All was going well until near the end of the meal my vegetarian daughter found meat in here pomodoro gnocchi. 
They did compensate us but not a good way to start or end. They were extremely apologetic.
author: Christina P.

description:
So I went to this place with ma girl's parents. They basically said they knew a place in north beach that was super OG. Just one of the best old Italian spots in North Beach. So I knew we were in for a treat before we got there. Homegirl and I were able to get there a bit before her parents and we sat at the bar while drinking a merlot and Pinot noir respectively. 

We were instructed to follow the host down to the basement which was really cool. Very old school feel. Like this would've been a place where mobsters were escorted to with their buddies. It's dark and wine racks line the walls along with dozens of hanging dried hams. There was also a separate bar downstairs.

No server there was young or inexperienced. Ours was from another country (we later found out France) and we has very very knowledgable about the menu. Just dropping bombs of knowledge left and right and absolutely persuaded me into ordering the dish I chose.

I ended up choosing the petrale mugnaia. A very simple plate with light flavors, which let the quality of the fish carry the meal. To be honest I thought my plate was good, but not above and beyond fantastic. The plating was excellent though, with the potatoes and everything looking very aesthetically pleasing. My homegirl and her moms got the cioppino which I tasted and was totally knocked back by. My plate was not even close to bad by any means, but I wish I had ordered that instead.

Only thing that was a blatant let down was the bread they doled out. I would never expect a place of this quality to be so sacrificial with the quality of their bread. It was cold, dry, and subpar. Everything was awesome otherwise.
author: Jim B.

description:
First the wine guy was awesome.... Very informative and the wine was wonderful
We ordered dinner... The veal scaloppine on the special was phenomenal tender and flavorful...
However I ordered the lamb ... Was supposed to have been marinated in rosemary and garlic.... Oops I think they forgot to put those in the marinade as I did not taste them at all... Also the lamb chops were very thin and lots of bone chips... Not well cooked and no flavor... This was a "special" of the night.... Not special at all so thin over cooked no flavor....
Also the tiramisu was not flavorful and literally dripped non flavorful liquid....
author: Anita B.

description: They over price and under deliver! Not authentic Tuscan by ANY measure either. Pleasantries from the waiters were unconvincing too.  A tourist trap for sure.
author: Paolo B.

description: Service was lovely; sweet old waiters. Food was okay. Nice wine list. Greeted at the door by enthusiastic manager - excellent touch.
author: Jenny N.

description:
Our large group dined in the wine cellar with a pre-arranged menu.  We started with wines poured at the bar.  Then progressed to long tables where they took our orders.  The cellar was dark and old-fashioned, but fit our large group perfectly, and didn't get terribly loud despite all the talking.
 
They gave several options, but for me there were only two - the sole and the veal.  The food enthusiast in me insists on getting something different from J so that I can try more dishes.  So he had the sole and I had the veal.  While the veal with mushrooms and pine nuts was quite delectable (thin, tender, great flavor, and great texture add of the pine nuts), the sole was AMAZING.  It was perfectly cooked to be flaky and tender with buttery flavor and texture.  I highly recommend it.

The dessert of cold zabaglione with strawberries is something I would never order on my own, but the small portion was a lovely end to the meal.  If you're a coffee drinker, try adding a dollop of this to your post-meal cup!
author: Angela M.

description:
Bellisimo!!!! Fantastico!!!!!! Grazie!!!!!

Had this Italian tonight after living on and off in S.F. for many years.

The food is actually superb. The service is a little old school and can lag at times but it all comes together at the end. the lasagna is superb. The veal is spot on. Get the Saltimboca and have a negroni. Your night will be complete when you have the Zabaione!!!!!!!!!

Tell them Mikey sent you!

Oh yeah get the calamari vinaigrette......
author: Michael O.

description:
Really yummy Italian food- this has been a favorite of my family for many years. 
I'd probably call this my favorite non-pizza restaurant in North Beach, in fact, with Ristorante Ideale also in the conversation (sorry folks - Rose Pistola is WAY overpriced for mediocre food). 

 Like so many other great restaurants in SF, I seldom come here- and this is not a comment or criticism of their food- just that I am 'easily distracted' by so many other options.  The long bar and classy and comforting dining room make for a very nice dining ambiance.  I am naturally drawn to North Beach Restaurant's sole dishes- they make several great variations which are always on the menu.  The pastas are EXCELLENT as well, and I have also enjoyed their veal dishes on many occasions.  Valet parking is there for those who need it.

You can't miss with North Beach Restaurant- you will get an ideal Italian dining experience which will leave you happily satisfied with your experience in this district.
author: Andy S.

description:
Don't be fooled by the beautiful restaurant front, high ceilings, brightly lit. I was so looking forward to this experience, but quickly shuttled to the downstairs room. Our was loud, dimly lit, could hardly hear our server, low ceilings, like we were in a basement.
The food was okay, but overall not to rush back for.
Our server earned his automatically applied 20%.
Certainly not a bargain.
author: Mark C.

description:
Six of us went here for lunch and had a good time with good food and great service. This place is an old time classic Italian restaurant where the maitre ' d checks in on you to see if everything is "OK" and recommends specials and wines.
Being a San Franciscan, I take pride in having places like this around.
author: Sidney Z.

description:
Came here on a recommendation. Needless to say, my experience did not meet the hype. Honestly, it is a great venue with good decor and a nice Italian environment. Average service with an Italian service who describe the special well. However as the evening went on, I began to feel rushed or ignored. 
We started with ordering app but in the server rush, he only heard one.  Meat and melon was average overpriced towthrown together dish. 
We moved on to the veal and pasta. The veal was bland and soggy. It was covered with cheese and tomato chunks but by far the better dishes odd the table. Eggplant was thick and bland. Pasta did not taste homemade but from a box. A below average place with mediocre service and food with an above average price tag.
author: Mary N.

description: This is such an amazing restaurant! The staff is so accommodating and knowledgable about all dishes. Perfect recommendation for wine and burrata and home smoked and salted prosciutto and carpaccio app pairing. Scallops 5 stars, eggplant parm 5 stars, spinach ravioli and tortellini in broth, all amazing too!  Topped off with vanilla gelato for the baby! Yummmmmm
author: Staci N.

description: Ok, the owner was great- but between Alex as a server and the food, I honestly cannot imagine a better Italian food experience outside of Italy.  INCREDIBLE.  Service, food, personal experience.  This place is the real deal.
author: George N.

description:
Mediocre overpriced food- stale burnt bread, tasteless fish. Service was annoying - we were asked literally every 2 min if we were ready to order, or if things were OK afterwards. 
It seemed as though the service staff was never trained - they were trying to do their best according to what they thought it was the right thing to do, and it was chaotic. Our table was three levels below ground, no windows - very claustrophobic, and the decor was of a hotel conference room. Not coming back.
author: Pete K.

description: The service and food was outstanding! Our waiter, Alex L., paid attention to every detail and created a fantastic experience for the four of us. The food could not have been better as we each had exceptional pasta dishes.  Wine selection by the glass was impressive. Definitely would recommend!
author: Mary S.

description:
Place has been changed a lot since I've been there . They gave me a good alexander kebab and beautiful lentil soup ! Thanks ! 


It was really good experience and a lot of changes since last visit ! 

Thank you guys !
author: Jay M.

description: Perfect service, perfect food, perfect wine, perfect prosciutto (aged on premises). Pricey.
author: Carlos L.

description: Spent a great night with office mates in the Prosciutto room.  Ambiance, food, wine, waiter and overall old itallian setting made this a very special event.  This is the kind of place you can trust to be "special" and "above average" on a consistent basis.  Our waiter was thoroughly entertaining jumping in with the vibe of our group.  I highly recommend for everything from a quick drink, to a small dinner for 2-4 or even better:  a dinner party of 8 - 25 in the Prosciutto room.  Thanks Lorenzo and North Beach Restaurant for keeping the "Italian" in North Beach.
author: Mike M.

description: Another great meal at North Beach!  Service was exceptional our guests felt welcomed and enjoyed each part of the meal....highly recommend to all visiting SF
author: Bert V.

description:
Despite its suspiciously tourist luring name, my girlfriend and I were pleasantly surprised with this 

It was absolutely epic!! Extremely delicious, great service, wonderful waiter.  I got lasagna (five stars, and I was raised by Brooklyn Jews- the next best thing to real Italians), she got veal piccata (she says 4.5, but she's a French Laundry type of girl).   

All the snobby SF haters rate this place low cause they're too cool for school, but I would gladly come back.  

Perhaps a bit overpriced, but I'm religiously obligated to say that.  

Also... You gotta check out the raw pig legs in the basement!!
author: Matthew D.

description:
Such a great place... Authentic Italian food!! Great ambiance , the waiter was incredible straight out of little Italy in New York 
Pasta freshly made leaving you wanting more 
Chicken parm seriously melted in your mouth with an incredible sauce. 
Yes a little pricey but worth it. A cab driver told us if we try it- we would always come back again on every visit to San Fran and yes he was right...look forward to my next visit there !! Yummy
author: Alyssa B.

description:
Have you ever eaten s meal so good you can't stop thinking about it?? The best Puttanesca since my own!!! The Escargot was perfect, everything fresh and clean, the salad was divine, the ambiance was enjoyable  and ...
Our waiter, Haije, was the most professional and amazing service person.  When a full Dixieland band appeared from the kitchen we were blown away. Better than any of the 5 star restaurants my husband had ever worked at. Not a long wait either.  We will do the 300 mile round trip drive and accommodations just to enjoy this fabulous place again!!!
author: Linda A.

description: The meek was okay - nothing exceptional.  Desert was not very good we all left most of it.
author: Jim H.

description: Perfection for food and service. We had a hiccup when my husband first got there as the rest of the party was late but clearly the food was the star. This is a very loud restaurant- if you don't mind that, then you should be golden. Would return.
author: Nina P.

description: Went here for my daughters 21st birthday. Although the the food is tasty and the service is good the presentation is sub par and really is not worth the price. Everyone enjoyed dinner but value for price is just not there. The fresh vegetables were some over cooked greens. We skipped desert as it just was not worth the price. I love an espresso to finish but $4.25 or a shot  - really? Glad I went, but would not recommend. Corkage is $30
author: Steven H.

description:
This Restaurant is an Italian pose. Food was mediocre minus, but either way not worth the prices listed. Waiter was playing a nice Italian persona, if you're into that, but it was actually just somewhat obnoxious. We also got charged a bottle of wine that we never ordered. They took it off after pretending to be surprised. Though I definitely was not surprised to see an extra charge on it. Also a 20% auto tip charge, which is fine but kind of ridiculous for the service given. 

I would go if you're into playing posing games and dig people putting on their fake thick Italian face on but not really if you're into the quality of food/service. Or at least don't go there expecting it.
author: Shai R.

description:
Absolutely amazing food and service!! This was our first dinner while visiting in San Francisco and after it came recommended by multiple people, we decided to try it out. There was honestly not one thing we ordered that we didn't enjoy. 

Lasagna and fettucini Alfredo were incredible. We ordered caprese salad and mussels for appetizers and it had the best cheese and freshest mussels I've ever tried. Tony was our waiter and we spoke to him about Florence and Rome. 

We got there at 9 on a Friday night and got a seat by the front window immediately. Overall it was great food, great service. And made our first night in San Francisco a win.
author: Lindsay M.

description:
We were referred by the Hilton concierge to this restaurant and I have always been Leary of referrals, but I can truly say Hilton hit it out of the park with the restaurant. Our waiter Haji was amazing we were unsure on the what to choose from this amazing menu , but he soon explained they could expand the menu to our flavor to our taste. I was thinking Cioppinno but also had a craving for their lasagne and he came up with a blend of pasta with Seafood that had similar flavor. Amazing, job by the chefs. My daughter who is a picky eater devoured her plate of Chicken Picatta. The house Sangiovese was fantastic. I can go on and on about this restaurant but if you would like high quality Italian food you will be very pleased.

Thank you for such a wonderful evening!
author: Tim D.

description:
I had the pleasure of returning to North Beach Restaurant this week, and I'm proud to say that the experience was just as great as it was on my last trip there--eleven years ago.  (As I said in my review, how many meals do you remember for seven years, not to mention eleven years?)

My wife used their valet to park our car (it's $8 at lunch), which was very handy.  We were here on vacation, and I had been raving about this place to her for years.  She wanted to know what all of the fuss was about.

As we entered, we were welcomed by their clean-cut ambiance.  The ambiance of the restaurant is fresh, welcoming, and sophisticated.  The art on the walls is also notable.  (Also, the restrooms are immaculate.  If you need to make a pit stop, this is a great place to go.)

We didn't get an appetizer--instead, we took advantage of their bread and their olive oil and balsamic vinegar.  Their bread, olive oil, and balsamic was amazing.  (Their olive oil is actually produced by the owner of the restaurant, who also has a winery in Napa.  We didn't have the wine, so I can't speak to that.)  

For lunch, we each had the Fettuccine Alfredo.  My wife considers herself a connoisseur of Fettuccine Alfredo, as she gets it everywhere.  (I generally don't, because the last time I was here, it was so good that it spoiled most every other Fettuccine Alfredo dishes I've ever had.  Now every time I order it elsewhere, I'm disappointed it's not as good as this one.)  Even with the hype and buildup, my wife loved it and agreed with my assessment.  Over a decade later, the Fettuccine Alfredo here is phenomenal.  The pasta and the sauce are homemade / made from scratch, and I've never had a better one.  (Nor do I expect to ever have a better one, at this rate...)

In conclusion:  This is STILL one of the best meals I've ever ate in my life, in what I think is the best overall city for foodies in the United States.  Just go--you won't be disappointed.
author: Joe K.

description:
The last time we were here it was April 2012  and the experience was amazing -  on the outside not much has changed we were  sat at our same table no less!  Our waiter spoke italian  and we met the owner this time.  The staff was ver kind and yes all the waiters were still male wearing black tuxedos -all very italian - all very classic.

The reason for the restaurant losing two stars  simple: price and quality if food.

The Osso Bucco was great. They have that down. We ordered Burrata with the house Prosciutto and melon- that was good. Not fabulous but good. They say it's flown in fresh daily from Italy maybe that's how they justify their over the top prices.  I ordered chicken piccata- I'm sorry I can do way better at home. My son ordered spaghetti vodka sauce-  again it was okay I do way better at home.

Dessert was amazing though -  the torta di gelato was one of the most interesting desserts I've ever had - in lay language it's cake and ice cream. It was served frozen and as the dessert begins to melt all of the flavors mesh into this lovely flavor that happens right in your mouth!! We also ordered Cold Zabaglione which was nice. My son ordered cheesecake - it was ok and tasted like Costcos.

So let's talk about wine - we ordered a bottle of 2007 Sonoma Brunello from the owners vineyard with a 90 dollar price tag. The wine has a nice nose on it and the longer it sat the more it mellowed. I don't personally feel it was worth 90 bucks.

Little things were annoying. The soda tasted a little bit like chlorine - one would think that a gourmet restaurant would pay attention to detail like that. 

The service was SPOT ON. That's why we left a 20% gratuity. 

The base bill was 318.00 for three people - this wasn't Jardinière, Saison, Gary Danko, Benu, or Michael Mina's.
author: Marna G.

description: I've been dining here for years. The food is always great as is the service. Try the calamari  steak, it's amazing! Thanks Lorenzo and Peter for always delivering a quality experience
author: Tracy M.

description: Went with friends after seeing Beach Blanket Babylon.  Our table was waiting for us and the service was excellent.  We took his suggestions and all four of us loved our food.  Wine and drinks were very good too.  Will definitely go back next time I am in the area.  If you love old fashioned italian food you should definitely try it.
author: B D.

description: You know you are in for a treat at an Italian place if the entire waitstaff looks like they could be in the Godfather movie! They were very professional, friendly and fast, with great recommendations. The house pasta was incredible, as was the veal osso bucco. It was so good we came back the next day for dinner again!
author: Tyler K.

description:
Went for a friend's birthday in a group of 7 and it was great! The food was amazing, the interior design was subpar, and the servers was very friendly! Will definitely come back!

P.s. If you want your food spicy, make sure you order "spicy" (instead of "medium").
author: Angela W.

description: Listened to a local personality tell of his experience at the restaurant.  He had brought a senator as his guest.  Hilarious when he described the dried out yellowing prosciutto!! What a great reputation it had under Lorenzo.  What happened to pride and work ethic?  Guess it does with the past founder/owner.
author: Judi M.

description: One of my favorite restaurants in SF.  The appetizers including prossetta on melon, was perfect.  I had the Lasagna, my wife has wild mushroom tagliatelle and both were fantastic.  The ambiance is very "Old School", I recommend requesting to dine in the wine cellar.  Their wine and olive oil are from their own winery, and they are delicious.  I would definitely go here again.
author: David B.

description: If you want to eat in an elegant restaurant with good service and run into Senator Feinstein, Willie Brown, and/or George Schultz; this is the place. If you want decent food, stay away. Escargot, Caesar salad, and eggplant and veal Parmesan all were mediocre.
author: Dell E.

description: Excellent. I had the oso buco which was cooked perfect. Best I have ever had. My wife had veal scalopini it melted in your mouth. This is a busy loud traditional Italian restaurant. Service is good.
author: Shayne L.

description: Second time. Very touristy, and service reflects. If you're looking for a local night out for Italian in north beach, look elsewhere.  This place is well past its prime.
author: David H.

description: I came to SF 35 years ago right out of a Midwest med school.  This was my first "real" Italian restaurant. I didn't know anything, so that night the waiter & staff made it their mission to educate me on all things Italian.  They are still my "platinum" standard in Italian food by which all others are judged.  Unbeatable in quality, value & just a great bunch of guys!
author: Lovey B.

description:
The only reason they got 4/5 stars is because of their high pricing and smaller serving size. 

Most of the dishes are in the $20-35 range.

I am a sucker for scallops, so I ordered the scallops for $33. And I would do it again. They are absolutely amazing. 

The service was 5/5 stars! Ambiance 5/5! I sat outside in the sun drinking a glass of wine. Love this place!!
author: Elena R.

description: A major disappointment considering the previous ratings. The lasagna was lacking any sort of signature flavor. Honestly I've had Stauffers frozen with more flavor. On the menu it says allow twenty minutes because they are all made to order. I had anticipated something special, not to be. Add to that a grossly overpriced at $65 for a bad bottle of wine and it makes for a non return.
author: Bob P.

description:
My friend and I were walking around Little Italy one afternoon. We were hungry, so we decided to grab food at this place.

I am glad we had our little impromptu to eat here. I ordered the fettuccine alfredo, which I love, and consider myself an expert of the perfect fettuccine alfredo...yes, I said expert, lol! My friend got the pasta with vodka sauce. Our portions looked a little small, but they were both deliciously divine, definitely hit the spot and surprisingly filled us up. 

We also got wine with our meal. The menu said that they had one of the top wine cellars in the Bay Area. After sipping our wines, I realized they were not lying, the wines were divine, and some of the best I had. 

In short, I would definitely go back one day to this place. There are a lot of great places in the Bay Area to eat at, but if a friend was in town and wanted to explore and eat in SF Little Italy, I would definitely take them here. 

Prices a little high for what you get, but definitely worth it overall. 

Oh and last note....if it is a nice day, request to sit outside the restaurant. Beautiful!
author: Sonia A.

description:
Cannelloni -- one of the best in the SF bay area (i've done extensive research)
Special lamb chops -- couldn't be better
Cesar salad -- excellent, and the 1/2 salad is enough if you're having a main course
We had a table by the front window: a great seat to watch passers-by, but with the comfort of indoor heating.
Old school waiters wearing formal black attire -- I like that.

Highly recommended.
author: Arthur C.

description:
The wife and I made a jaunt to S.F. for an overnight and wandered down to North Beach from our hotel in the financial district.  After poking our head into a few restaurants and finding out wait times were a lot lengthier than our growling stomachs would allow we were pleased to find an open table at this restaurant.

My first impression was that this was going to be a tasty meal.  Who doesn't love good Italian food?  I was excited.

Staff was very friendly and all the food came out promptly.  We ordered two caeser salads and a soup (can't remember which soup) to start.  The salads had a beautiful taste but had a sloppy preparation - the wife even commented on it.  The soup was not memorable.

For entrees I ordered the Cioppino and my wife ordered the Fettuccini with Fresh Clams.  

I love Cioppino but to be honest it's not often done really well.  This one was no exception.  I expect a fish stew with fresh and varied ingredients, and hopefully some very nice crab.  There wasn't the typical broth - this was much too much tomato flavor, hurt by the thick pasta sauce/paste consistency.   As to the seafood - there were two mussels, one shrimp, a few small pieces of clam (without shell), the rest was white fish.  It had an okay flavor but this was not the dish I wanted.

My wife enjoyed her entrée.  The pasta was not fresh but was good nonetheless;  The fresh clams did not come in their shell but seemed plentiful (I have my doubts about how fresh they were).  For the portion size $29 seemed pricey - and yeah I realize it's S.F.

Overall...  I expect more from an Italian restaurant in North Beach.
author: Josh D.

description: Im a San Francisco native. This restaurant I can always count on to deliver certain things. Best host to great you. Great waiters that go out of their way to deliver service the classic way. And mainly fantastic food. It always is a pleasure to dine here. Lunch or dinner. Thank you for continuing to hold to such a high standard.
author: Silvia M.

description:
Great Italian food-the staff treats you like you are the most important customer in the restaurant
Risotto with wild mushrooms along with the melon prosciutto appetizer rocks
Hard not to fill up on the breads dipped in olive oil and balsamic vinegar
author: Margaret f.

description:
The only reason I stumbled in here was because it was raining, and the other 2 restaurants I tried going to were closed for the day. I'd wanted to keep walking to go to our 3rd choice, however, I glanced at the menu, found they had Cioppino and said "screw it, let's eat here."

Never again.

The waiter tried bullying us into ordering more and expensive dishes. Even after we said we only wanted the one dish and entree he'd say "I really recommend this, not that." Then about 5 minutes later he'd stroll out with the dish he'd recommended even though no one in the party stated they wanted it.

As he placed the dishes in front of us, we said: 
"We didn't want this. We didn't order it."

He yelled and said "Then what is it that you want?!"

We told him our original order.

He huffed and puffed and said "I told you, you can't have that. You can have this."

I said, "I came for the cioppino, I want that."

He stormed off in a fit. Unclear as to whether or not we'd get that. We hemmed and hawed about leaving. We were angry that he kept bringing us entrees we didn't order, and that he was trying to bully us.

Finally he came out with the food, and as he placed it down he muttered "You can't really have this."

The soup was delicious. It was good. It was fine, there was plenty of it for us. We were stuffed.

The waiter ignored us the rest of the short time there.

He might be used to bullying tourists into buying higher priced and more items, but it wasn't going to happen with us.
author: Vanessa F.

description:
I've never met such a rude waiter in my life. My date and I came here to grab some dinner. We ordered an appetizer and some entrees. My date ordered one of the more inexpensive items, and the waiter insisted she order another dish that was more expensive. She told him that she wanted what she'd ordered, and couldn't eat what he recommended because she was allergic to one of the main ingredients. All he kept saying was "No, I don't recommend that."

After that little interaction, we debated about just eating our appetizer and leaving. But she insisted on staying. When our entrees came out, he brought her the dish he'd recommended and not the one she wanted.

Even after I told him we did not want it nor did we order it he kept pushing the dish on us. It wasn't until I demanded the bill for the food eaten (the appetizer) that he backed off, and brought her what she ordered.

The appetizer was okay, the melon could have been a bit more ripe. The entrees were okay, but he did damper our mood a bit which made the meal less enjoyable. We just wanted to eat and leave.

I've never had a restaurant experience quite like this, and I hope I won't have to deal with that level of discomfort again.
author: Mike F.

description: Order multiple times via Yelp!, no issues with deliveray.  Quality of food is excellent and every pizza has been amazing.
author: Barry W.

description: Veal parmigiania $34 is excellent. Excellent quality veal you could possibly cut with a fork or spood its tender. The sauce is not too heavy its a bit soupy which meant my entree which was delivered so quickly was gone so quickly. The cheese is good not sure it was fully melted but it was good. Three bites of the potato and I want a dozen more wow very tasty! The veggie was devoured too. No meatballs thou
author: Jody S.

description: Sad to say I think this place has gone downhill. The Veal I ordered with pine nuts was too greasy and rather tasteless. The antipasti was mediocre as was my salad. Service was friendly and fast, but restaurant was 70% empty at 7pm on a Wednesday.
author: Trevor B.

description: We were a table of four that had early reservations and I think that was a good choice to allow us to be sat quickly and served quickly. Some people don't like that but to me it was a plus. Marco was our server and he was one of the most professional I ever met who knew the wines and the menu very well. We all chose different veal dishes and we were all very very satisfied. Finally a place that knows how to make real marsala. We paid about $100 each with a generous tip but we did have drinks and a nice bottle of wine so the price was as expected Only the second time in my life I've been to San Francisco but when I come back this will be at the top of my list as well as the local pastry shops with Espressos and pignolis.
author: D H.

description:
After passing an interview and exam, my hubby and I ended up celebrating at North Beach Restaurant and ordered the waiter's chicken recommendation.. 
First, ambience was super immaculate, spotless and class, the Italian Server was so accommodating, The chicken and rice with garlic and pepper was sooo delicious.. It's worth it that we ended up giving a thick tip...
author: Kash D.

description: Good basic, old school, authentic and old world cuisine. Great wine list as well and this ain't no pizzeria! Had the OSSO BUCCO and it was to die for!! Dang, I'm salivating just reminiscing about it. Go already if you're in North Beach looking for great Italian.
author: Trujillo F.

description: Meh. I was here with a group and maybe my expectations were too high, but I wasn't particularly impressed. It seems like NBR prides themselves on the old school Italian vibe they have going on. The prosciutto and melon was good, and I liked my spaghetti alla vodka, but it wasn't anything I couldn't get somewhere else. I wasn't paying for the meal so I don't know what the final bill came to, but the dishes seem overpriced for what you get. We skipped dessert in favor of finding some cannoli at one of the many Italian bakeries in the neighborhood.
author: Rachel C.

description: We visited on busy night with a large group , so if you're having a romantic dinner for two , disregard this review to some degree .... Don't care what the food tastes like . Stuck us in a basement butchering  / dishwashing room and tried to pull it off as a private room. Seriously , it's like a morgue in there . 80 prosciuttos hanging from the ceiling over your head . Giant stainless commercial sink prep station with a couple of candles stuck on it for decor . There is a difference between setting up a table for a large group in an old wine seller , and the utility room they tried to pass off .  They also need to have their carpets cleaned . Come on guys pull your act together ! Valet was a mess as well . Food was decent . San Fran has much better to offer for your hard earned $
author: David R.

description:
Amazing restaurant.    7 course meal.   And we brought our own wine (which is always a big plus in my book).

We went back again and the food and service is as good as it can get.   Fantastic wine menu too.  

Highly recommend
author: John R.

description: Went to Beach Blanket Babylon & to this restaurant for my third time with Bunny of the Year 2015 CARESSA Kisses. Classy place, waiters in black suits, the breads were amazing omg, three types & I am trying no starches but are a bunch.  The carpaccio & prosciutto was superb, the minestrone was super & the clams with angel hair CK ordered she raved about. They brought us a desert that was super, didn't ask what it was but damn !!
author: Dennis H.

description: This place is trying to be a high end restaurant, but the quality of food and service is sub par. We ordered and our food was out in 5 minutes, which at a fast food place would be great, but at a "higher end" Italian restaurant, normally you expect quality fresh food to take a little time to prepare. The food wasn't bad, but it wasn't great. It didn't taste all that fresh, and was warm, not hot. After dinner, drinks and dessert, our bill came and we paid cash. Soon, the waiter picked up the cash and never brought change back. I had to ask for my change. I wasn't going to leave a 43% tip for poor quality food or service. I was planning to leave the customary 20-25%. When I asked for my change, the waiter seemed surprised and made an ordeal of having to break change, then brought the change without a receipt. Over all the atmosphere was very awkward. I'm not sure if they are used to only serving locals who are regulars or what, but I won't ever return on future trips to the city.
author: Jay B.

description: An old landmark of North Beach. I came on a Monday night and despite the lack of product knowledge as to how each item was prepared, he assured me it was good. I ordered a simple bolognese and was impressed enough. We also had a veal dish and it was good. I like the friendly staff, nice decor, but its a little pricey.
author: Gabriel B.

description: I ran in and asked the man in charge if I could use the bathroom because I really had to go. He was so nice about it and let me. So my friend and I decided to stay for a drink. We got to try the frozen lemon drink that is there special house drink. It was delicious. The bartender was also very nice and gave us great conversation! Hopefully we'll be back to try the food! Thank you!!
author: Victoria N.

description: Just visited again and same wonderful experience--great food and service.  A real treat.
author: Jane G.

description: Ambiance was good. Pretty laid back feel & not pretentious. Great wine selection & their dessert was yummy. But all in all a bit pricy for the quality/quantity of food they serve specially their pastas.
author: Jays D.

description: Went here for a rather important dinner... the meeting of my parents with my soon to be in-laws. Very unimpressed. The server seemed to be having a super off day. He would take one drink order, then go and pick up the drink, then not ask if anyone else wanted anything to drink. This "style" of service continued throughout the meal, making for a very bumpy overall dining experience. The food was also not tasty.  Would definitely never eat here again.
author: Meredith A.

description:
What a treat this place was!

We stumbled in here on accident, and boy am I so glad we did. Greeted by amazingly friendly and attentive staff, we were seated promptly.

Our server Mel was an absolute delight. He was warm, kind, and made sure we had everything we needed without hovering or interrupting our dining experience unnecessarily.

The wine selection was great. I ordered the Chicken Scaloppini Piccata - delicious! The sauce was perfectly seasoned and so flavorful. Accompanied by potatoes and greens, it was a great meal overall.

My date ordered the Tortellini Supreme and had nothing but good things to say about it.

Five stars all around!
author: Sarah G.

description: Great atmosphere and food! Our waiter, Daniel provided such a great experience!!! He really was "Dan the Man!" Everything is homemade and delicious! Make sure to make reservations ahead of time!
author: Scott M.

description: North Beach Restaurant is a Tuscany inspired place.  Welcomed by a very friendly manager/owner I proceeded to de-construct a cold starter of Carpaccio & Home Cured Prosciutto di Parma, a great way to initiate the meal.  That was followed by plain presented home-made Ravioli Toscana, a 9/10 dish. There were four gigantic ravioli only, but each of them was as big as 5 square inches!!! The ragù meaty sauce and their filling were yummy and succulent.  To finish I got, as suggested by the friendly, assertive and professional waiter, the Cold Zabaglione & Fresh Strawberries, a great way to top up this opiparous treat.  A strong Wi-Fi signal is available and table service is great. On other topic, the internal deco needs a bit of a revamp, but who cares when the food is that good!!!
author: Pablo D.

description:
I came with friends for my birthday and to be blunt l typically dont write reviews but felt the need too here.
It was AWFUL!. I had a steak and it was tough and flavorless.My wife had a calamari steak that also lacked flavour. To add insult to injury it was VERY over priced. I do and have travelled globally and experienced various cuisines in those locations and this was one of the worst experiences ever. We were informed the chef was older and passed two years ago. Well on last nights experience it seems so has the food. I highly recommend you do NOT go here waste of money and time.
author: Chris V.

description: The service is impeccable.  A little pricey for the quantity and quality of food.  Tasty but not that special.  Nice atmosphere but not as casual as I thought it would be.
author: Chris L.

description: As you can see in the photo I posted, we love this place!  Dinning in the cellar-the atmosphere is totally "God Father-esque" , prochuto and melon, and the wine!  North Beach owners also have a winery and a wine club (yes I'm a member) you can't go wrong with any selection from The Petroni line!  This is all before you even order your meal!  The food is amazing, no matter what you order, you will enjoy. I recommend going back enough times to try at least everything once!
author: Theresa A.

description: Great atmosphere and very lively. Watch your head. 2 guests in our party were hit in the head with dinner plates. We had the halibut, veal, calamari, chicken & scallops. Not a bad dish among them. Dining room was crowded but comfortable. Very accommodating on separating checks.
author: Robyn M.

description:
It's unusual when a restaurant can stay good over the years, and unfortunately, this restaurant isn't the exeception.  15 years ago I went here a couple of times and I used to raved about it and recommend it to visitors. Recently my husband and I went, and not only was the food far more expensive than the quality deserved (it was decent, it wasn't the best, but the prices wanted to encourage you to think so),  but we had serious problems with the restaurant and the service. 

First when we came in, a guy who acted like a head waiter was socially awkward at us, and in our faces about how much we'll love it there; then he emphasized how NONE of this food is SOUTHERN Italian (*ptui*), it's all NORTHERN Italian (this is where your eyes are supposed to light up and you're apparently supposed to think, ooh la la, none of that low-class Southern Italian food). Well, my husband is Sicilian so we found that insulting.

We were looking to host a dinner party and they showed us downstairs.  They cure their own prosciutto - which by the way my husband's father did, too - but what his father didn't do, and would never have done, is serve dinner under the hanging meat practically on top of your head. I don't see how this can be legal frankly.  Last thing I want in my prosciutto is somebody's nasty old hair. It's disgusting.

I was really pissed off. This place used to be classy. We won't go back, ever, and I'm definitely not recommending it to anybody again.
author: Shannon W.

description:
Food was ok..
Automatically charged 20% for tip...what if I wasn't satisfied with service...which I wasn't ..he attended others more than us.
Beware of samples....they charge you for a sample! They should let you know ahead of time or not call it samples...samples should be free.
Valet  parking. .unbelievable rude attendees. .really and you charge 20   dollars 4 that.
Would not recommend.  ..never coming back.
For the quality of food ...it's way over priced...go somewhere else
author: ROSIE B.

description:
Beware:
Waiter handwriting the tip of 20% on the bill as well as on the credit card receipt. 

Upselling: Waiter 'suggesting' shared pastas & desserts, half of which remained uneaten. That, plus the suggested appetizer medley added 35-40% to the bill.
author: K C.

description:
Best bolognese and capellini everrr! The carpaccio melts in your mouth. Been here about 5 times now and have yet to order anything I didn't enjoy. 

Can get pretty busy on the weekends, would suggest a reservation.
author: Jennifer L.

description: This is one of the best restaurants ever.  It is old school Italian with new school cool.  The staff is awesome.  Just look at the pictures of our food.  The lemon cellos are legendary.  If your in San Francisco it is a must stop!
author: Doug P.

description: Wow!!! All I can say is amazing!!! The melon prosciutto appetizer was the best I've ever had, followed by an outstanding veal chop and the entire time enjoying a fantastic 2013 Patz & Hall Chardonnay. I would also like to give a huge shout out to our server Luca who was very knowledgeable and pleasant. And when you visit make sure to check out how it all happens downstairs.
author: Kurt S.

description: Found this place while walking around Little Italy. We were pleasantly surprised , both our fish entrees were delicious . Our waiter was excellent. They had an extensive wine list that was fairly priced .This is truly an old school Italian restaurant .
author: Pat G.

description: Came in without reservations and with kids, which is the equivalent sporting a cold sore on your face and going to a kissing contest. We were understandably shooed to the basement which was a little twighlight zonish. Kind of freaky, dark and filled with holiday decor to hide the fact we were in a North Beach basement. The food exceeded our expectations. My son ordered a delicious rigatoni with meat sauce and also enjoyed the chicken piccata and spinach ricotta ravioli. Only downside was Tomatoes used in the appetizer were a bit rough-would be better with a juicy heirloom. This place would really benefit from an interior makeover as the look put "old" (and musty) in old school. Get this place remodeled, keep up the professional and attentive service and keep making delicious food!
author: Matt H.

description:
Excellent place to eat! The waiters were extremely friendly and made sure we had everything we needed while my kids and I waited for my dear friends to arrive. 
We saw on the menu the Lasgnia would possibly take up to 25 minutes to prepare, so we asked the waiter to be prepared to take two orders. This definitely avoided any delays. The food was delicious. My son experienced his first Lasgnia and loved it, so he took over my plate and finished it for me. My daughter loved it too, but ordered without knowing if she'll love it. Her desicion was based on The Garfield Show. :) Would I return? Of course, without any doubts!
author: Leila H.

description: Service was great - from the bartender, the maitre d', to the server. The food was inconsistent.  Wine was great.
author: Leigh H.

description:
Been coming back here regularly for years, never disappoints. Had the family there last Saturday, Marco as usual, fantastic waiter, food, simply the best.
You can never go wrong here.
author: Christopher F.

description:
This restaurant was chosen for my birthday dinner simply because it's one of the few places that serves Veal Parmesan by our hotel.

We were disappointed at the entryway when the doorman was too busy texting on his phone to look up. He still had his phone out while he opened the door for us.

The host was very friendly, I appreciated that. My fiancé made a reservation and the host picked out a intimate table away from the crowd. 

We were served stale bread though, and my Veal Parmesan didn't taste as great as other restaurants. I went to bed hungry after dinner, we just weren't satisfied with this place at all. Might want to skip this place...
author: Zira C.

description:
As a transplant from NYC, I am an Italian food snob. 

With the exception of the complimentary bread which is just OK, this place is on par with the best Italian restaurants in Manhattan and I recommend. 

Pricey but worth it. Try the homemade burrata. To die for.
author: J L.

description: We made a 630 reservation and arrived on time. We got a great table and our waiter was immediately there to take our drink order. When he returned with the drinks he recommended some appetizers. The Barrada and prosciutto where delicious. For the main course we had the chicken scaloppine, with prosciutto, mozzarella in a white wine sauce which was amazing. Our service for the evening was great. When we left (~8:00) the place was PACKED. I highly recommend this restaurant.
author: Jim W.

description:
North Beach Restaurant is a reminder of the way things used to be.  The host knows half of the guest by name because they have been coming here for years and the Menu is unapologetically filled with staples from the old country that have been good for centuries so why change them.  

I always start with the penne bolognese, the get whatever the special is that night, it's never failed.  Couple that with some Italian wine,Grappa, and great friends and the night is complete.

This place isn't trendy, it's too old/awesome for that.  It's also not touristy because they forgot to make a reservation.  If you are looking for Classic Italian, stop in, you won't be disappointed.
author: Theo S.

description: Absolutely Amazing food and service! The filet mignon is one of the bests I've ever had. Also there was a seafood pasta that was very tasty. The service was perfect and completely were attentive and satisfied our needs. We even received a free desert. It is however pricey but definitely worth the money for a date night. The wine here is also delicious. I would recommend this place to any couple looking for a nice date night.
author: Kelsey T.

description:
4 of us, dinner on Saturday night. 
I had a great dinner at NBR. Our table was the Wine Cellar, down stairs basement. 
On the way to down stairs, I saw 2 original Dali's prints and few original Miro's prints on the wall. I don't really care both artists because both kind of out-dated artists.

We share appetizers.
Caprese Salad, imported sliced burrata mozzarella, tomatoes and basil, seasoned with salt, and olive oil.
Home Cured Prosciutto and Melon, still don't the idea why Melon? but I put the Prociutto on bread, olive oil over and slice of lemon, was nice.
Homemade Ravioli Toscana was really good. 
My gf had the Veal Saltimbocca, she gave me a piece, it was good.
I had the day's special, Grilled Lamb Chops. They were a perfect medium grilled, so juicy, so moist and ........ just, immmmm, ... perfect Lamb Chops I have ever had.
Sorry, I forgot the name of the red wine. It was really good.

I was very skeptical about NBR, only because the place is Ronn Owen's favorite restaurant.
If you don't know who is Ronn Owens, keep it that way. 
He is the most annoying talk radio host. 
I don't like his jerk-off voice, I don't like his jerk-off opinion, I don't like his jerk-off comments, and I don't like his... jerk-off.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v-G5PZEqiGU

The service was excellent. All professional waiters.
Great atmosphere.
Excellent Lamb Chops.
Great homemade Prociutto and Ravioli.
Good wine.
5 star.
author: Nobu K.

description: Classic Italian restaurant thats hard to match in the city in my view. Extensive menu including a few veal dishes that are my favorites.  I had scaloppine marsala. The meat was very tender and there was plenty of it. Served with sliced potatoes and broccoli rabe. We had a few appetizers to start which were all very good. The sauce with the veal was a bit sweet which was not to my liking. They may have used sweet marsala rather than dry but I'm just guessing. Wine was very nice and reasonably priced. Espresso was delicious as was the cannoli and cold zabaglione one of us had. Service was top notch. All in all a very nice evening out.
author: Guy R.

description: Amaaaazing food! I don't understand the poor reviews on here. I had a fabulous meal and will most likely return if I am every feeling indulgent! Came here for a holiday dinner with my colleagues and we basically were told to get whatever we wanted. We each had a sampler appetizer plate that consisted of lobster tail, prosciutto and a type of cheese. Each one tasted like butter. The prosciutto paired with the cheese melted in my mouth and the lobster tail was super juicy and delicious! We then ordered a main dish and my colleague and I split a T-bone steak with pasta. I wish I remembered what pasta we ordered but wow both dishes did not disappoint! Then to top off our amazing meals, we ended the night with a sampler platter of desserts: cheesecake, pudding, tiramisu and dipped strawberries. The meal was phenomenal and the waiters were incredible friendly. Great restaurant!
author: Samantha S.

description:
Went here for my closest friends birthday dinner. I had never heard of NBR but he was raving about it which helped me gather interest as I drove from San Jose to North Beach last Friday evening. Damn, such a long drive, especially knowing you're going to have to drive home in a few hours. The trip was more than worth it, in fact, I would've driven another 2 hours to hang with my best friend and the rest of the dinner party. Sometimes it is cool to be grown up and somewhat civilized. 

Okay, the food. Actually let's talk waiter first. Al Capone was our waiter, Jimmy Hoffa was the maitre d' and Tony Montana was sitting at the table next to us with a big pile of white stuff. I think it was gnocchi. Our waiter did look like a skinny Al Capone and my friend and I kept trying to figure out if he had a mustache. If it was there it was pencil thin and I couldn't see it. Very nice waiter, attentive, kept the wine glasses full, and was always within arms reach. I'd give the service 5 starts if it was not for the requisite 20 minute waiter break between the end of our dining and when the bill came. I swear every restaurant I've ever been to picks up the last finished plate, asks if everything was ok and then the entire staff leaves the building. 

I had the veal parmesan. It was thinly sliced, with a well balanced red sauce and just the right amount of melted mozzarella. It comes with a tiny bit of sautéed spinach and two roasted potato slices. The quantity was perfect for me. It didn't induce a food coma like so many other Italian restaurants and frankly when I ordered, I was worried about eating and driving. I almost got the petrale to play it safe but you know what, sometimes you just have to live on the very edge and get a little crazy. 

I'd definitely go back, but before I do I am going to hit joe's and try and find a smaller quaint Italian option as well.
author: Don A.

description: Best ravioli I've ever had; best Caesar I've ever had.  Very attentive and knowledgable staff.  Extensive wine selection. What more can you ask for.
author: Pere M.

description: Really great Italian restaurant if you are a pasta lover! Everything you can dream up, you can order! Anything is possible on their menu! Highly recommend the pink sauce and vodka sauce. Very clean and upscale environment for Little Italy experience. Wait staff is exceptional! Make sure you make a reservation!
author: Brooke A.

description:
Classic and traditional Italian cuisine. The place has an old yet romantic, elegant feel. All the servers are generally very helpful and polite and go out of their way to serve the customer. I think the food is pretty good, they have a rather large menu with most of the Italian favorites. Large wine list. This place is more on the formal side, especially if going on a Friday or Saturday night.

I tipped well and I'll be back!
author: John D.

description: Love this place - super yummy raviolis and a fun place for a large group in the prosciutto room downstairs! Make sure you do make a reservation on a weekend evening.
author: Sharon C.

description: Loved this place. Exactly what you would think of when you picture an authentic, legit Italian restaurant. The wine selection was amazing- we had the Justin Isosceles yummy yummy. He caprese salad was pretty good to start. The bread was delicious as well. For dinner we split the pasta putanesca with rigatoni which is so delicious I could die swimming in it. Capers were huge and olives so good. I highly recommend this plate. Next we split the veal and prawns. The side  vegetable looked a little odd as it was cucumbers or maybe green squash but my god it was good. In a lemony cream sauce. There was also two slices of roasted potatoes but honestly I was too full to take a bite. The service was very good as well. We loved this spot!
author: Jessica G.

description:
Ever been to a restaurant where party of 2 dine, served nicely and by the end of the meal, the server decides his own tip. I thought he wrote down for a suggestion only but when I asked him to run my credit card, he filled up the tip space with his own handwriting.
For me it was amusing and left me a rude impression of this establishment.
I am working in a restaurant myself and this is what the server not aware of. Probably he judged me and my boyfriend from our attire and assuming us to be that customer who doesnt know how to tip, but even so, this practice is not correct. Because I work in a restaurant that even not charged gratuity for party of 10. Gratuity is always optional. Just because I felt he put his own price reasonably, and I was about to give him the same amount anyway, I signed the copy.
But, it doesnt mean I am a satisfied and will return or suggest this restaurant to anyone else.
author: Meike N.

description: Absolutely wonderful! New to SF we had a difficult time finding an elegant Italian restaurant. Google and Yelp lead us to pizza and or take-out. Dressed for a nice intimate and romantic dinner we nearly called it quits for diner food. After walking and then driving we decided to find any restaurant open and  stumbled upon North Beach! Service was upbeat, pleasantly humorous and all of our questions were answered with care. We fell in love with a new wine after our waiter carefully sought out our likes and dislikes. Our dinner's were rich in texture, creamy and the meat was tender enough to melt in your mouth. We will definitely return within the week.
author: Jessica B.

description:
We were attracted to this restaurant because it looked upscale.  The staff  was friendly and seemed helpful so we had high hopes.  I was hoping for authentic Italian food in North Beach.  What a disappointment.  The proscuitto was good, but our entrees were inedible. Suddenly the staff became totally disinterested in us.  No one asked why we were not eating. They just removed our plates, had the nerve to show up with a dessert menu and then presented the bill.

The place is a total tourist trap and has no interest in satisfying customers.  It was a very costly mistake for us.
author: Deanna N.

description:
We had a great family meal here this weekend and our waiter was great with my niece and nephew which made for a great experience all the way around.  We started off with their famous home-cured prosciutto and melon which was good and for the main meal I ordered the veal cutlet parmigiana which was huge but really tasty.

Great spot that I think people might overlook in North Beach.
author: Blake B.

description:
The staff was friendly, service was good. It didn't appear to be a restaurant for kids, at least in the area we were seated...main floor close to the restrooms. 

They have a nice wine list, lots of options but it's not cheap...$80 is about the starting price for a decent bottle of wine, I brought two nice bottles from home that would have probably been $130 there. They charge $30 per corkage. 

They have valet parking, a nice perk since we were going to a show just down the street and we could leave our car their during the show.

The food, OUTSTANDING! I ordered Risotto Pescatora - Assorted Shellfish, $28. And their Famous Home-Cured Prosciutto and Melon, $14.50 ---all of it worth every penny.

The only thing I would ding them on is the bread, I love bread! What they served was several days old. 

While this place is a little on the pricey side it's worth every penny since they have valet. For those of you not familiar with parking and maneuvering  the streets of  North Beach ---well, it's nearly  impossible to find parking, any day of the week.
author: Mary C.

description: If your looking for a nice sit down place with great food and service take this off your list.  That's how we started out when we arrived but when we were greeted by one of the rudest waiters with un-accommodating  policies for children. Terrible experience and not worth your time and money.
author: Randy P.

description:
Went here as a last minute Valentine's date w/ hubby and was so glad we did. Its a cozy place & you will sit very close to other patrons, but it was still a great restaurant. Very romantic. The service was prompt and the food AMAZING! I got the spaghetti alla carbonara, and it was some of the best i've ever had. Hubby loved his food as well. Cheesecake for dessert just made the whole evening that much better. 
We will definitely be going back whenever we're in the City.
author: Ikeyla L.

description:
I have always enjoyed NB Restaurant, The Chicken Mattone is a favorite
and the Seafood is always excellent. Hot Tip, Lunch ends at 3 and the Menu
goes to Dinner prices, get there early and $AVE... Excellent Wine List.
author: Peter J.

description: The food was not bad.  The reason for my lack of stars is because of how overpriced everything is.  $17 for exactly four shrimp in the cocktail?  Seriously?  The pasta dishes were overpriced as well.  The ambiance and wait staff are...okay.  Nothing outstanding.  You are in North Beach- there are MANY places with good Italian food and a good wait staff.  I do not see any reason in paying an extraordinary amount for something that is good- but not extraordinary.
author: C E.

description: The wife and I went for dinner before seeing the Beach Blanket Babylon show as it's very close. Great service and food. Best part of the restaurant was the warm welcome and genuine interest from the server in making our meal special. First time but we will definitely be going back.
author: John S.

description:
Our family has been hitting this spot for a long time-  why? consistency!  great food, good service, serve late, valet parking-  old world charm right in North Beach-   Congrats and
hats off to this old school, Italian Restaurant  keep up the good work
author: Earl K.

description: Great atmosphere especially if you are seated in their private prosciutto room where you can smell it and look at them hanging above you. They cured their own prosciuttos. Food were just mediocre American Italian that you can get at most of the "Italian" restaurants in upstate NY where I live.
author: Tommy C.

description:
I will echo Erin S's comments below, since we dined here together.  However, I think she was too kind in giving three stars.

The Maitre 'D was very kind and welcoming, but that was the extent of the positive vibe here.  Our server seemed to hate us.  I guess I can't blame him completely, because one of my dining companions asked A LOT of questions.  There may have been some communication problem, as he contradicted himself a few times.  One example: he said the corkage fee was $20, when in fact it ended up being $30.  Yes, that's completely outrageous, but if you see the markups on their bottles, you'll probably save money bringing your own.

Service was slow throughout the evening, although the place wasn't busy.  And I should add, the best service we got was from the guys pouring water.  We saw them much more often than we did our server.  If I could have tipped them separately, I would have.

We ordered three pasta dishes, which ranged from meh to good.  Nothing great, however.  When it came time for dessert, we decided to spend those dollars elsewhere.  It was one of the best decisions of the night.
author: Raina S.

description: Our favorite Italian spot in San Fran! We can't leave the city without a stop here. The basement seating can get warm, but the old-time club feel surrounded by cellars is great! Homemade pastas and sauces to die for. Starter bread is delicious. Everything on the menu is worth trying and the specials are always on point! Wish we had a North Beach in Texas!
author: Megan B.

description: A failure on almost every level.  The waiter we had tried to up sell us by giving us a taste of wine and then asking if we wanted a glass.  Glad we said no thanks, turned out the glass of wine was $22.00.  Tried to order some appetizers and got four prawns for $20.00 added to it.  Guess he said we ordered it but we sure never ordered them.  Clearly the waiters are being told to get their average check amounts higher.  My lowest rating and recommendation for this place.  The food?  Terrible caprese salad with tasteless tomatoes and bland mozzarella.  The prawns we didn't order?  Well, they were okay and so was the pasta but the sauce was honestly too salty.  Lousy bread and inflated wine prices round out this poor restaurant.  Try the great US Restaurant down the street for real North Beach Italian.
author: Bill S.

description: I have been coming here for 14 years from SoCal and still love it. I wondered if I would like it as much after my trips through Italy esp. Tuscany and I do. It still is wonderful. It is the real deal. By far the best things I have had as a entrée is the Lasagna and Fettuccine.  But the prosciutto is by far what they are famous for. There is a dry room in the wine cellar (wine list is extensive, though I don't imbibe) where they age their prosciutto. You may reserve a table and eat in the aging room. It is a wonderful place.
author: Douglas W.

description:
This place is just OK.  After wandering around debating on which restaurant to eat at, we ended up here because my aunt said she had heard good things about it.  It seemed a bit formal & fancy to me, but we were in North Beach, and you can't go wrong with Italian in North Beach, right?

We brought our own bottle of wine since we had originally planned on eating at a different establishment which does not have a corkage fee.  After checking the wine list, my sis realized that it made more sense to pay the ridiculous $30 corkage charge rather than order a bottle of wine off the menu.  Crazy!

We had a nice little table in a nook by the front window.  It was great for people watching on Columbus.  But since we were tucked away we were forgotten on more than one occasion.  Plus every time our waiter came to help us, he seemed like he couldn't get away fast enough.  Did he not like us?  We would ask him questions about the menu & he would answer quickly then run off.  We weren't in a hurry, but he took so long to get back to us that we decided to skip appetizers & just get our main dishes.

For my entree I had the gnocchi piemontese.  The gnocchi was delicious, the tomato-based sauce was nothing special.  For $20 I guess I expected more.  My dining companions enjoyed their pasta dishes too, but we weren't blown away.

With so many Italian restaurants in the area I wouldn't choose to come back here.
author: Erin S.

description: This has always been my favorite pizza place to go with my family. I always get a combo pizza and clams and linguini with white sauce. Those two are my favorite.
author: Steven Y.

description: Probably the best Italian restaurant in San Francisco. Classic and Fine dining in the heart of North Beach.
author: Nave A.

description: Flavor of all the Marina sauce on the lasagna was very off and odd flavored and scant.  Almost no sauce on the gnocchi and it was very bitter.
author: Catherine D.

description: group dinner and reservations ready...starting glass of wine waiting for others...table ready on time...touristy location and restaurant...wine for the table starting...smoked salmon and scallops as appetizers...small sizing and hardly enough to share...a decent bite and no more...order of cioppino for main...small flat platter bowl of red...chunks of fish and shells...smaller serving in comparison...experienced better for less...
author: Hen A.

description: I was meaning to write this review right after dining at the restaurant but didn't get around to it. Finally I have some time to say what a wonderful night I had. MARCO, our waiter was fantastic! I can rave about what an exceptional job he did for hours and hours if yelp let me lol. Excellent food, stupendous service, and magnificent setting! A must on any tourist list of places to enjoy a nice dinner and drinks!
author: Abigail A.

description: used-car salesman server who tried his damnedest to upsell us a bunch of expensive appetizers we didn't want. mediocre food that is way overpriced. i'm not big on servers who tell you that you ordered wrong either, especially when the mistake was theirs. never again.
author: Angela D.

description: Went with a group, we ordered appetizers and entrées for all. All our orders were something I could have made at home with ragu sauce and the salt content was to the level of turning all the food bitter, the eggplant was horrible and uneatable so we asked to exchange it . We overheard the owner tell the waiter no return just bring them another  dish. This prompted us to check our bill at the end.  The bill had two extra charges of dishes not ordered and no credit of the eggplant so as we questioned it the owner Peter Patroni came upset to our table and said too bad the food was perfect and was shouting right into our face. In all of my years I have never ever experienced such a horrible human being, can't understand why he is in business he is demeaning to his staff and they are terrified of him.  Never even think of going here for ragu and poor quality food. They are preying and tourist who won't come back. After all that He over charged and for 3 main entres that we never bought.  Unbelievable disturbing experience ruined our trip to the city.
author: N S.

description: We were here on this past Saturday to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We heard about the restaurant because we happen to be Petroni wine club members. Initially we had called ahead of time and asked if they did tastings & they told us there was no affiliation. (Which confused us) When we showed up we were greeted by Mr. Petroni himself! He was very welcoming & thanked us for being members. He bought us anniversary cocktails. We were seated shortly thereafter & Mel was our server. Excellent customer service. Food was outstanding!!! I had a pasta that each bite packed some real flavor. Husband had the house special and it was so tender!!! Dessert was amazing & we had some lemon sorbet champagne cocktail that was delicious! Definitely would go back!
author: Amanda C.

description: Great place. Our clients had a wonderful time and loved dinner. The wine list could use a little upgrade but this is a great place.
author: S M.

description: Great service! Sat at Al Fisher's old table. The waiter had been there for 27 years! Food was great, yummy wine and sourdough bread. We will be back! Perfect place to go prior to Beach Blanket Babylon show.
author: Lotus G.

description:
The North Beach Restaurant is like having sex in the back of a Rolls Royce with the valet of Bertram Wilberforce Wooster seated beside holding a tray with The Macallan. 

What Cannelloni debauchery! What orgasmic Vongole! 

Cheers Jeeves!
author: Nick A.

description:
Visited on a Wednesday night at the recommendation of work colleagues living in San Francisco. Short summary - it was... okay. I am a bit of a pasta snob, so I take my Italian food seriously, and this place, while decent, was far from life-changing, or even really memorable.

ATMOSPHERE: Busy and small. The restaurant is small, and they have absolutely maximized their dining room space by all but stacking tables on top of each other. We ended up going through what felt like a maze to get to a section of the dining room by a window, and it was a TIGHT squeeze to get between the tables. To my dismay, the aisle between us and the table across from us was only about 1 to 2 feet, so it felt like we were dining together. (kudos to the food service people who actually have to navigate this space!!!)

FOOD: Decent. Not terrific, not terrible, just in the middle. Depending on the dish, the portions are very small, so if you are hungry be sure to ask your server what the portion size of your dish is BEFORE you order it. Here's a breakdown of what we had:

1 - Home-Cured Prosciutto and Melon - Nice, but small portioned (maybe 4 pieces of extremely thin meat and 2 melon slices) and not nearly worth the $15 price tag.

2 - Carpaccio alla Veneziana - Meh. Same as above. Nice, but not worth the cost (unless you aren't the one paying the bill).

3 - Ravioli Toscana - Homemade - Actually these were quite good. Nice flavor, well seasoned, and good sauce. My biggest issue with them was the fact that there were only THREE. Who charges $21 for 3 ravioli? The website shows a picture of this dish with like 20 on the plate - seriously misleading, and if you're hungry, this dish isn't going to cut it.

4 - Lasagna - Decent, but again misleading. The menu suggests these were made to order, and like other reviewers, our order was up and on the table about 10 minutes after ordering it. I think it's HEATED to order. That said, the flavor was okay, but again the price tag was dissapointing (sense a trend??)

5 - Petrale Mugnaia - Expensive ($33), very small portioned, and while nice enough tasting, not worth a second try because I forgot it until just now as I'm writing the review.

SERVICE: Fair. Our server was well informed about the menu, accommodating with drink and water, and brought the check in an efficient / timely way.. 

VALUE: Poor - see the food notes for specifics. In all, the portions are way under, and the inflated costs of the dishes way over. Due to this fact alone, I'll likely not be back. There are a TON of options in North Beach to try which don't have such a high opinion of themselves.
author: Jenifer W.

description: My friends frequent this restaurant often so I thought I would stop in before a long drive out of the city. I went and sat at the bar and had a bartender that was less than pleased to be at work. My meal was average and would not have stayed and hung out as long except I had a local sitting next to me that was entertaining. He loves the place also, I might try again someday.
author: Ellen H.

description:
We visited for drinks and it was okay, but a tad boring.

We opted to just have drinks and go elsewhere for dinner after seeing some what the food served.  Great wine list if you want a bottle but sparse by-the-glass selection.
author: Kevin L.

description: First time of many I'm sure. Greeted warmly and professionally at the door when we arrived. Then brought to a nice table on the main floor. Our server Nino was terrific...knowledgable, made suggestions, and had a gray sense of humor. Can't wait to go back.
author: Philip C.

description:
Went there last night for a friends anniversary dinner.  Surprised by the terrible service for a $$$ restaurant. The warmth was pretentious and waiters condescending. We like our food but don't need the attitude. 
Tiramisu was great, food average. Avoid this place
author: Karan K.

description:
First of all, the main person who took my reservation was very gracious and accommodating.  I had trouble finding the location but after calling to let him know I would be late with my date, the gentleman said, "NO PROBLEM, seniorina... "
As soon as I got there there was this wonderful gentleman who looked and said, "I shall give you the best seat in the house!"  I felt so wonderful and grateful and he did indeed give us the best seat in the house.  I had a wonderful glass of pino grigio and the grilled salmon.  Wonderful wonderful wonderful.  Our waiter was gracious and so Sicilian and had a great mustache.  Thank you for the wonderful experience.. because of you guys, I enjoyed it thoroughly and would say hope to see you again!
author: Rudia L.

description: I have been working in San Francisco a month, and this may be my favorite place. I have had several dinners here-- all excellent. Try the veal shank-  amazing . Friendly staff and management.    Terry
author: Terry B.

description: Initially a good first impression then it went downhill.  Wife ordered linguini with fresh clams; linguini with canned clams was also on the menu for a lesser price.  When the dish arrived, it was apparent that a mistake had probably been made.  Clams were small, salty in taste.  There were no clams in shell.  Waiter's arrogant response was "this is what you ordered, you should have written down what you wanted."  When the check arrived, lo and behold, we were charge for linguini with fresh clams!!  Although he corrected the check, the waiter's arrogance and attitude was unforgivable
author: Tom S.

description:
Great place. This is the kind of old-school Italian place we've been looking for, which we've had trouble finding anywhere else. When you walk in and the waiter has a great Italian accent, that's definitely good sign.
