I had spaghetti carbonara, and my wife had gnocchi. Both were excellent, and I've had carbonara in probably 30 or 40 places around the world, and this was very good.

We finished with a chocolate mousse torte, and lemoncello. Again, hope very good. We're definitely coming back to this place, and wish we had something like this closer to home.
author: Eric M.

description:
Excellent service and authentic Italian fare with excellent service by Ivano and the maitre d'..
Vongole with baby clams superb and osso buco excellent. Valet service excellent.  hot Zabaglione excellent,perfect balance.  wine suggestions perfect. could be in NY or Italy, for certain.
author: S S.

description: I came here as I recommend restaurants for work and was curious to check it out. I was dressed casual as I had been out in the park for the day and felt very uncomfortable. I know this is a "higher end" restaurant but a paying guest is a paying guest. I felt like we were not given the best treatment because of our casual dress and the place had a pretentious vibe in general. The food was good- but not exceptional and for how much everything cost (this place was super expensive, even for SF). Maybe a better spot for older crowds but I certainly won't be recommending NBR nor dining myself here again. The competition is just too stiff and I was overall very unimpressed. I guess a note to self also is to not forget your business cards nor dine in casuals. Regardless- will not be returning.
author: Alex F.

description: Not sure why they have such a low star rating. Every time I am in SF, somehow I always end up back here. Family run, stellar wine list and one of the few places a solo water can grab delicious did with great company at the bar. Never had a bad meal. Highly recommend. The owner, peter, he can hook you up with a tasting at their winery in napa. They are the only US maker of Brunello wine.
author: Meredith F.

description:
Horrible experience. Started with reservations made by our hotel but we were seated at a tiny table near the kitchen. The food actually made it worse.

I understand al dente but my wife ordered the special lasagna that the menu said took 20 minutes....and it arrived in less than 10. Surprise! It was severely undercooked as was my ravioli. We also felt very rushed and this was just a huge disappointment from beginning to end.

We walked down the street to get a drink and stumbled upon the Volare Trattoria. Food looked great, the staff made us feel at home and I would recommend trying them instead.
author: Stuart G.

description:
Molte bene

good old school italian in the North beach area.

great service and very attentive

food choices are very solid and good variety
author: Stephen R.

description: I'm from Emilia Romagna so I am superpicky about italian food since it is typically 50% sicilian 50% american but this place is authentic and very good. NOT cheap but for the food and the area is perfectly reasonable. Carpaccio was good, I had Tortellini Supreme, they didn't have prosciutto as in the authentic recipe, but they were still very good. My friend had tagliatelle with ragu' (aka bolognese sauce) and the sauce tasted like it is made in my area. But there are many other things you can try, to taste real italian dishes that are not just tomato and mozzarella. The service was also pretty fast for such restaurant.
author: Robby G.

description:
I came here for my wedding anniversary in 2011 and have been here a few times prior. I find 
the food and service to be consistently good.  Are there better in SF.. I'm sure, but we haven't had a bad experience here yet and hopefully won't in the future.  We either walk from our hotel or valet park. 
I read some reviews that the waiter forced an order on them, but I didn't have that experience at all!
author: Lydia J.

description: We came here on the recommendation of s great friend worthy great taste. The food did not disappoint! I asked the waiter for his favorite pasta without about 7 dishes in mind that if he would've mentioned I would have ordered. He - Antonino - was decisive in the mare chiaro so I trusted his recommendation... And it was phenomenal. My sis had the tagliatelle bolognese and it was fabulous too. Delicious!
author: Elizabeth B.

description:
This is my first Yelp review.  The meal we had tonight was so very good; I just had to pay my compliment! 

The service was top notch.  I had the minestrone soup which was truly excellent. My date had the salad, very good also. 

The bread was ok, but I have had better.  The lasagne and cannelloni were both amazing!  Had the bottle of Petroni 2006 Brunello Di Sonoma. Having just returned from Italy, I was very impressed with this wine. 

You can't go wrong with this restaurant.
author: Tom P.

description: We walked in without a reservation because the menu looked inviting. We were warmly welcomed by the maitre d and immediately seated. The waiter (Matthew) was by our table before we had even settled in. Matthew made some wonderful recommendations (listen to him) and picked a wonderful wine for us. The atmosphere was relaxed and welcoming. The food was great and the service phenomenal. Will definitely go back but only if we know Matthew is going to be there. Make sure to ask for him. He was the cap on a wonderful experience.
author: Jean H.

description: The service was awesome!  Very friendly and seasoned.  The food was just ok, was a little disappointed.  The wine list is extensive, but marked up to much.  Looked for a good cocktail and the highest end bourbon was makers mark.  I do not think I would go back, which is disappointing , because the staff know what they are doing.
author: Neal S.

description:
Over 25 yrs. this restaurant has been our five star fav. You will never miss with  it in dining, service and ambiance. This time our waiter was D---. We won't mention the name not for his service or wonderful on the mark  suuggestions. But when it came to paying  I gave him two hundreds and the billl  was $ 150. I told him to give me back $20. That would have given
him a twenty percent tip. Instead he brought us back thirteen dolars. My husband told him we were short. And maybe he was just mistaken(the waiter.) He pulled out his WALLET and gave my  husband a ten.I have never seen that. The waiter makes change from his wallet? We gave him a lesser tip and did not smile at either him or the maitre d' as we left but I did give the maitre d' a glanc back to D---. Will we go back? You bet, it is too good to be missed. Wll we count  our change?    You bet. That is why we gave it four stars.
author: Ruth E.

description: The food was delicious.  The calamari steak was tender and well sauced.  The service, however, was terrible.    Our server acted like we were interrupting his evening.   I had told him it was a special occasion, a birthday.    He didn't even offer us a dessert menu.   So disappointing.
author: Cathy K.

description:
Everytime I travel to San Francisco I come to this restaurant. The people have known me an my family for some time. This trip was no different. When I tried to use Yelp to make a reservation the times were not good for us but then we called and they said they would have a table ready for us. The service is great as it always has been which isn't a surprise as the same people have worked there for a while. You can also see the owner walking around which I like because it shows how he cares.
At every Italian restaurant I order the same dish of Penne Bolognese and North Beach Restaurant has one of the best I have ever tried.
author: Daniel B.

description:
Very classic, old-school Italian restaurant.  

The service was excellent, the food decent, and the wine outstanding. 

It wouldn't top my list of favorite SF restaurants, but for what it is- it is one of the best.
author: Jeanette W.

description:
SO FAR THIS IS MY FAVORITE ITALIAN RESTAURANT!  FRESH FISH!  They are so strict about having fresh fish that if they don't think it's fresh enough then they will temporarily take it off the menu until they can get it fresher and recommend the closest think to it instead of lying to and covering it up in a lot of sauce which some other restaurants might do.  

Owner Lorenzo Petroni MAKES HIS OWN WINE.  MAKES HIS OWN VINEGAR.  MAKES HIS OWN OLIVE OIL because he owns Petroni Vineyards in Napa, not to mention THEY CURE THEIR OWN PROSCIUTTO inside the restaurant in a separate dining room called the Prosciutto Room.  When the bartender wasn't to busy he even gave me a tour through the Prosciutto Room to go see it being cured.  

Good food, good service, and if you are driving there THE HAVE THEIR OWN VALET PARKING FOR $10 ($20 for non-customers).  Which is reasonable for how difficult parking can be in North Beach.  Lorenzo probably owns his own parking lot there too.

A MUST TRY FOR THOSE WHO LIKE GOOD TUSCAN STYLE ITALIAN FOOD SERVED BY AUTHENTIC ITALIAN WAITERS IN A MORE QUIET FORMAL SETTING.
author: Rudi A.

description:
I wish I'd spent more time with the lower-rated reviews -- they're spot-on.

I liked the fact that they split our green salad and caprese.  That's about the only thing that stood out.

The restaurant is fairly loud, and most two-top tables are in the traffic path to the kitchen and bathrooms.  Not a good place for a romantic dinner.

The food is average.  I had ossobuco and my wife had the eggplant parmesan.  Both were reasonably tasty, but definitely not worth the price charged, even for North Beach.

When the eggplant parmesan arrived, it was served with a side of potatoes.  We both thought that was a bit odd, but had failed to notice it on the menu.  My wife asked the waiter for a small portion of pasta to go with her sauce, and the waiter said something to the effect of, "oh, all I can do is give you one of the sides on the menu, like pasta with marinara sauce -- the kitchen won't give me plain pasta."  He didn't even bother asking.  Way to charm us.

When it came time for dessert, he rattled off the standard fare (tiramisu, zabaglione, chocolate mousse, cheesecake, etc.).  It was barely Italian.  I asked him which desserts were prepared at the restaurant (knowing well that when you see cheesecake on the list, it's probably the Sysco special).  He admitted that only the tiramisu and zabaglione were made there.  We both passed and had some coffee.

No one even noticed when we left.   That's a lot of restaurants' last chance to win your repeat business.  They blew it.

We won't be going back.
author: Scott H.

description: Food wasn't too shabby... Had pasta. Tons of wines to choose from. Our waiter was friendly although he seemed drunk and he was in a rush to get us moving when we still had half of our bottle of wine to finish.
author: Adriana R.

description: Loved this place, the pasta was very fresh and delicious. The desert was amazing. highly recommend this place. My husband and I will definitely go back.
author: Maria G.

description: Service and the food was great! Price are reasonable for very good Italian food. When in SF will make it a point to have dinner. I was 20 minutes late and they still seated us!!
author: Dennis D.

description:
I've never eaten here. And I never will.  I also don't write negative reviews because I don't have negative experiences at restaurants. This place breaks the mold. 

We innocently tried to park with the valet service at North Beach Restaurant. After the car was driven off, we started walking down the street to meet a friend at a near by restaurant before returning to North Beach. The valet started screaming at us aggressively that we couldn't do that. Underline AGGRESSIVELY. I replied with, "then bring us the damn car."

30 seconds later I had this valet two inches from my face screaming every obscenity in the book. "YOU F*&%$#*$ A__HOLE, YOU PIECE of S#$%, and on and on while practically spitting and fighting back his apparent desire to get physical. To say I feared for my safety is an understatement.

I walked inside and explained to the host that they had a real problem with their valet. He calmly walked outside and was met by the ranting valet who screamed and shouted that I was the one who was swearing at him and this was all my doing. The host told him to stop swearing, at which point the valet walked up to me and got 2 inches from my face again, without words, but just some sort of "I'm going to kill you" stare down.

Now I had no choice but to wait inside to eliminate the chance of further problems while we waited 15 minutes for the car to return. My only other option was to call the police because the management of the restaurant was clearly unable to control the situation. 

Upon leaving the valet slammed my door in an effort to display his so called professionalism to the owner who was standing outside. As we pulled away the valet stood just outside of the owner's site flipping us off and mimicking us like a 6 year old.

THIS PLACE SHOULD BE PUT OUT OF BUSINESS. And the age old "we don't own the valet" nonsense doesn't cut it.
author: Mindy L.

description: I walked into North Beach Restaurant asking for a point of contact for an auction donation for a non-profit organization in the Bay Area. I came here because my husband and I eat here when our families come to town. The man at the door quickly said they support only TWO organizations in the city for "over 30 years" and proceeded to say i worked so hard putting together the letter and envelope - he would immediately throw away my letter - and to keep it...totally belittled me and didn't even want to know what organization i was representing. Now that I think about it, I don't know why we even came here - the food is mediocre and overpriced. Needless to say the staff is forgettable. Not ever coming to this place again even though we live a block away.
author: Alexis C.

description: Always accommodating, always great service, always delicious! Best carbonara EVER!!! See you for dinner again tonight!
author: Danit B.

description:
Very much a fan of the North Beach Restaurant but falls short of what it tires to be.  Have bene here for both lunch/dinner and part of a large group with pre-fixed menus.  All of the time the food very good and the service was outstanding.  Food always tastes fresh with good (not great) flavor.  Service is always outstanding.  Wine selections great.  Pricing is a little high even for San Francisco.

Was here with my sister who valeted her car.  They parked it in a location and it received a ticket which was removed.  Had an issue with management to get it resolved but it eventually was resolved.  This left a bad taste in my mouth.
author: Patrick T.

description: Came here with a party of 4 and all of us thought it was excellent.  Service was prompt and attentive.  The server recommended a platter of appetizers which was excellent.  My friends order an ablone appetizer and the oso buco which they both said was execellent.  I ordered the cannelloni which was above average.  The tiramisu for dessert was a let down after that but the appetizers and main courses were so good, it didn't matter.  Wine list was extensive and reasonably priced.
author: DJ L.

description: Just great!   Took a group of 4 here for a business dinner while staying in Union Square area.   The waiter was great, created special dishes for us and guided us around the menu.   Not a swanky place but if you are looking for good Italian food with a great wine list then check this place out.
author: John N.

description:
The food was just average and a bit overpriced for the quality of the dishes. 
The service was excellent and very fast after we made it clear we were on a hurry to go see a play at the Fugazi. The staff was very accommodating and helpful. The restaurant feels old school in a good way, I think. It was loud in there , obviously, it's Italian - deal with it. Its very spacious and it was fully packed on a Sunday night but the wait was not bad. 

I would not mind eating there again but will definitely not be my first choice.
author: Adolfo D.

description: We chose this restaurant because of its high ratings and reviews, and were very disappointed.  The food is simply not worth the prices.  We ordered spaghetti carbonara (listed on the menu as the restaurant's specialty) and the chicken marsala.  The carbonara was just ok.  The chicken marsala was terrible- the marsala was very syrupy and much too sweet.  For an almost $30 dish, it was very disappointing.  Also, we expected the atmosphere to be romantic, as was suggested in other reviews.  But the lighting is bright and perhaps it was the acoustics of the room, but the restaurant was very loud.  We set out for a romantic, delicious dinner, and left feeling disappointed.  I know I've used that word three times now in this review, but that's the best way to describe the experience!
author: Lisa M.

description:
Found this place because of the reviews and the 4 1/2 star rating. 
The service at North Beach was really good. From the hosts to the waiters they were all nice and made sure we felt comfortable. I tend to search for the Veal dishes when i go to Italian restaurants and they had plenty to choose from. I went with the Veal Scallopini and my gf went with the Veal Parm. They cooked it perfectly, both dishes. Although we didnt have any wine, they have an extensive selection of wine with a wine cellar you can visit. The food came out pretty quick for the place being busy and all. I definitely have to come back and try out the pasta dishes as well. The portions i would say are perfect, not too much, not too small. I was stuffed so i didint have a chance to try any desserts although the Tiramisu looked delicious. If youre in the mood for Italian then this is your stop.
author: Ray P.

description:
Cute restaurant with old fashion servers in tux.

I came here for lunch on a Wednesday and the place was pretty quiet.  We were seated immediately.  

This is a good restaurant for business meetings.  I probably would not recommend coming here with a large group as it is a pretty quiet restaurant and a little on the stuffy side.  Service was very consistent and the food was delicious.

Valet parking was $8!
author: Jenn G.

description:
I was in the area with an old friend that I have not seen in 6 years and I decided to take her to this restaurant because she wanted to try some traditional local food of San Francisco. I have been at this place in 2003 and I remember eating a fabulous petrale alla mugnaia. I remember the restaurant also served the cioppino so I decided to try it again.
North Beach Restaurant is conveniently located at the intersection of Columbus Avenue and Stockton Street in the North Beach district. The inside is elegant and it has a typical Italian restaurant interior design and feel which means no pathetic Italian flags or photos of Naples and Sicily all over the walls.
Since I previously ordered a petrale alla mugnaia, this time I tried the cioppino. For drinking, I ordered a Moretti beer. While our meals were being prepared, our waiter brought us some garlic bread that I dipped in olive oil. When the cioppino arrived it looked very nice, it smelled very good and it tasted amazing. I like to eat good authentic food and I think that North Beach Restaurant's cioppino is definitely something to try if you visit San Francisco. The course came with a crostone, crab meat, one shrimp, one clam, one piece of cod and one mussel. It all was drowned in a tomato-based broth that perfectly accompanied the seafood. I really liked the cioppino with the only exception of the mussel which tasted gross (I don't know how to explain the bad flavor you get from a mussel that either tastes disgusting, it's not cooked or something in between). The side was a combination of brown rice (I think) and some small broccoli (not too soft and not too crunchy).
The waiters are dressed up with a black jacket and they are very polite which I like. I am a traditionalist when it comes to food and service so I appreciate that. We had the pleasure to be served by Luca, a gentleman from Firenze who was nice and very well mannered.
Several courses at the restaurant are in the $20 and $30 range but based on the food I tried, they are probably worth the price because after eating the petrale and the cioppino, I can guarantee you pay for the quality of the food and the preparation. The online menu lists several interesting things but I question a few options that to me do not sound very Italian like linguine with porcini & scallops (mushrooms and seafood just don't go together), combination of filet of veal and prawns (meat and seafood are not served together) and halibut (impossible to find in Italy). Aside from that, I see some errors like "lasagna" that should be spelled "lasagne".
All in all I give 4 stars to the restaurant because of I really liked it. I plan to go back again in the future to try other courses. I saw gnocchi [alla] piemontese which I definitely need to try since I was born and raised in Piedmont.
author: X. Y.

description: Fantastic!  Best Italian meal ever!   Can't wait to come back.   Must try the home cured procuito and the pasta de la cassa!
author: Rafa V.

description: Liked the generous portion of seafood with the fruti de mare. Small place, but good atmosphere with outside seating in Little Italy.
author: Ramon C.

description:
Do not choose this restaurant.  To begin with, we had a reservation and were given a poor table though it was not crowded.  

The bread was not fresh.  The pasta was okay (we tried four different kinds) but certainly nothing special - and therefore incredibly overpriced, averaging $25 a dish.  We suggested a shared pasta for our two children, but were told emphatically by our waiter that would be too little food (needless to say, it would have been plenty).  I asked for a nice glass of red wine and was brought a fine Sangiovese - at what I learned was $22 a glass.  

We gave a $28 tip on $140 bill and the waiter changed the amount to $38.  All in all, not worth your time or money in a city so full of amazing food and honest establishments.
author: Claudia G.

description:
My husband and I had never eaten here before, but had heard rave reviews. We had been to a restaurant for dinner and decided to stop in for dessert and wine. We walked in told the host we wanted a table for 2 for dessert and drinks. We waited for a table to be cleared and we lead downstairs and seated at our table.

The waiter came to our table and we told him we were going to order dessert and we wanted to order a bottle of wine. He looked at us, said: "So you aren't going to order dinner?" And we told him we wanted dessert and asked what he recommended and that we wanted to order a bottle of wine. He then mumbled something under his breath, took away the bread and water at our table and left without a word.

We sat and waited about 15 minutes and he never came back - no waiter even acknowledged us.

We finally got up and left.

Terrible customer service, and sadly, I have nothing to say about the food because we were ignored.
author: La Tache T.

description:
Great service 
Ambiance in basement/wine cellar was ok
Portion size is over generous and just average!
Great wine list was the highlight 
Would not return!
author: Nancy A.

description: Beautiful location. I felt like i had stepped into a film noir, and i was the italian mob boss. They talked me through their favorites on the menu, spoke italian (Grazie Signore!) And had an amazing wine selection to choose from. I recommend the veal.
author: Jon E.

description:
This place was good, not great. The food was fantastic, but if you're looking for great food and a fun atmosphere, this is not the place. 

When we walked in everyone was very fancy and polite. Service was great! 

Food: bread and butter was cold and not great. I always judge a restaurant on their bread and butter. Bread must be warm and butter must be room temp! How hard is it?! Their bread was stale and the butter was hard and not easy to spread. The bf and I split the Cesar which was fantastic. I got some fish which was good but not memorable and the bf got beef stuffed tortellini with Alfredo sauce and broccoli. It was delish! 

This place is pricey! Not worth it if you are looking to spend a pretty penny on a meal. There are so many better places! I suggest Park Tavern right down the street!
author: Kelly B.

description:
Unfortunately, I'm having to write a poor review of this restaurant. We were visiting friends in town for a wedding and had a large party downstairs. The food was fair, but the waiter had an attitude like none other. Maybe he had too many tables, I'm not sure. 

I didn't think much of it, until he auto grated our check with 20%. I used to serve so 20% is minimum for me. However when service sucks, I have no issue giving feedback. Which I did to the waiter and his manager. 

After I told the waiter he was getting sub 20% tip and why I thought it was water under the bridge. Only to check my Amex bill and found he changed the amount back to the original. It was a 4 dollar delta, but obviously it's the principal and the way it was handled. I now have to call during business hours and speak to the secretary to try to get it changed.

The manager was nice, but he took no action to prevent this type of feedback.
author: Damon C.

description:
My only disappointment in the restaurant is that the last time I was there, I was told that Manfred did not work weekends.  Boo!  I just love him.  I live in the Monterey area and he always recognizes me and my husband of girl friends.  He is full of wonderful suggestions, too.  

I actually think this may be my all time favorite restaurant.  Great food, great service. Not too pricey.  What more can you ask for?

The cannelloni is to die for.  A little rich for my system, but I always try to talk whomever I am with into getting them so I can taste.  I usually get the pasta with meat sauce.  It is PERFECT.  Not too rich, but delicious.  I also usually get the spinach salad.  Very light.  Love it.

I go here almost every time I am in SF.
author: Joni B.

description: I love the North Beach Restaurant.  Staff and management are welcoming and professional.  No 22 year old learning to be a restaurant manager here, staff are pros.  Many of the waiters are actually Italian.  Food is always great.  Pasta, veal, classics and a few originals.   Appetizers are fresh and tasty.   Full bar, outstanding wine selection, friendly bar tender.  Go early, sit at the bar and enjoy a drink while you wait for your table.  For visitors to SF, North Beach is our Italian neighborhood and the North Beach Restaurant totally reflects this.  Lots of locals eat here including a number of local celebs.  No dark wood and red velvet wall paper and drapes.  The dining rooms are warm and inviting.  Sit at a table for two up front and enjoy the view of a busy vibrant neighborhood or sit in the back for a more private intimate meal.  Attire is casual, sport coat and slacks even nice jeans are fine.   Great spot to eat at prior to seeing Beach Blanket Babylon ( it's a block away) or for a special event.  I noticed a few folks celebrating birthdays.   Parking can be tricky so Uber or cab works best,  if you must drive, valet can handle parking for just $8.00.   The other evening my date and I had two appetizers, two entrees, desert, coffee, sparkling water and a really nice bottle of wine.  Great service, never rushed, a perfect dinner.  Total cost $160.00.  Worth every penny.  This is San Francisco at its best.  Reservations are a good idea, especially on Fri. Sat or other normally business nights.  Reservations are not required.  go early you may be able to get a table.  Great, consistent spot
author: David C.

description:
Oh my yes please!  Best Italian restaurant, hands down!  

We had such a wonderful dining experience.  It began with our welcome.  They remembered it was our anniversary from my conversation when making reservations.  A nice touch.

Our waiter was attentive and informative and our meals were delicious. From antipasto to salad to entree we were in food heaven.  The  pasta in vodka sauce was out of this world yum.  My hubby ordered the veal parmigiana and it was amazing.   My favorite dessert from childhood is zabaglione.... Guess what?  Yep, it is on their menu.... And it is fantastic!

North Beach Restaurant is Food Heaven, you will not be disappointed...

And if you are playing tourist in The City, make time to see Beach Blanket Babylon, it's just across the street and you will have a deliciously fun night to remember!
author: Elle P.

description: The most heavenly gnocchi I've ever tasted. Favorite restaurant in Little Italy.
author: Kristina N.

description: Was recommended this place by a friend from Arkansas. I was skeptical.  He was right. I had the NY sirloin.  Cooked perfectly and delicious.  My son had the swordfish, again outstanding. Daughter had ravioli.   Yum.   Wife had spaghetti.  It was cooked Italian Stel, which means the noodles were stiffer than were accustomed to.  Not her favorite.  Tiramisu for dessert.  Gone within seconds.  A wonderful meal.
author: Kevin M.

description:
Pros: friendly, easy to find, varied menu selection, energetic servers wanting to provide you a great experience. Food selection was good, taste was good - fresh and flavorful however nothing to write home about. Its set in a nice area of SF so fun to stroll around after.

Cons: odd smell when you enter, lower level they call 'wine cellar' is a tad bit depressing, dark and dingy and located in the basement. Seating is uncomfy and the same chairs you'll find at a hotel banquet hall. Bread was not fresh. Pasta selection was heavy on the meat side - need better vegetarian options which is shocking considering this is SF. Wine choices were not good and the one glass I had was perhaps the worst I've ever tasted.

Its not a formal, high end restaurant even though the servers all wear tuxedos so don't be thrown off.
author: Jonny M.

description:
You want Italy - here you go.  

You can't go wrong at this long, standing spot.  I have been dining here forever and it never disappoints.  The food is delicious and varied and staff is friendly and fun.  

You definitely should have several courses and lots of wine.  My last visit was a holiday party with 14 of us and this was the third or fourth year we have held it there - don't know how we did not wear out our welcome already but maybe that will tell you something about the place.  You can have a good time there and they will take care of you.  

My last visit I had the rabbit off the specials list and it was excellent.  No Thumper or Bugs, just a great dish!

I've taken clients to eat there and they loved it.  So you can go there for a party or to impress.  

The prices are good too - not cheap but not a rip off - for good quality and tasty Italian food.  

Stroll the neighborhood afterwards and take it all in.
author: Why N.

description: Food was good, atmosphere and service were even better. Great old school vibe and an amazing wine list.  They offer valet parking, so take advantage of that if you can.
author: Bill J.

description: Outstanding on all accounts... menu, wine list, quality, service, and cozy Little Italy ambiance! My SO & I love Italian food and this place sets the standard for us. Too bad we can't find a joint anywhere in L.A. that can even remotely hold a candle. Guess we'll have to fly back to San Fran for another memorable visit VERY soon!!
author: Lisa R.

description:
Probably being generous given how much this place costs. I had the pasta putenesca and I must say it was easily the worst I ever had. The black olives totally overwhelmed everything else. The Cesar salad was impressively mediocre. 

So many other places in North Beach, do yourself a favor and save some money and have a better meal.
author: Greg C.

description:
5 stars every time.  Not sure how other reviews are so low, but every time I have eaten here the food has been absolutely delicious with outstanding service.  Maybe I have been lucky.

Waiters are super knowledgable, huge wine selection, can be pricey but worth it.

Raviolis are insane, chicken marsala unbelievable, spaghetti carbonara should probably be illegal.
author: Cameron Z.

description:
Went here on the recommendation from another restaurant. 

It is an Italian restaurant in the middle of the district just off Columbus. The owner also has a winery in Sonoma so it has a strong focus on good wines. We tried their red-wine and the brunello, both of them great wines. 

It took a little while to get a table. The restaurant was extremely busy and appeared quite a bit disorganized. Had to ask for ice water twice! 

We had Cesar salad for starters. It was OK but really not much of an experience. 

For mains we had sea scallops and Fillet of lamb. The scallops were extremely salty and in reality impossible to eat, so they were returned and replaced with veal masala. The veal had apparently been drowned in the Masala, so not a great dish either. The lamb was at best bland.

The waiter was anything but attentive. I would recommend that you stick to the bar and try their red-wine before you go elsewhere for dinner.
author: Henrik C.

description: Authentic Italian favors.  It's Florence in San Fran. A party of 9 sat intimately at a round table where we laughed, drank & exchanged repartee.  Our waiter's menu recommendations were spot on; meals was brought out promptly.  Flavors were fresh & tasty. Don't skimp on dessert it's the cutest bow at end of a lovely eating experience.
author: Laverne W.

description:
It's Sunday Funday at North Beach Fair. We could have gone back to the US Open, but 2 days in a row at the Olympic Club... It was the trek out to Daly City that turned me off. So it was my 1st time @ North Beach Fair. Yeah not a fan. I was @ Union St Fair a couple of weeks ago, which is usually my kind of scene, but I thought that sucked too. So I guess I'm getting older, prefer just a nice glass of wine & phenomenal food and ambiance, which always puts a smile on my face. 
So I was literally ready to leave NB fair, when we noticed the sidewalk seating of this Italian restaurant. 
I've been here before years ago. So I'm reviewing my experience today. I wasn't really hungry to eat anything. I just wanted a glass of wine. We sat outside which was great to people watch.  
Nicola, our Italian waiter who was all dressed up in a tux, was super friendly. We took his advice... Brunello di Sonoma Poggia Alla Pietra (Petroni Vineyards) was absolutely amazing! And the mussels were so delicious. 
The best part, was when someone called out my name... I thought I was pretty incognito w/ my cool US Open hat that I got yesterday & my shades...  I know SF is way too small; bound to bump into an old flame:(
So this guy just told us how he swore to himself that he would never return to this restaurant after a bad experience he had back 1997. So I laugh, then you shouldn't be sitting at our table...
Well I have to say this place is great for a business meeting. I just got asked for my CV, and I'm not even looking for a job. Funny how I've always been interested in learning more about legal consulting... and without even trying, I just got asked to read his depositions and get paid for it... nice! So all is good.
author: Myra M.

description: Love this place. Food is excellent and the service is impeccable. The caesar dressing is the best I've had. Love love the carbonara. The veal Parmesan was so good too. You must go.
author: Carolyn F.

description: Thanks to our wonderful server Alex D, we had a great dinner. Knowledgeable and friendly service, what a gem! He suggested the Brunello 08 made by the owner. Appetizers were delicious, as well as the pasta perfectly al dente. We had no room for dessert but Alex talked us into trying the rum tiramisu which was a perfect ending to this yummy meal.
author: Sang A.

description:
A classic Italian restaurant in North Beach for sure.  We had a party of ten and the whole night was great.  As we three sisters walked over to the bar, Italian gentlemen, handsomely dressed, and clearly regulars, offered us their seats.  Fun from the start of a two hour dinner affair, the place is popular and with classic appointed decor.

Our table was ready for a family celebration and our waiter could not have been more professional.  From appetizers to dessert we were  constantly taken care of.
A couple shared the crispy calamari, but we all had to taste; perfecto.  Some of us had the half Caesar salad with fresh Parmesan cheese.  1/2 order was ample and very good.  From Petrale stuffed with crab and shrimp, to filet of lamb, everyone was happy.  My only complaint was that I found my Osso Boccu to be fatty, although the dish with polenta and veggies was good.

You must try their Zabaglione with strawberries.  Out of this world!

Ciao!
author: Rose J.

description: Great service. I had the lamb chop special  which was delicious. Wine menu has some lovely Italian wines.
author: B R.

description: So this has been one of our faves in the City. However, tonight we're feeling very ripped off. We got talked into the special which we were told was veal with broccoli and pasta for two. Waiter didn't tell us it was $64. The waiter also told us we "must" have the mushrooms. My husband asked for a nice glass of red. When we got the bill, there was an appetizer added that we didn't have, the pasta (which we were led to believe was part of the dinner) was an additional $16, the mushrooms were an additional $30 (!!!!) and the glass of wine was $22.  $300 later (before a tip), it's no longer our fave.
author: Laurie L.

description: This is probably one of my favorite restaurants of all time! I've traveled the world lived in Italy and it is the closest thing to Italy as it gets the food is homemade everytime I come to San Francisco I try to go to North Beach restaurant several times during my stay. If you are fortunate enough to come to the beautiful city of San Francisco I highly recommend coming to North Beach restaurant for lunch or dinner and as well the staff is excellent I really have nothing bad to say only great reviews for this restaurant
author: Sherri B.

description:
I feel a little bit guilty giving a low rating after sampling only 2 items, but we were very disappointed. After fireworks on Independence Day, we wandered around with the masses to find dessert.  A friend had recommended North Beach Restaurant once before, so we decided to give them a shot.  Everything started out fine--nice decor, good ambience, friendly service...but then we ordered the tiramisu.

If this was not an Italian restaurant, or if it was located somewhere with few Italians or little competition, I might be more lenient, but this was among the worst examples of tiramisu I have ever tasted.  The cake/ladyfingers was overly soaked, so was mushy.  There was not enough filling between the cake layers to provide that luxurious, creamy deliciousness that I expect from tiramisu.  It just had no flavor--between two of us, we didn't finish it, which speaks for itself.  There's just no excuse for this, especially in North Beach and at these prices.

They get 2 stars because of the aforementioned service, etc. and because the prosciutto and melon that hubby ordered was pretty good.  We won't bother going back, though.  There are too many other options in the area that deliver excellent cuisine at much more reasonable prices.
author: Areena M.

description: Had the Shrimp in Vodka sauce dish, which was nothing to rave about. The 2 stars goes specifically for the service- the waiter was horrible! He was not welcoming, informative, and could not recommend a dish to save his life. Out of all places you would think they would have a big wine selection, that was a major disappointment. My biggest mistake was coming here for Valentine's Day.
author: Neera P.

description:
Located right in the heart of North Beach, this has to be one of the best Italian places in the City. If you're of Italian descent, have a good Italian name, and don't speak Italian; be warned. Don't say your last name the ethnic way. They'll start spouting off Italian faster than cutting off someone in Rome.

I usually stick with the veal saltimbocca, but the risotto is so decadent. The only thing that could make this place better is if they had tartufo for dessert. I won't fault them for it because a good tartufo is hard to find.
author: Don G.

description: Salty, touristy and corny. My hotel suggested I go here because I wanted fresh pasta. They had fresh pasta but it was so covered in salt I couldn't taste it. Three things on their standard menu were the "specials" for the night. Wine was overpriced based on experience elsewhere and the food bill should never have been well over $200 for 2 of us. Disappointing.
author: Jonathan D.

description:
This is really old world San Francisco. North Beach is the kind of Italian restaurant that makes you want to come in on a cold night, all dressed up with a bunch of family.

They have a beautiful bar, and the people have been there forever. I was fortunate enough to go with a friend that has dined there a zillion times (even as a small girl). So we were treated to the full family embrace.

The menu.... how to describe it? It rivals the old Italian restaurants on Long Island, it's very east Coast. Lots of traditional dishes, all with their own super spin on things.

Our meal:
- Spicy hot angel Hair pasta - SO EXCELLENT
- Baby lobster tails, in butter with potatoes (died and gone to heaven)
- Tiramisú - how can you pass it up? I'm not a Tiramisú fan, but this was really smooth & creamy.

The service was excellent, the food hot & delish. 5 stars
author: Maureen B.

description: Oh my GAHHHH now THIS place is the real deal. High class n old world, great ambiance, food was incredible. Best lasagna ever and my hubby got the bolognese tagliatelle. We moaned with every bite. They are very proud of their wine that they make themselves and let me tell you, it's worth the 100$ we paid for it. This was a classy joint and so far has been my favorite dinner so far in San Fransisco. They got it goin' on. The balsamic vinegar is great mixed with the fruity olive oil to dip the fresh bread in. Can't say enough great things about North Beach Restaurant.
author: Bonnie B.

description:
I have loved North Beach Restaurant from the first time that I ever ate there. The service is impeccable and the staff are incredibly friendly. Their linguini with clam sauce is the best I have ever eaten hands down. The steak caruso also melts in your mouth. I have never been disappointed by this restaurant. I have spent many birthdays eating here.

The absolute best thing on their entire menu is their cold zabaglione. It comes with fresh berries and is my favorite dessert in the world. They always tell you that the hot zabaglione is better, but I much prefer mine cold. Amazing.
author: Bernadette R.

description: Wonderful Italian restaurant.  Always crowded and great for groups.  Most people don't know how to each here though.  In Italy you get many courses including one with pasta and one with salad.  Each course is shared among your family or friends.  In the US we don't usually share, so we miss out.  Best to ask for more plates and share every dish here. It was amazing to see how many people nibbled on each others plates when they could have had a bit of each others.
author: Mike N.

description: The food was good. It wasn't the best Italian food I've ever had but it was good. The restaurant itself is a little stuffy if you are just looking for a casual meal. One plus about this place is the valet parking. North beach is impossible to park in so for 10$ this is definitely worth it. The service is good and the food is good. It is a little pricey, especially given all of the Italian restaurants within 2 blocks and seems to me like more of a special occasion place. The menu has several options and the wine list was very full as well.
author: Cara C.

description:
We stopped in here before a showing of Beach Blanket Babylon for an early dinner.
This is truly old school North Beach Italian. The tuxedoed waiters give excellent service, and the food was wonderful, with good portions.
We had the cannelloni (go for the cream sauce) and the gnocchi with gorgonzola. 
Truly a classic San Francisco experience.
author: Ken P.

description: There must be far better places to eat Italian food in SF.  Our appetizer plate was decent, although the veal shank was a cold terrine, which was not at all expected.  The entrees were decent.  My wife had the pasta bolognese, my friend had the osso buco, which was also good.  I had grilled lamb chops.  They were cooked fine but could have used a little sauce or juices on the plate.  The veggie was some mysterious combination of mushrooms and I'm not sure what else.  The desserts were bad.  My tiramisu tasted strongly of rum and espresso, which overpowered the dish.  The warm zabaglione was just gross, but that was my first experience with zabaglione and maybe it's supposed to taste that way.  Not an awful experience, but clearly there are better options out there.
author: Gary F.

description:
I live in North Beach and had yet to visit this restaurant, so when two old college classmates of mine came into town I knew just the spot.

We had reservations and as we walked in we were immediately seated by the gentleman up front in the tux. As soon as we were seated the waiter was ready to get us settled in. He brought us water, and a variety of bread (focaccia, french, rustic) and I ordered a glass of Shiraz (it was a looong work week).

Appetizer: Cesar salad--Very flavorful, was split between us 3 (larger portion)

Main: spinach ravioli in bolognese sauce-- delicious! I was so impressed by the flavor. I have been to too many Italian restaurants where their sauces are bland. Bravo!

The wine itself was also very smooth. Overall the experience was excellent. My wallet and I will be returning!
author: Angela B.

description:
Service- excellent! Very friendly wait staff! Good humor!

Came in on a Sunday night with my bf and nephews and had a fabulous time!  We ordered a bunch of items and shared. We enjoyed calamari, Cesar salad, fettuccine Alfredo, meat ravioli, and salmon.  All were good!

Great wine list as wee!
author: Elizabeth G.

description: Wow, my wife and I loved our first dinner here. Service was outstanding. Appetizers were fresh and excellent. Our entrées were fabulous, one a special and one a variation  of a menu item offered to my wife when she asked questions about the menu. We will come back again next time we're in the city. I can't believe this place has such mixed reviews. Hopefully our next visit will be as good.
author: Kyle C.

description:
This place is SOooo good.  The food is excellent, and the service impeccable.  We had four different items at our table, and each of my guests raved about their food.
Thanks, North Beach for a great evening !  Your food was great and the service made us feel special...
author: Steve G.

description: Came here for my boyfriends' graduation and loved it! We had so much food that night and it was all very lovely. The servers were extremely nice, I loved that one of the servers really wanted to get a good picture of all of us and kept changing the lighting to make our pictures look good. I'm definitely planning on coming back!
author: Star B.

description: little Italy in San francisco is such a cultural place! We decided to try North Beach Restaurant. I loved how pretty and quite it was inside and how nice the workers were toward us being there. There is a wine cellar downstairs I did not have the chance to see but I heard it is spectacular. The food was okay, I had a fettucine Alfredo pasta that I enjoyed but could not finish and tried the escargo but did not like it much. My family members like their dishes for the most part. The Veal was not so tasty but the lasagna and eggplant dishes were good as well.
author: Izabella S.

description: Cozy and traditional Italian restaurant. Food is great and staff is friendly and attentive. I have dined here for ten years and have brought family and friends. Highly recommended for both lunch and dinner.
author: Mari W.

description: Great service, accommodated vegan options graciously, tasted great.  If they offer you a taste of their wine, know that it's 90.00 a bottle or 22.00 per glass!!!!!!!
author: Courtney E.

description:
I was 100% surprised. I cannot tell you how many times I have driven or walked past this restaurant only to dismiss it. From the name it's too old, too touristy and just too much of a trap. I was completely wrong. 
The restaurant itself during the day (came here on Saturday during the Fleet Week Celebration) is white tablecloths and clean, nothing spectacular. The service is IMPECCABLE. From our server dropping my napkin perfectly in my lap, to his description of the wine list to his attentive nature I began to rethink my impression of this iconic place. The burrata appetizer with prosciutto and cantaloupe drizzled with balsamic was better than great. Again our server went beyond expectations by dividing the food into two portions. I ordered the Penne Della Casa and although the portion was small it was just enough to last me all day. Rich and decadent with freshly grated Parmesan. Divine. Next time I show up hopefully my dining companion will be better but hey, the food was excellent.
author: Sherie R.

description: I'm a little partial to this place cause it's the first place I ever had gnocchi in my life (back in '98) and I loved it.  Haven't been in a while as I live in NYC now, but from what I remember, it was great.
author: Elton W.

description:
Learned about this place through a local friend in SF....it was divine!  The homemade burrata with tomato and basil was delightful.  I love fresh burrata!

For dinner, I enjoyed the special which was the Petrale Mugnaia - Sautéed with White Wine, Lemon and Butter Sauce. The sole was perfectly cooked and was delicious.  

Next time I am in SF, I will definitely go back!
author: Gina S.

description:
I've been a few times over the years and it's always seemed like a lot of fuss over nothing, your basic bland American-Italian restaurant, but putting on airs like your rich uncle's third white tuxedo wedding more than the classic bottle of red, bottle of white, Brenda and Eddie Billy Joel kind of thing.  If you've got a rose and a date, don't mind the formality, and you've got a patient flair for stuffed shirt camp this might be your place.

Having said that, the bridge-burning behavior of the valet the other night makes me never want to patronize the place.  After circling many blocks my friend had finally found a legal, metered parking space right across the street and was backing in.  A valet in uniform, a medium short stocky guy with crew cut hair, ran from across the street, motioned for someone he seemed to know to make a U turn from in front of the restaurant, bumped my friend's car, and announced that it was his spot.  When she initially refused to leave he said he was going to call the police.  I've seen these situations before and if the police aren't on somebody's pay they'll tell the valet to go to hell, you can't claim a parking space by playing zone offense, but when you have a new car with a nice paint job you don't want to challenge people over a parking spot.

Who the $%# do they think they are letting their valet treat the neighbors like that?  This happened to me once before, a well known steakhouse, and guess where else I'm never going to return?
author: Gil S.

description: Needs some updating with the decor, but the food is some of the best Italian I've had in San Francisco. Great service and very accommodating!
author: Jeremy S.

description:
The food is good. No doubt about it. I'd say the food is a 3.5-4.0 star experience, but the value just isn't here.

We had the veal parm and the lamb chops - both were great. However, the food is overpriced and the service is mediocre. $31 for a veal parm is absurd, no matter how good it is. This isn't Gary Danko, it's red sauce tuscan italian food - not complicated cuisine, so let's not make it seem like your dishes deserve Michelin Star price tags.

Additionally the wine list, while impressive, is over-priced as well. It's over-priced to a point where it is clear they are intentionally try to get you to buy $100+ bottles of wine. There are very few value wines, priced in the $50-100 range and the ones that are were Kendall Jackson priced at $60, which you can buy for $10 @ the store. I enjoy buying wine with dinner and have no problem spending a lot of money, $100+ on bottles, but when there is clearly over the top mark ups and lack of value, it becomes a hurdle for customers.

Overall, good food, over priced, and not a great value.
author: Justin O.

description: The server was Luis, amazing!! Old school professional. Great service! Food pretty good. Old school good Italian. Wine list impressive but a bit overpriced. The owner is a total D Bag. Prejudice, rude! I had an unfortunate date and had to cancel the food before it was made. The wine my date ordered wasn't touched. The owner made me pay for it. Even though he saw my date leaving and not touching it. If you want good reputation you don't do that. Let your staff do the work sir. You have no business being in customer service! Beware of the owner!
author: leonid v.

description:
Went here years ago and recently re-visited.   Boy, was I disappointed.   A once-elegant Italian restaurant with great food and service had morphed into a trendy touristy restaurant.  Tables are now jammed into every nook and cranny resulting in a high noise level, even when speaking to fellow diners across the table.  Barely room to squeeze between tables when leaving to use the rest rooms.  Service was okay but nothing to write home about.  The food was also, just okay considering the price and area.  

In future I will take my business to the many smaller and wonderful mom and pop restaurants in the North Beach area.  If you're going to pay these prices, at least get the ambience and the food that should come with those prices.

Very disappointed!
author: Wendy M.

description:
I am from the east coat and have trouble finding decent Italian joints.

This was a nice place to eat.  It wasn't too dark and the people we sat next too were friendly and my girlfriend and I talked to them about their weekend and what we got and how it was.

I got the veal saltimbocca and it was damn tasty.  She had the halibut and i thought that was closer to three stars.  We had the prosciutto of course as an appetizer.  It was not bad.  We each had a glass of wine which we each enjoyed.  I had the tiramisu, which is more on the wet side which I like.  It lasted about ten seconds before I was done.

We spend about $135 for the two of us after tip which was not bad.  We were not rushed out or feel it was too stuffy.  We walked from out hotel so we had no car / valet issues. I would come back again.
author: David S.

description: What amazing restaurant! The food was delicious, the waiters are really nice. I had penne arrabbiata, tasted exactly as I expected. Others really enjoyed their food. Even though it is pricey, it worths every penny!
author: Reem O.

description:
My family is usually cautious about eating out Italian, because nothing is better than Grandma's tomato gravy (the best in the world), but I could confidently say that this restaurant surpassed the precedent, set by my grandmother, for what Italian food should be.

Our waiter, Marco, was not only knowledgeable about everything on the menu, but extremely kind and funny. 

The food was, without a doubt, absolutely perfect. Not just my food, but every bite of everything that my family ordered. It was the type of food that you never want to finish, the type that changes your perception of food overall, and that is not an overstatement. They serve amazing food in an amazing environment, and I would highly recommend it.
author: Darien F.

description: This place is a fantastically convenient location for a pre or post dinner if you're seeing Beach Blanket Babylon... it's a short walk from the theater and has good food. It's pricey but is almost worth it due to the proximity to the theater alone and the portions were surprisingly large. An added bonus is that they're an Italian restaurant that offers more than just pasta dishes; they had a pretty extensive menu. I had the Chicken Toscana-- good sauce and the accompanying veggies and potatoes were pretty good. Classic Italian atmosphere complete with great hosts and waiters that seem to enjoy their job. Although the food and service was good, I'm only giving 3 stars because the food wasn't anything special... It was good Italian food, but not anything unique or worth telling everyone about.
author: Kiki C.

description:
You'll never go wrong here.  The maître d' will welcome you with genuine warmth.  Waiters are knowledgeable, efficient and friendly -- they won't hesitate to make you a recommendation.  This place is not trendy --  it's old-fashioned Italian food, freshly made and full of flavor.  Great pasta made daily, with an assortment of sauces.  Wonderful Petrale sole from their own boat.  Delicious calamari vinaigrette and succulent caponette.   An excellent "California Brunello" from their own vineyard.  And the lightest tiramisu on earth.  

Try the Spaghetti Lorenzo, certified by UC Berkeley to have only 240 calories.  You won't believe the flavor!

I've been going here for 35 years and never get tired of it.
author: Jennifer K.

description: Fantastic Italian food with REAL Italian waiters like the old days.  Yum!
author: Laurie R.

description:
My wife and I went on a weekend getaway from Seattle to San Francisco.  We went to this restaurant before catching the Saturday night late show of  Beach Blanket Babylon.

I'm rating this restaurant low because after eating here over the years and having great meals, this was the second time in a row it was dissapointing.    The main culprit again was the food.  We both consciously said let's order something other than a pasta dish given our experience a couple years earlier.  

My wife ordered the veal chop medium-medium rare and when it arrived, she could hardly cut through it.  Tough and full of gristle. When we told our server about this, he simply offered to replace it with veal marsala cutlets.  That dish turned our to be okay, nothing remarkable about the veal, the sauce, or the potatoes and vegetables.  

I ordered the veal parmigiana and on our server's suggestion had them pound down a veal chop instead of using a cutlet. His comment was, "it will be so good it'll have you speaking Italian in no time!"   Unfortunately, I was still speaking English when I was done.  Very bland, and part of the veal was a little on the tough side.

On the non-food side, the ambience was great, our server Luis was very entertaining and efficient, just what you'd expect from the tuxedo'd old school Italian servers there.  (My wife and I did notice a bit of we're-living-off-our-reputation-attitude, but hey, you got a bunch of Italian guys running around, capiche?).

Unfortunately, we won't be coming back.  I generally figure a restaurant, even one as expensive as this, can have an off night food wise.  To have it happen twice in a row when our visits are every couple of years is just too much, especially when there are so many other good ones in the North Beach area.
author: John S.

description: Best Italian restaurant in San Francisco hands-down. Peter Petroni makes excellent food, wine and olive oil. Great service and reasonably priced for a restaurant of this caliber.
author: Danny O.

description:
I flew out to San Fran for work and found one of the best authentic Italian restaurant I have ever been in!
From their kind service through the great food and their extremely delicious deserts, 
every thing there was 5 stars level!!! 
Although the price was a little high the experience was worth every penny I spent there.
This place made my work trip to San Fran feel more like a vacation!!
author: Hila B.

description:
This place was recommended by the concierge at the Intercontinental. While I was not overly impressed, the restaurant was good enough to take note. 

The service was great! Our server had an accent which seemed to bring the ambiance as though you were in Italy. I ordered the special which was a sole of some sort. The fish was mild with great texture, for a guy who once did not like fish, this was pretty good. Could have used a little more flavor but I'm definitely not complaining. 

The table seemed to have enjoyed the dinner, based on the conversation after wards we all seemed to agree that the place was A-OK! 

Cheers,

O
author: Chris O.

description:
Food is over priced and poor value yet good.Same with the wine.Normal mark-up is three times.NBR mark up is 6 times.House wine is $90 and they own the vineyard.
Poor service with an attitude.Too many good places close by to waste your money here.If you want to spend this kind of  money you can do much better.You can do much better if you don't want to spend a lot of money.
author: Julian C.

description:
North Beach Restaurant features very good Italian food, a good wine selection, along with a truly professional wait staff.  Located in the heart of North Beach it has typical neighborhood ambiance.

Worth considering for an evening of good food in North Beach.
author: bob c.

description:
Disappointment. First, the staff is super friendly, mainly men, dressed up like old fashion European cafés. Everybody welcome you very well. All these positive smiles and warmth get erased once you eat the second course. If the second course isn't the best like the starter was, this time it's not because you didn't pick the right one, it's because the food here isn't good.
At the end you may decide to "share" a dessert because you doubt on the quality but still believe it can happen. Beh! The tiramisu is just as bad as the two other meals you had...in my case a tomato-mozzarella and cannelloni.  In the first one, the tomato wasn't ripe and was the cheapest faded red one on the market. The cannelloni tasted worst than a canned one. A lot of melted cheese to hide the floppy meal. :(
So, your very nice waiter and very nice staff start to make you think you have been ripped off. They all know the food isn't good, so they better smile at you.

Definitely a big disappointment :(
author: Claire P.

description: A good meal. I had the petrale (sole) cooked with lemon butter; sweetness had the petrale portofino (stuffed with crab). Both very tasty. It came with potato and a spinach type vegetable-kale maybe? We don't drink, but the wine list is extensive I understand. Service was a bit rushed, but our reservation was honored on time on a busy night. Seems there were important locals on the night we were there-lots of handshakes and Italian spoken. It was pricy, but not crazy pricy. I enjoyed the meal, but probably won't be back. Not because of anything bad, just not anything great.
author: Michael R.

description: Do it.... GO!!! We were a bit overwhelmed with the restaurant selections in San Fran.... We just knew we wanted something local.  We met a group of locals and they all said GO to north beach!  We were lucky enough to get reservations for the next night.  The ambiance was nice, quick paced, and extreme customer service!  Then there was the food...... Omg,words can not express how delicious it was.  I had the salmon and my husband had the sole stuffed with crab & shrimp.  We both licked the plate!  Had to try the tiramisu for dessert and it happened again.... We licked our plate! :)
author: Tricia R.

description: This restaurant had the best Spaghetti Puttanesca I have ever had.  The service was outstanding and I almost went back through San Francisco just to eat at this place.  The venue was open late and the people were very personable and friendly.  I loved this place.
author: Joe S.

description:
I'm impressed.  

I've lived in San Francisco all my life.  For years, I'd written NBR off as just another tourist restaurant.  When I went in there on Friday as the guest of an old friend from Tokyo, now a high-level Japanese businessman, I was expecting good company but only so-so food.  I didn't realize I could be so mistaken about a local restaurant.

NBR did a brilliant job of putting together a top-flight tasting menu, what the Japanese call omakase, a selection of their finest Italian cuisine.  The food was superb in selection, preparation and presentation, and the service was phenomenal.  I've never seen anything like it in a US italian restaurant!  NBR merged the best of omakase, many small portions of diverse specialties designed to be savored and not just ingested, with the subtleties of fine Italian cooking.  

Wines (three bottles) and grappa set the meal off to perfection.  Service, including lots of personal attention from the owner, was superb.

I'm impressed.
author: Paul S.

description: You are entering the world of very authentic Italian restaurant with old traditions and very on point kitchen. From the moment you enter a very welcoming host in Italian greets you and if you speak Italian you can keep up a full conversation. Everything is perfect from a great wine list selection to appetizers  and main courses - also New Yorkers keep in mind - California is moving very slow and I find it very annoying in regular restaurant in Cali to wait for an hour to get meals. It's different here - everything is on point - the food the atmosphere and an outstanding service - must have a dinner spot in San Fran!
author: Simon L.

description: Outdoor tables on the sunny side of a (relatively) quiet street in North Beach makes this a pleasant, dog-friendly place to have a delicious meal and people/dog watch.
author: Laura P.

description: The atmosphere was a bit somber for a Friday night.   Their wine list was very extensive.  Had the Pasta Della Casa, not a fan of veal, pasta was a little too firm for me.  However, the wine sauce was really good.
author: Jenise N.

description:
I went here for mother's day. I thought it would have been a perfect place to go eat at for some family time but I was wrongfully mistaken. On top of making us wait a long time to get a booster seat, we found hair in the salad. 

We decided to just tell the waiter and move on, it happens sometimes. They ordered us a new salad with NO hair.  

When our main dishes arrived, my plate had a bug in it! I wasn't too happy. We told the waiter and he took it off the bill.
author: Noel R.

description:
I had lunch here last Wednesday with a couple of co-workers and I ordered the scallops.  We had wine (white and red) and a beautiful caprese salad all was beautiful, enjoyable  food,   hey you are sitting in North Beach, that's worth something.  The waiter neglected to inform us that one of the items was not available until after all orders had been made and he didn't have to go back to the kitchen to find it out. Awkward moment.  

Cons - I made a reservation for 11:30am, they told us we had the earliest reservation ...we spoke to the head guy to tell him we were bringing some decorations for the table and a cake, he said FINE, come at 11:15. 

So we got there at 11:25am, the doors were open.   All other tables around ours was ready but not ours.  We were told to stand aside and let the waiter finish...they knew they had a group coming why didn't they prepare our table so it would be ready when we arrived? Instead we were told that we were "early" and the restaurant wasn't officially open yet...distinctly different than what we were told on the phone. 

It felt crowded in there. Rushed feeling.  The wait staff was full of themselves.  As if they know they have it made and YOU  are definitely not going to make or break them so you best get out of their way.  

They charged us $35 to CUT our cake and they did a hack job, my piece was just some whipped cream thrown on the plate.  The waiter even noticed it and apologized but did he fix it? NO!

The coffee is hideous. Parking is dicey.  


So, If somebody else is paying I would go back...wait...no I wouldn't.  I suggest going where you will be treated as the important person you are with consideration and respect , after all you don't get a discount price for not being a movie star.
author: BellaLissa B.

description:
Oh no.

Living in russian hill close towards north beach, we are quite limited in the good restaurants genre.  Gary danko, frascati, tony's, don pistos, okoze, house, nick's tacos.   

So on a nice sunny day we walked around and decided to try out north beach restaurant, one of the few restaurants in north beach that has more than 3 stars (barely).  First, I had no idea they were so big. Seats 150 people upstairs and 150 people downstairs.  They must have a free food night to make use of all those extraneous seats.  I still would not come.   

Coming from a weekend with lots of booze, I settled with just water which didn't seem to please the waitor.  The end 1/4 of the bread was rock hard.  My husband got the pasta della casa but got it with papperdelle. It was bland with an in house pasta they shouldn't even bother using.  I got an $18 mussel plate with which you would expect  1.quality  2. bit of quantity  3.freshness. FAIL FAIL FAIL. and I want a crostini dam*it.  Broth too salty with no depth.  I figured I'd try tiramisu and it was good enough.  This place isn't cheap.  Might as well pay a bit more and sit at Gary Danko's bar if you're nearby. 

Lesson learned. don't eat out on a monday in north beach when tony's and don pisto's is closed.
author: Hannah W.

description: This is a classic traditional San Francisco restaurant with outstanding Northern Italian food. That means it doesn't have young waiters who want to be your new friend. It implies that the waiters are professional and know what they are talking about. The food is consistently excellent but it is not in anyway "cutting edge."  I have eaten at the North Beach Restaurant hundreds of times. That makes sense since I was born and raised in a San Francisco Lugurian family. This is the kind of place my grandparents would have patronized if they could have afforded it. I am grateful that I can.
author: Dick S.

description:
The highlight of North Beach Restaurant was our waiter.  Very helpful, took the time to explain the menu, offered to prepare an appetizer for the four of us with their house cured prosciutto, burrata, tomato slices and basil.  Excellent.  
Three of us ordered the linguini with scallops and porcini mushrooms, very good.  The fourth person in our party ordered and thoroughly enjoyed the filet of sole.

The only negative was our 8:30 reservation turned into 9:00.  Granted they were slammed on a Saturday night, and I wanted to believe all reservations were 30 minutes behind, not so sure as we stood in the entryway.
author: Paula M.

description: Possibly my most favorite Italian restaurant from anywhere. Wine list fantastic. Get the Veal! Oh my.
author: Rich T.

description: I have two favorite restaurant in San Francisco and this one is one of them. Every time I visit SF I make it a must to eat here. I've been coming to this restaurant since 1978 when my father use to take me as a young kid. This is the first place I learned to eat escargots and I make sure to always order it as my first appetizer  each time I come.... No words can describe how delicious the food is. The waiters are excellent and so much fun. BTW, they cure their own prosciutto down in the basement. You have to try it. If you come here ask the waiter to give you a quick tour downstairs you're going to love it.
author: Admired Drunk V.

description: Impeccable old-school service by waiters in suits...your wish is their command. Food was exquisite. I've never had such wonderful fish (petrale sole), and there were 2 huge fillets on my plate. That plus the burrata and the prosciutto/melon appetizer and we were in heaven!
author: Rose N.

description:
We ate here on our last day in SF and my wife and I were very surprised at how all of the courses were superb in taste and quality.  I had the Risotto Pescatora and the portion was just right too.  Hadji out waiter gave us impeccable service too.  All in all this was the way to end our vacation!

I would highly recommend this restaurant!
author: Dave D.

description: The food is amazing and never disappoints. The house cured prosciutto is amazing and you must ask to see the meats hanging in the basement. The burratta was also a nice treat. The only downside here is the wine list. Prices are across the board and have little rhyme or reason to them.
author: Darin L.

description:
This restaurant has seen better days. I used to love this place. Back in 2001 through 2003, I came here consistently, sometimes as often as twice a week. Then my friend informed me that everything went downhill and I stopped dining here. Finally on April 9, 2011, I came back to give it a try. THOROUGHLY DISAPPOINTED. 

The quality was average at best, only that diners are PAYING A PREMIUM FOR AVERAGE QUALITY FOOD. The prosciutto appetizer was pretty good. However, the entrees left much to be desired; the food was salty and watery. The veggies that came with my entree didn't even look edible.

Quality wise, this place is about 2 stars at best. Yet with their prices, one would expect a lot better. As such, minus 1 star because of the ridiculous prices. 

Years ago, the name 'North Beach Restaurant' was a reflection of it's great pomp and excellence. On one occasion, I even saw Willie Brown (former mayor of San Francisco) dining here. Those days are gone. To more accurately reflect its current state, this place should be renamed 'North Beach Rape' -- for its impact on your wallet.
author: Willk W.

description:
I was unimpressed and sorely disappointed last night at NB restaurant.  Yes, I have been there in the past and always had a decent time as you can see from my previous post but last night changed it all.  

We had a reservation that we made about a week prior and they still sat us next to the kitchen when the restaurant was not nearly close to full.  Then the waiter got our cocktails wrong TWICE after ignoring us for a solid 15 minutes. I had ordered wine and specifically said when the main course comes out then bring the wine to the table... nope.. I was half way through my weak cocktail and then there was another glass of alcohol in front of me.  That is one thing I really dislike.  Let me finish what I am already drinking.  Are you in that big of a hurry at such a "top" restaurant that my request is not important?

The appetizers:

Carpaccio & Home-Cured Prosciutto - Combination:  to be honest, it was boring.  It didn't melt in my mouth and make me want more. I let my husband finish it.  I don't plan on ordering that again.

Calamari Vinaigrette (House specialty): Pretty good. It is a cold dish so if you are someone who likes their calamari fried this is not for you.  It wasn't chewy at all and the vinaigrette was a nice touch.  I would order it again.

Main Course:

(When it arrived the waiter spilled the sauce from one plate onto the table.  That could have been on my silk shirt dude.. I would have been pissed.  Again, are you seriously that busy that you can't slow down? Please try not to throw the patrons food at them.)

Sea Scallops - Sautéed in White Wine Mushroom Sauce: No complaints. Not the best I have ever had but the mushroom sauce was a really nice touch to the scallops.  It is a very rich dish so if you have a sensitive stomach this is not for you.  I like that the potatoes they pair with it are just lightly seasoned.  I wish the broccoli was also lightly seasoned instead of dripping with sauce.  

Combination of Filet of Veal and Prawns - White Wine, Lemon and Butter Sauce:  My husband wished he had ordered pasta.

Desert:
Cheesecake: YUM and yes I would order this again.

As for the price?  Expensive yes but not really worth it here.  If you don't mind expensive but you want really great Italian then go to Capanina in the Marina.  That is where you will find me when I have my next Italian craving.
author: Kylie L.

description:
Mmm...Italian food. Italian food is by far my favorite cuisine. Of course I'm a little biased because I am Italian. North Beach is a really good restaurant in SF that serves authentic Italian cuisine. They always greet my family by name when we dine here. Nice touch! 

We started our delicious lunch with an order of the antipasto. It includes veal, calamari, prosciutto and provolone with pesto, and marinated cranberry beans. One order was plenty of our party of seven. 

I always think about ordering something new. That's all I do...think about it. I end up ordering my usual favorite meal, the gnocchi Piemontese. I love how the gnocchi practically melts in my mouth. Perfection. 

Amazingly, I saved room for dessert. I ordered the cold zabaglione. Three words, one phrase...OMG! I could eat the cold zabaglione every day (of course if I did, I would probably be as large as a heifer). 

As we left the restaurant with our tummys full and happy, my cute little nephew caught the attention of an adorable elderly woman sitting at a table in the front of the restaurant. My mom said that she is a regular and that was her table. So sweet! 

I love places like this...where everybody knows your name and they're always glad you came. Cin cin!
author: Karen G.

description:
I admit that it has been a while since I have eaten here, but this has got to be my favorite, go-to Italian restaurant in the city. I'm not saying its the best, there are hundreds of great places. But it is my favorite, so much so that my wife and I had our rehearsal dinner here. 

The staff is very friendly, all very authentic. Occasionally I see who I am pretty sure is the owner and am also pretty sure is a Mafia boss. He also owns a winery in Napa. They even cure their own prosciutto; we actually ate in the room in which they do this once, with about 35 legs of ham hanging above us. Great ambiance!

Like I said, the staff is very friendly and always willing to talk to you about the menu, Italy, wine, life, etc. They have a very substantive menu, with about 30 different types/combos of pasta. And of course they can make just about any pasta dish they are missing. Off the pasta menu, the Osso Buco is exceptional. And finishing the meal off with some limoncello is always a good choice.

Writing this review made me hungry, I can't wait for my next visit to the North Beach Restaurant!
author: Scott C.

description:
This place is real fine dining. You will find that many local famous people/politicos come here and dine. The veal is perfect, they have a variety of italian dishes and  wine to choose from and the service and very attentive. Your not going to get huge portions but they are perfect portions.

Take a taxi if you come here or come early if you have reservations to find parking, but they do offer valet and that is very quick and easy too. This is one of my favorite real Italian restautrants in The City.
author: X X.

description:
My wife and I sat at the bar and had their polenta soup and tried their house wine.  The Polenta soup was tasty (tomato, polenta, cheese), but they really need to give you a knife!  Talk about stretchy cheese!

We tried their 2005 house blend for $22.  Not that great.  Very acidic red.
