So all in all, it was a nice place to sit in the sun for an hour or two, but I don't think I'll be coming back here for the food. It seems highly likely that you'd end up paying too much for unimpressive food.
author: Julie S.

description: Sadie and I took her two girlfriends here as a thank you for putting us up for a week. Went there after spending the day at Baker Beach (a great time).  Very good, but expensive Italian food.  Great wine list but again expensive-- suggest you stay away from wine by the glass.  Service was up to snuff.  Parking was a hassle. Make a reservation.  Will go back on our next trip to our favorite city.
author: Bob J.

description: I have been going to the North Beach Restaurant since Lorenzo opened it in the 70's.  It's expensive but the food is fantastic.  It's a delightful San Francisco experience.  If you want to treat yourself to something ot of this world...........order the abalone.
author: bert k.

description: One star for location and another for my pasta. Portions were large, and my spaghetti amatriciana was a perfect al dente. My dining companion had the eggplant parmesan and regretted it... a bit tough and not flavorful at all. I oogled the expansive wine list, but we weren't looking to drink a whole bottle. The selections by-the-glass were sad in comparison, so I settled with a Peroni. The maitre'd was definitely on crack and the whole experience just felt a bit rushed.
author: Erin M.

description: I have only had pizza here. I have never ordered any of entrees or dessert so I can't comment on that. Anyway, I think the pizza is pretty good. Not the best, but good nonetheless. Service, on the other hand, is extremely slow and mediocre and the wait can get ridiculous at times not because they are packed but because no one cares and they don't bother cleaning the tables and would prefer to keep people waiting. I'm honestly not sure if I'll be back.
author: Diane M.

description: My new Favorite restaurant in the City..  Took my family, including our HS age Italian exchange Student to dinner a couple of weeks ago and couldn't have had a better experience. The food was excellent. I had the best Calamari Steak ever and our exchange student thought the Gnocchi was almost as good as her grandmothers back home.  With Lorenzo (the owner)  looking sharp and sitting at the bar speaking Italian to some patrons, our Waiter, who was very attentive, with his thick Italian accent,  My older daughters (23,20) came away feeling like we were back in Italy.  Got a chance to speak with Lorenzo after Dinner and found out that he was from the same area (Near Lucca) where both of my grandparents were raised.  This place is old school.  As one of my daughters put it best  "some places try to be authentic, this place just was.."  we will definitely be back on our next trip to the City
author: Rex W.

description: The Osso Bucco was decent, but the two pasta dishes ordered by my party were waaaaaay over-cooked.  The waiter recommended a $90 bottle of wine, which seemed a little presumptuous for an initial recommendation.  It was also just expensive generally.  Throw in the fact that our bill was miscalculated...not the greatest experience.
author: Thomas K.

description:
i was luckily here for a business lunch because i can imagine the place jammed packed for dinner.  the food was quite delicious.  the best dish was the pasta della casa, really one of the best pasta dishes i've eaten.  the cioppino alla pescatora was excellent too especially if you dip bread in the sauce.  tried the some of the veal scaloppine alla bruno was great sauce but i thought the veal itself didn't have much flavor.  had the glass of syrah which was excellent.  tried some of the chianti and it was a good standard chianti.

the only thing i didn't like was that there was a piece of black hair on the broccoli side order.  i told the waiter and he was totally cool about it.  he just gave me a new one.  i don't know how most of you feel about it but actually hair doesn't gross me out that much because i can see how it could accidentally happen.  the waiter was nice and he gave me a new order of broccoli.  so i was ok about it.

i'd give this place a try again if i visited san francisco but not at dinner time.  like with any other place i eat, i'll just look carefully before i eat.
author: Norman S.

description: The service and ambiance are wonderful.  A great, old time, San Francisco institution.  I'm sure the wine is also excellent if you're a connoisseur.  Unfortunately, the prices are WAY too high and the food quality is way too low.    There must be a dozen places in North Beach that would provide a better dining experience.  Be sure to stay away from the chicken dishes and the Veal Saltimboca (with a piece of salty prosciutto draped over each piece of veal).  The one GREAT dish was their specialty soup (with polenta).
author: Mark B.

description: I didn't think this place was anything to sing and dance about but everyone I came with was losing their sh*% over it. The house made prosciutto was good and my chicken piccata was good. There was nothing remarkable about it it was just ok. The chocolate mousse and zabaglione were excellent though and I would go back just for dessert. 3 stars for the great dessert.
author: JoAnna S.

description: The service is nice and professional, and the food came out so quick!  The portions were a good size.  Its expensive but based on the atmosphere kinda expected.  I'm not sure that its anything special that I would definitely go back for but it wasn't bad.
author: Angeli J.

description: I took a date here a few months ago - the atmosphere and environment was nice, I was able to talk comfortably and didn't feel drowned out by the other patrons.  The food was decent but nothing too spectacular as Italian goes.  But I'm Italian myself and extremely picky when it comes to such food.
author: Anthony D.

description: My friend and I were visiting from Seattle.  A taxi driver recommended North Beach Italian Restaurant.  From the moment we walked in it was an amazing experience.  We had the Mozzarella, tomato and basil with fresh balsamic vinegar and olive oil appetizer.  Scrumptious.  I had the house pasta special Spaghetti Carbornara.  I usually shy away from pasta as I eat low carb but it sounded too good to pass up.  I could not get enough.  Best pasta I have ever had.  My friend had the special of the night Lamb Chops.  A month later we are still talking about the North Beach Italian restaurant and how we never had a better meal.  Pricey yes but so worth it.  And the service was excellent.  Can't wait to go back!
author: Jackie W.

description: The WORST customer service! My husband had been going to this restaurant for 20 years and started taking me there 12 yrs ago, but we will not be going back thanks to a horrible customer service nightmare we experienced. On our way out for a night with friends, we stopped in for a quick dinner. The waiter lost our debit card somewhere between our table and the cash register.  A debit card is a direct link to our bank account... AND THEY HAD THE NERVE TO SEND US A BILL FOR OUR DINNER and then call us when they did not get paid right away..WTF? Talk about ruining our night...not only did we have sit on the phone with the bank to deal with canceling our debit cards and putting a freeze on our account, but we couldn't get cash out to take as we went out with our friends. Now of course we did not go there looking for a comp on our dinner, but you would think that for all of the trouble and anxiety they put us through that night that they would at least not charge us for the dinner. Where's the customer service at North Beach Restaurant?
author: V S.

description:
I was very disappointed in this place.  We came after seeing BBB and just wandered around until we found it (our first choices had long lines, and we didn't plan ahead).  The service was spotty, nothing to get excited about for sure.

The bread was tasteless and some of it was STALE.  They didn't pour out the olive oil or vinegar so we had to do it ourselves and consequently poured too much.  It's a small detail, I know, but these things add up.

My entree was pretty bad.  It was the pasta primavera, and I swear those vegetables were frozen!  They had that chewy frozen vegetable texture and they were cut like frozen veggies - hello, the carrots were small and cubed - I paid $19 for that atrocity!  If they weren't frozen, I have to wonder why they tasted so bad!  The sauce had an odd smell, too.  My friend' s entree came lukewarm!  The other two friends thought their food was good, and I tried the spinach ravoli and will say it was decent but not great.  The pasta didn't taste very fresh at all.

This is a tourist trap.  We should have known when there was no line to get in while the good places were packed.  So you live and you learn, eh?  I won't go back!
author: Nishka B.

description: My grandma like's this resturant (this is where she was engaged to my grandfather). My mom likes this place, my rich boss likes this place, my hipster friends likes this place, I love this place. Great for a date. This place is so understated and simple that it is perfection. The food is perfection. Not a fake attempt at something old.
author: Pink G.

description:
So I really don't even know where to start. I don't normally go out of my way to publicly bash a restaurant but if they're willing to consciously rob people of their money by selling some cheap ass, frozen, pasty, overcooked, alien food then I have no problem exposing their attempt to make a quick buck off uninformed tourist that happen upon, what looks to be a pretty legitimate spot to snack on a meal.  That's the problem with most restaurants in north beach, they rely on tourists and the money they'll spend on any gruel you put in front of them. So when the owner of the restaurant has made making a buck off tourists their top priority, you get restaurants like North Beach Restaurant. Be warned.

So that being said, onto the meal! Lets start with the soup. Minestrone. So don't forget that you're paying top dollar for this crap and what North Beach Restaurant gives you is...Minestrone. Thanks. Who cares how it taste, it's minestrone and you're spending like $50 a head to eat here. But  if you need to know,  it's a salty mess. Prosciutto and carpaccio is up next. Completely void of taste and not coincidently, the highlight of the meal. That's also their specialty so that makes North Beach Restaurant super lame! Then we had the caprese with "burratta". My sister hit the nail on the head, cream poored over mozzarella and a tomato that had seriously just been smuggled right off some dude's jr. bacon cheeseburger. I can't say that one was a winner either. On to the entree. I ordered the special, osso bucco and holy sh#t was it special. A totally rubbery piece of braised, mutant flesh in the most oddly textured sauce I've ever come across in my life. You could almost pick the sauce up with your fingers. Like it wasn't quite a liquid but not quite a solid either. It was school paste dude. Veal shank braised in school paste for $30. Accompanying my shank-in-paste was a cube of broccolini. Seriously, they heated up my frozen cube of broccolini and forgot to de-cube my veg. Dude fluff that sh#t up or something. 

So my appetite is completely non-existent at this point and I'm eating with a large group of people so I'm confined to entertaining myself by coming up with various science experiments I might conduct on my meal.  There were so many questions I had that needed answering. Like how the f#ck do you overcook a vegetable and simultaneously turn it fluorescent green? What shape are those frozen veggies in? Is that a prism of frozen veggies? What species is this shank of meat? Is it in the bird or reptile family? If North Beach restaurant supplied bunsen burners and petri dishes I'm stoked and giving them as many stars as I can get my paws on but unfortunately they sell this sh#t to eat so...

If I could punch a restaurant in the face I would've
author: Jon C.

description: Seriously...if you want to pay top dollar for the rush treatment, this is the place for you.    Dine in complete anonymity because you will hardly be noticed or acknowledged.    A pretentious dining establishment at it's finest.  I will say that the food was very good, but the Safeway unripe tomatoes for the caprese were a bomb and there is no excuse.   If we were in Italy, our treatment would be considered an insult to the family and Lorenzo would be paid a visit.   Niente di speciale
author: Larry S.

description: This restaurant has the best service you can ask for my wife took me and my friends here for my birthday. Even tho me and my friends got a little to loud for a place like this they were very accommodating the waiter was amazing and i had some of the best Italian food in my life here. This place is on the pricey side. Dinner, appetizers and drinks were about 1,200 but for a group of 12 that isn't bad. My apologies to management if we were to loud......
author: Matthew D.

description: Good food, overshadowed by the high prices.  Be careful if they try to push the owners wine, the price tag on it is not worth it!!
author: Rich B.

description: Went to this restaurant recently and had a great dinner experience.  Highly recommend this place.  When we were finished, all the Maitre D's thanked us! Now that's service.
author: Jan G.

description: After reading the reviews, I have decided to write one because I found other customers with the same problem -- an underhanded way of offering wine to the customers. I went with four friends. When it came time to order a bottle of wine, we were going to order a bottle that cost $38, but, instead, we asked it they had a house wine. Now in all of our restauurant experiences, "house wine" is usually cheaper than the other wines offered. The waiter failed to tell us that the Chardonnay house wine would be $55/bottle. When we received the bill, we were surprised to find we had spent $17 more for the house wine. After leaving the restaurant, we were discussing this, and two of us decided to return and talk to someone about it. The man we spoke to said for this restaurant, "house wine" is the wine they serve by the glass, and it's $55/bottle. He said he was so sorry the waiter had failed to tell us this. However, after reading other reviewers' comments who have had similar problems with the wine served, I don't think he was sorry. In fact, I feel this restaurant intentionally and underhandedly omitted telling us that, in fact, the "house wine" would be more expensive. The words "North Beach" bring back many childhood memories to me. I'm a third generation San Franciscan with parents and grandparents who grew up in North Beach. Now as a senior (67 yrs. old), I chose to have lunch at North Beach Restaurant with four friends who are also SF natives. Some in the group have known each other 60 years. I am appalled at the deceitful way this restaurant handled the choice of wine, and I am sorry "North Beach" is part of your restaurant's name. I will never eat at NBR again. There are too many other wonderful choices of restaurants in North Beach whose staffs and policies show more integrity.
author: B M.

description: I have been eating here occasionally since the 70's and I am sorry to say this will be the last time. Expensive, mediocre food.  Gnocchi with pesto was gross, mostly oil and cheese with a tiny bit of basil. Prosciutto with hard melon. Certainly not worth $75 for two, just one appetizer and two entrees and one ($7.50!) bottle of water. So many good places nearby for less.
author: Scott H.

description: On my latest trip to my favorite California city of San Francisco, we decided to try North Beach for dinner in Little Italy.  We had walked by it in the morning on the way to eat breakfast so we looked at the dinner menu and decided to try it out.  I had the mare chiaro (shrimp, tomato, cream sauce over rigatoni pasta) which is very good.  It was $24.00 and I was able to eat the whole thing so you know that portions are somewhat small.  Expect to pay more for what you get but it is good and I did like the atmosphere of the restaurant.  Obviously their rent is VERY HIGH so they have to charge a lot for their food.  It was a little crowded (for a cold Thursday night) so you're sitting really close to other patrons so it was a little louder than other restaurants.  We still enjoyed our meal.  I had the VERY BEST date that night and I was very impressed with the choice of place for dinner that night.  Well done, Babe!  The service was very good.  I definitely recommend coming here at least once to experience great Italian food.  After all, I found my true love in this city, the food was my second love.
author: Sylvia W.

description: a very nice and classy restaurant in the middle in north beach. came here after a show at cobbs. there was nothing wrong with the pasta i ordered, but there was nothing spectacular about it either. and at $20+ a plate, you'd expect more. the drinks were pricey too of course, but we didnt really care. the waiter and the atmosphere made me feel like i was in italy. good place if you're looking for a nice, classy dinner. just make sure to bring a loaded wallet..
author: Andrew T.

description: One of my favorite places! My oyfriend took me there on our first date, and its keeps getting better everytime we go back! The service is amazing!
author: Susan B.

description: A few months ago I made reservations for 5 for outside seating during the Italian Heritage Parade.  The day before the parade our friends cancelled so I called the restaurant to change our seating to 3.  We arrived Sunday by 10:30am as I was instructed to do but now there were only two of us. I let the Maitre d' know this and he changed to 2 (I saw him write it too).  We waited over an hour to be seated in front with full view of the parade..however they did put us in the crosswalk way so had to deal with people bumping our chairs and blocking our view all day.  They also sat another person at our table which was just fine. She was a very nice lady.  She ordered a Chardonnay 3 times before she finally got it an hour later.  We ordered a bottle of Pinot Grigio which came quickly but sat in the sun for over an hour with no ice bucket .. which was promised to us each time a waiter came to our table.  It did finally come when there was only one glass left in the bottle.  We ordered our food. I ordered a Caprese Salad first.  When the salad came they gave each one of us one...I only ordered the one for me not for the table.  DUH! Then the waiter was quite rude about it when I told him I didn't order it.. He said 'you were supposed to be a table of 5'. I tried several times to tell him that reservation was changed and the Matre d' knew that we were only two and that we didn't even know the lady at our table. They refused to bill her separately too.  WHAT?  We ended up having her tab on our bill and had to figure it out for her to pay us.  That's just ridiculous.  They also charged us for two Caprese salads not 3 as delivered...that was wrong...we should only have paid for one since that is what I ordered...one for me!  They also did not come to our table very often and we had to wave each time to find someone to help us.  They had 4-5 waiters on all the tables outside and our waiter, when we did get his attention, kept making it a point to tell us 'how busy he was and they were'.  WHAT?  He again was rude but thought he was funny..NOT! I had to bite my tongue and get through our overpriced lunch so we could leave.  This event happens every year...either you need more staffing during the parade or you limit the customer seating, so your staff you do have, can do their job and BE POLITE!  I will not be eating at this restaurant again and will make sure I do not recommend it to my friends or family.  Next year I'll make sure to get a table at a different restaurant and hopefully they will know how to treat a paying customer no matter their status.  NB Restaurant staff was definitely running around and catering to their longtime wealthy customers and kept us waiting! I tried to get my husband to leave only a 10% tip for the service..but I am sure he didn't do that.  STAY AWAY FROM THIS RESTAURANT unless you care to be treated like poor trash!   Peace
author: Diana C.

description: This place is dressier than you'd think it would be being that it's in SF near Columbus. I was ok in my hoodie sweater b/c my friend was dressed nice enough for the both of us. I guess b/c there was a lot of date action going on there and not too many groups. Anyway, the greeter was fantastico! He set the mood for an awesome time. However, our waiter had a different type of experience in mind. He was a tad impatient and rushed. For instance, he even got kinda pissy when my friend didn't like the wine he was served. The waiter got him another wine but not without huffing off in discontent. Not the experience we were looking for at this joint. I would expect this behavior from a chain like Chili's or Applebee's. And there was no reason for it either, it wasn't busy -- it was a Tuesday night. Moving on, I ordered the (homeade) Ravioli Tuscana. It was ok. The pasta was cooked perfectly but it was wayyyy too salty for me. I think it was salty enough to give the entire state of CA high blood pressure. That said, not really thrilled with my experience however I think I could have had a better experience w/ a different waiter and another dish.
author: Natalie L.

description: I've been eyeing this place ever since I found out it's owner is the same of our favorite and long ago closed Basta Pasta.  We played hooky this week to see the matinee of Wicked, and after finding primo parking decided to try North Beach Restaurant. I looked at the menu outside...pricey, but wanted to taste that linguine con vongole once again. I guess it's not fair to compare as Basta Pasta no longer exists, but I couldn't help it.  although I'm nursing a cold, the food was good, tasted almost the same. But the atmosphere is so different. Very expensive ($16 for a caprese salad with 2 slices of burrata and 2 slices of tomato), and a bit intimidating. Thank goodness we were there for an early dinner, as we were probably underdressed, (after reading other reviews of mayors and other famed patrons). The waitstaff was actually very friendly, (in spite of my Uggs!)  I missed the casual hipness of Basta Pasta...especially their Pantera Pizza with a light tomato sauce and adornment of prosciutto....but I'll probably be back when (my pocket book allows!) and my craving for linguine vongole hits or to compare the Chicken Toscana to our old fav.
author: foxy b.

description: Service was efficient, friendly, and professional ... hand made pasta was delicious, especially the Gnocci and Spinach Tortelini. Classy but comfortable ambience ... perfect for a date. :)
author: Devin P.

description: Had good food here. Burrata salad was tasty, penne vodka outstanding and sabayon good though not worth 12.50. Service by our waiter was outstanding. One star knocked off for Maitre D (Indian man) who told us we could not have the table we wanted (we wanted the well lit table next to the one he asked us to sit at) because another party would be sitting there momentarily. It seemed sketchy to me as the restaurant was (and remained) more than 50% empty. As predicted, no one sat at that table the 1.5 hours we were there. Cmon guys! Don't treat your customers like second class citizens!
author: N R.

description: Was looking forward to taking our daughter for her 30th birthday. We booked reservations for 6. We were unbelieveably dissapointed. The place is a complete dining trap. The waiter came on and advised us that they like to start the dinner with some appetizers which included toasted bread with some tomato, some pate, and some small lobsters. He acted as if this was their complimentary beginning appetizers. We were billed $147.00 for about $30.00 worth of appetizers. The waiter then had the nerve to add a 25% tip to our bill when presented. Our bill was over $600. Of course I called him on it and it was changed. Never have I felt so shaken down in a supposedly fine restaurant. I would avoid at all costs.
author: Don M.

description: DO NOT EAT HERE!! I would like to relay my recent firsthand experience. We went for a birthday dinner for 16 people and sat in the basement in the 'cigar room.' No ambiance. There was a box of cigars in the room which I guess made it a 'cigar room' which was located off of a room with prosciutto hanging from the ceiling. My husband and I were early and ordered a bottle of wine and told the waiter it was for the 2 of us. As more people arrived the waiter opened another bottle of wine WITHOUT ASKING US and offered it to the guests. My husband immediately put a stop to this. We really should have told the manager but did not want to cause a scene at the party. During dinner the same thing happened when another member of the party ordered a bottle of wine except this time the waiter opened SIX BOTTLES of wine WITHOUT ASKING us. I think this is dishonest and we were charged for the the bottles. I will never go back. This place is a trap and they also are dishonest!! There are much better places in San Francisco with much better service. Go go Lupa in Noe Valley instead!!
author: julie q.

description: Oh how the mighty have fallen :( hubby and I went into SF for a romantic getaway. I searched through yelp and saw that this had fallen to 3.5 stars and thought wow no way this used to be fantastic. So we decided to go in and give it a try hoping the reviews were wrong. The bread was tasty but then came the entrees. Hubby's poached halibut tasted and looked as if it was a previously frozen filet from Costco, dry and tasteless and small to boot! My veal piccata was decent, not great, But the worst thing is they served the entrees with breakfast potatoes...come on you're the North Beach Restaurant for goodness sake..breakfast potatoes? I am so sad to give you 2 stars but I could not possibly give you another :/
author: Amy Y.

description: Simply put, this is a great restaurant.  The parents were in town for the weekend and thought a "nice" dinner would be fun.  The decor of the restaurant is clean and elegant, the service impeccable, and the food delicious.  The escargot, as well as the Caesar salad, were amazing.  The veal and prawn entree was done perfectly with a side of steamed spinach and potatoes.  Be sure to make reservations.  Also, they do in fact take credit cards (contrary to the description on this page)
author: Mike F.

description: reasonable prices, great atmosphere.  the person that takes care of the wine is very knowledgeable and polite.  my waiter was funny, i love his sarcasm.  great for dates.
author: Wailun Eugene W.

description: If you want VERY good Italian food in an authentic, reliable North Beach restaurant, North Beach Restaurant is your best bet.  We live within walking distance and this is our second time to eat here.  There are so many menu options and each dish is delectable!  We *LOVE* their veal dishes and I have ordered the Veal Picatta twice now!  My husband orders the chef's specialty- Veal Saltimbocca and it's AWESOME.  We've also ordered one of the pasta dishes which was wonderful and you have plenty of options of all kinds of food here- chicken, pasta, veal, beef, etc.  Their wine list is extensive and highly rated.  Both of Italian reds we've had were great picks for $30-$40/ bottle.  Service is always great and professional.  If you are looking for a great Italian restaurant to take out-of-towners to, this is great choice. Or if you just want great Italian food you won't be let down!  The atmosphere is pretty lively but not too noisy.  We were lucky the last time we went, on a Saturday night, to sit in the wine cellar below and that is a great spot to sit, surrounded by wooden walls full of yummy wine in a truly unique wine cellar room.  This would also be a good spot for group dinners or a birthday dinner, as I noticed many parties eating with 6+ people.  The ONE thing I would *definitely* recommend is reservations on www.opentable.com or by calling restaurant directly.  They are always extremely busy and the wait can easily be 45mins+ on a weekend night.  If you haven't made a reservation, call ahead and ask them to put you on the list if possible.  They are usually pretty accommodating if they have some tables open.  Bone Appetit!
author: JR W.

description: This is my favorite Italian restaurant in San Francisco.  Some people feel it is a tourist spot, but anything in North Beach is, isn't it?  This is a good spot for a date or a group, and the owner Lorenzo  and his staff are friendly.  The Sand dabs are awesome when on the menu and the Spaghetti Lorenzo is always good.  Classy atmosphere and I would recommend to anyone.
author: Glen E.

description: My fiance and I just had dinner at North Beach since it is hyped as "the best italian in SF", but it didn't live up to such a claim.  The minestrone soup was bland.  I had the linguine a la vodka which was good, but way too heavy on the onions and overpriced at $20+ an entree.  The service was very good.  Overall, for the price and the food, I think you can do a lot better elsewhere.
author: kay g.

description: I just moved to SF after 17 years in New York City.   I have to say the Italian food in NY beats this by a mile.  I had family in town and decided to come here after seeing good review on open table and also recommended by friends of friends in SF.  The prices are really high and I don't feel the quality is up to the cost.  I may be a bit spoiled after having amazing Italian restaurants in NYC, but I really expected more tonight.  The service was very good, but the food was lacking.  The only thing that was really great was the penne in vodka sauce. It was actually really good.  I had chicken marsala and it was sweet.. strange..  Others ordered veal parm... pretty good.. and eggplant parm.. have had much better... We had the prosciutto/melon app to start - really good prosciutto, but very small amount for the price.. .we also had the escargot.. i would pass on those..  I don't think I'll be back.. It's just too expensive for what you get... Will have to keep searching for a restaurant that matches up to NYC.  Oh.. we also got cannoli at Stella's afterwards as Yelp listed it as the best in the bay.. I'll pass on that too.. again.. may be spoiled from the cannoli in NY..  will keep looking..
author: Brooke M.

description: Almost every time I go to San Francisco I like to go to the North Beach restaurant, but as far as I am concerned they have had the last of my money.  I took a group of my guys to a nice dinner and basically left feeling as though I had been ROBBED.  I will give you some examples, I ordered a mixed plate of Serrano ham and beef Carpaccio for the table at $16 and received four small slices of ham and about 6 piece of Carpaccio, we also ordered a tomato plate for 11 dollars which had three slices of tomato with a couple of anchovies laying across them with a bit of cheese.  So at that point I was feeling a little non plussed with the appetizers.  My main course was meant to be a heart fish stew Ciopinno, and when it arrived at close to thirty dollars I was disgusted.  It came in this tiny bowl and consisted of 1 mussel 1 clam and three pieces of flaky white fish all covered in what could only be described as about 1 cup of marinara sauce and not a crab leg in site.  I really like Ciopinno and have it at numerous restaurants, the best I have had is at the Dead Fish Restaurant in Crocket CA.  In comparison it is full of Mussels, Clams Crayfish Crab and mountains of Flaky white fish all in a delicious bowl of Marinara which is fantastic to mop up with as much bread as you would like.  But as the dish is described it is an extremely Hearty fish stew.  As for what I received in the North Beach restaurant, I would be embarrassed to serve that to anyone, 1 mussel, 1 clam and three pieces of white fish in Marinara Sauce and they want to call it a hearty fish stew............pathetic.  Our meal with drinks was close to $100 per head and that is without wine, my suggestion to anyone who is thinking about trying this restaurant for the first time would be don't.  Keep your money in your pocket and go somewhere else, in fact spend $100 in a cab and go to the restaurant in Crocket where you can have a delicious Ciopinno and feel as though you have great value and terrific service even with $100 cab fare added to your bill.
author: Nick M.

description: omg!!!!!! it was the worst italian dish i've ever had.  the dishes we ordered was too salty to eat.  i felt they soaked  veals and scallops in salt water and then cooked.  furthermore, we told them that it was too salty and not able to eat, but they totally ignored and told us it was not salty at all!!! the bad customer service!!!!  plus, they had only a few servers and it was not enough for the entire restaurant. the server who was taking care of us told us that he was serving 7 tables at the same time. that's why it was too slow and we had to wait for him during our meal all the time.  i will never go back to the restaurant.  we were very upset and disappointed.  very bad food and customer services...
author: BB K.

description: look, i went there for years and i was a young buck and i mean young! they prababaly never noticed me,i was there with the movers and pushers. so maybe later i start going on myself,they don't remember me(who cares)wow! on a later visit some 'big shot' (owner.brother,relative...)lost control(controllo)&kinda made some  noise my way.just because i made a tiny  request . north beach rest. get food somewhere else. these people act like your at church,your lucky if they let you in and now there going to scrutinize you.then you get judged. oh and if you don't look right or your date doesan't(my expieriance)they are booked!i wonder how many lawsuits...
author: OSEPH E.

description: unbelievable service!!!!!!! i didn't see what i wanted on the menu...'no worries-we will make that for you!!" dinner was amazing. worth every penny!!!!!!!!!!
author: melissa c.

description: Food is great! Been here several times and i've never been let down. Very nice atmosphere, and cool Italian waiters who know their stuff. Great place for a romantic dinner or family dinner. Outdoor seating available on a nice corner of North Beach. Award winning wine selection.
author: John c.

description: I have been to north beach a few times now and have never had anything but good things to say.After reading some of the reviews I wonder where people are eating. Italian at. Having eaten in Italy and a lot of places in the med this is pretty close. Things like the grilled calamari and anti pasti were amazing .Maybe the good dishes are not the main stream items.And the service is a throw back to when your waiter helped you find the right food and drink.I wish more places were like this. To be honest you cant be afraid to spend to get a good meal here.The Petroni wine which is the owners winery is really good as well. The decor is a little dated,but fits the style of food.I am bothered a little by the tourists, but its north beach what can you do.I suggest making a reservation and sit in the back.I have tried most of the menu and really dont have anything to pick on. Just open your horizons and ask the waiter what he would suggest.My favorite is the Abalone or cannelloni .This in not nouveau Italian or a small quiet place for a romantic meal. But quality ingredients and well seasoned food will bring me back.
author: michael s.

description: We started out fine...  The exterior looked nice, the service was friendly all until it became clear we had just dropped by for lunch.  Just lunch.  Not a rafter of appetizers, not a bottle from the owner's winery...  just a few bowls of pasta and a few glasses of red wine.   Then the air changed.  We were, suddenly, annoying.  At the time I had a health condition that made it actually dangerous for me to eat fat -- I asked the waiter which item on the menu had the least fat.  He directed me to the veal, which I really doubt was leanest thing they had.  I ended up ordering the "Lorenzo Pasta" which the menu said was about 300 calories.  Brusqueness ensued.  It started to feel like we were being treated like tourist.  I had this image of waiters high fiving each other in the kitchen when they ring up a big sale.  Maybe ringing a bell when they sell a bottle of the family wine.  (Cappuccino is, after all, for closers.)  On the way home I started having an attack, which made me think the pasta wasn't as healthy as the menu suggests.  People's dietary issues can be serious.  The people who want to make really sure there are no peanuts in their food have a reason.  Sometimes people who ask a lot of questions about fat or sugar aren't just silly dieters who don't know how to live.  I'm not sure that was clear to the guys at this restaurant.
author: Sharif E.

description: I could not believe my last visit here.  My family has been coming here since the mid 70's.  It was always one of the highlights of our summer going and being treated to foods off the menu and a warm family moment.  Now flash forward to the present-  probably my worst dining expirence in some time.  The "House" seems to have cheapened up quite a bit, from the metal legged chairs that I am sure could be seen on a normal day in any auditorium, to the fact that they did not change table cloths at 3 tables around us and I am sure  they did not change ares as well.  We had been in our seats possibly 5-7 minuetes when our drinks showed up- the waiter told us of the specials in an accent that was almost impossible to understand.  We ordered an appetizer special and 2 min. later it was seved.  Then our dinner order was taken.  2 orders of fish and a pasta before, or so we thought.  5 min. later our main course and pasta plate was delivered.  The pesto on the pasta was brown and the plate looked dead.  I will say that the fish was spectacular.  Should be for 38.00.  The waiter then took our plates and asked if we wanted anything else and with a polite "no" was promptly handed the check.  From start to finish the dinner took just short of 50 min.  I believe I have given this review more time and thought than they did.  Too bad Bruno and company will never know how dissappointing this experience was. they have forever lost 2 loyal customers
author: james k.
